  • Hydro Pump: If not using Tera Fairy, Hydro Pump is a reasonable choice that deals massive damage to Hippowdon and Fire-types without risking Draco Meteor.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Not only does Tera Fairy give Salamence an edge against many Dragon-types, but it also pairs extremely well with Intimidate, transforming Salamence into an effective hit-and-run threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel comes in handy against Dragon- and Fairy-types alike, though the added weaknesses to Ground and Fighting make it less effective at taking physical hits with Intimidate.

  • Flying: Air Slash becomes much easier to justify with Tera Flying, and if you're willing to risk it, Hurricane can be used to become almost impossible to wall with Choice Specs.

  • Fire: Tera Fire doesn't offer as much defensive utility, but the powerful STAB attacks come in handy against Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon trades defensive advantages for an extremely powerful Draco Meteor that catches defensive foes like Dondozo by surprise.

Items

  • Choice Specs: With Salamence already standing at a decent Speed tier, it can get away with Choice Specs, making it extremely difficult to wall outside of using Blissey.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf trades wallbreaking power for the ability to get the jump on major offensive threats, such as Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Garchomp.

Physically Offensive.description:
• Salamence is somewhat overshadowed by other physical Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Dragapult, but it has a trick up its claws: Dual Wingbeat, which OHKOes Breloom and Meowscarada through their Focus Sash.

  • Earthquake versus Fire Blast: Earthquake is the best option for hitting Steel-types such as Gholdengo hard, but Fire Blast is Salamence's best shot at 2HKOing Corviknight.

  • Dragon Dance: After a boost, Dual Wingbeat's Focus Sash slaying powers go into overdrive, being able to bust through Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Great Tusk.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, a boosted Dual Wingbeat has a 75% chance to OHKO offensive Mimikyu through its disguise! It also means Salamence no longer needs a boost to OHKO Great Tusk and Flutter Mane.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Tera Blast Salamence OHKO Azumarill and Iron Bundle, and potentially 2HKO Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage.

Abilities

  • Intimidate: While Salamence isn't particularly bulky, Intimidate makes setting up far easier when paired with a Flying Tera type that removes Salamence's common weaknesses.

  • Moxie: With Moxie, Salamence has the potential to seriously punish Breloom leads or snowball through teams even without Dragon Dance.

Mixed Attacker.description:
• Salamence's great mixed offenses, Intimidate, and decent Speed give it a niche as a powerful wall breaker.

  • Dual Wingbeat: Dual Wingbeat lets Salamence OHKO Breloom regardless of its Focus Sash, something very few Pokemon can do.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor deals massive damage to Dondozo, usually doing more than 50% to physically defensive ones.

  • Substitute: Substitute makes the Dondozo match-up even better, making Yawn a non-issue. It's also a good way to scout Terastallization against slower threats.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type covers a lot of Salamence's weaknesses and makes dealing with Mimikyu, Iron Bundle, and Flutter Mane much easier.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Salamence a great match-up against most Dragon-types, and pairs especially well with Intimidate to turn Salamence into a good hit-and-run attacker.

  • Fire: With a Fire Tera type, Salamence gains a resistance to Fairy-type attacks and deals massive damage to Assault Vest Magnezone.

  • Electric: Tera Electric gives Salamence a great tool against Dondozo with Tera Blast.

  • Dragon: While this Tera type fails to help Salamence much defensively, it makes Draco Meteor 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo.

Calm Mind.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 252 HP / 236 Def / 20 Spe with Timid: This outspeeds up to Jolly Dragonite, so Encore and Scale Shot won't be as problematic.

  • 252 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Bold: This physically bulky spread survives Adamant Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash without Terastallization.

Latios.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon is a new addition from the Indigo Disk that happens to be relevant!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive.description:
• Latios's useful array of resistances, fantastic use of Terastallization, and good offenses make it a strong choice for either a wallbreaker with Choice Specs or revenge killer with Choice Scarf!

  • Luster Purge: Despite its low PP and poor offensive coverage, Luster Purge's high chance of dropping Special Defense still makes it a great wallbreaking tool.

  • Flip Turn: While Flip Turn is weak, Latios forces enough switches to make it a reasonable offensive pivot.

  • Trick: Trick gives Choice Scarf Latios an option to nearly shut down defensive Pokemon like Porygon2 and Ting-Lu and situationally lock offensive foes like Dragonite and Chien-Pao into more manageable moves. Choice Specs Latios isn't quite as effective with this, but its it's still worth considering for crippling defensive foes.

  • Shadow Ball VS. Aura Sphere: Shadow Ball is Latios's best move against Gholdengo and will 2HKO most Flutter Mane sets as well. Aura Sphere leaves Latios reliant on Special Defense drops to deal with Gholdengo, but it is a more direct option against common Tera Steel foes like Dragonite and opposing Latios.

Other Options

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam is handy for letting Choice Specs Latios OHKO Assault Vest Landorus-T and deal massive damage to Ting-Lu, though Draco Meteor has more general utility in many cases.

  • Grass Knot: If using Choice Specs, Grass Knot pulls a 2HKO even on Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu, though it being resisted by so many popular Pokemon like Dragonite makes it a risky move to be locked into.

  • Surf: If using Tera Water, Surf is a reasonable coverage option against Steel-types.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt offers good coverage against most Steel-types, but it is a very risky move to be locked into due to Ground-types like Landorus-T and Excadrill.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Latios's typing isn't amazing defensively, but the very useful resistances to Urshifu-R's and Ogerpon-H's STAB moves mean Terastallization isn't always an upgrade. Still, thanks to Levitate, Latios has some effective defensive options to consider.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has superb synergy with Levitate, making Latios an effective offensive check against common foes like Landorus-T and Dragonite while giving Latios great counterplay against Fairy-types like Flutter Mane defensively and offensively with Tera Blast. This also lets Latios tank a Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B, though the Vacuum Wave weakness can be bothersome afterwards.

  • Fire: Tera Fire also gives Latios a vital resistance to Fairy-types while maintaining the resistances against Ogerpon-H's STAB moves and providing a powerful Tera Blast against most Steel-types.

  • Water: Tera Water covers Latios's issue with Ice-type attacks, which can save it in a pinch against Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle, while still retaining an important resistance to Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.

  • Electric: Tera Electric removes all of Latios's weaknesses except from Mold Breaker users with Earthquake like Excadrill and provides a useful paralysis immunity against common status spreaders like Porygon2, Flutter Mane, and Serperior.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a decent alternative to Tera Steel, giving Latios a good option against Dragon-types while still retaining a Fighting-type resistance.

Items

  • Choice Specs VS. Choice Scarf: Choice Specs is preferred on Latios for the excellent wallbreaking potential. Choice Scarf Latios is a reasonable revenge killer, but it still doesn't deal well with Chien-Pao due to the Sucker Punch weakness, making it more reliant on unique qualities like Trick and Levitate to separate itself from other Choice Scarf revenge killers.

  • Soul Dew: While not as effective at breaking walls as Choice Specs, Soul Dew is a reasonable alternative to still take advantage of Luster Purge's Special Defense drops, and it is a great way of getting around Item Clause issues if Latios still needs a power boost.

Minor Optimizations

  • Neutral Nature: It's best to use a neutral nature with a Timid Mint to ensure that Latios can eat any berry without getting confused after using Trick.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Empoleon's fantastic typing and good movepool make it a great choice for a specially defensive Stealth Rock setter.

  • Yawn versus Roar: Yawn has fantastic synergy with Stealth Rock, forcing foes to either take damage or be put to Sleep. Roar is more reliant on Stealth Rock being set up first, but it isn't as vulnerable to common Substitute foes like Iron Bundle.

  • Flash Cannon versus Ice Beam: Flash Cannon is the preferred STAB move for dealing good damage to Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. Ice Beam is still worth considering for dealing far more damage to Landorus-T, Garchomp, and Gliscor though.

  • Flip Turn versus Surf: Flip Turn makes Empoleon a good pivot despite its low damage output, though Surf is still a reasonable alternative for doing good damage against Ground-types.

  • Roost: Despite Empoleon's good defensive profile, Roost can be hard to fit in since it means either giving up support or coverage. Still, it does make Empoleon a better check with Flutter Mane when paired with Flash Cannon.

  • Calm versus Sassy: In addition to making Flip Turn stronger, Sassy's lower Speed can help Empoleon pivot out last. However, Sassy forces a Speed tie with 4 Speed EV Ursaluna-B unless 20 Speed EVs are used. If the power drop isn't an issue, a Calm nature with a Speed IV of 17 can be used to reach the same Speed.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Empoleon's superb typing means Terastallization should only be used to flip certain troublesome match-ups.

  • Flying: Tera Flying floats above common Ground-types such as Landorus-T, Garchomp, and Ursaluna-B, and it additionally grants an important Fighting-type resistance.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a good response against Fighting-types like Urshifu while making Electric-types such as Zapdos and Vikavolt less problematic.

  • Grass: In addition to a Ground-type resistance (though this can be risky against Landorus-T), Tera Grass saves Empoleon from Breloom's Spore.

  • Bug: Bug isn't normally a great defensive type, but the resistances to Fighting and Ground, combined with not being weak to Electric, makes it a viable choice on Empoleon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is the most reliable healing item, especially when getting free turns with Yawn.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's quick burst of recovery is a decent alternative to Leftovers. Make sure to use 244 HP EVs with it so it activates after getting hit by Ting-Lu's Ruination.

  • Air Balloon: Empoleon is an especially effective user of Air Balloon with its offensive advantages against Ground-types, doing especially well against Gliscor thanks to Empoleon's Toxic immunity.

Assault Vest.description:
• Empoleon's vital advantages against Fairy-types and good Special Attack make it a fantastic Assault Vest tank.

  • Surf: Surf is a reliable secondary STAB move that's particularly good against Ursaluna-B.

  • Ice Beam versus Grass Knot: Ice Beam has a multitude of high value targets, such as Dragonite, Garchomp, Landorus-T, and Gliscor. Grass Knot's coverage is less impressive, but it prevents Empoleon from being totally walled by bulky Water-types like Dondozo and Milotic.

  • Flip Turn: Flip Turn will require giving up coverage or priority, but Empoleon is a bulky enough pivot to justify it.

  • Vacuum Wave: While not being a strong priority move, Vacuum Wave is great for picking off weakened threats, especially Chien-Pao.

  • Competitive versus Torrent: Competitive is the most reliable option for checking Flutter Mane, punishing Charm variants and ensuring that Special Attack drops from Moonblast turn into an advantage. Torrent can make some sense with Tera Water though, making Surf very difficult to switch into.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Empoleon relies on its excellent typing to be a great Assault Vest tank, but its lack of recovery means Terastallazation can still be important for flipping certain match-ups.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly improves Empoleon's match-up against common Ground-types like Ursaluna-B and Landorus-T, removing the Earthquake / Earth Power weakness and having a powerful Surf.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a great response against Fighting-types like Urshifu and also lets Empoleon tank Electric-types like Zapdos and Vikavolt more reliably.

  • Flying: Tera Flying's Ground-type immunity is perfect for saving it from sweepers like Garchomp and Landorus-T, and it additionally removes grievances with Dondozo's Fissure.

  • Grass: Tera Grass protects Empoleon from Breloom's Spore and makes Grass Knot more desirable.

Floatzel.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Swift Weasel.description:
• Wave Crash: This is your main offensive option. When further boosted by rain, Tera Water, and Choice Band, it becomes one of the most powerful physical moves in the game, 2HKOing the likes of Bold Amoonguss and OHKOing maximum Defense Corviknight. Mystic Water is an option for flexibility but sacrifices the listed KOs.

  • Liquidation versus Waterfall: Liquidation is a secondary option, and it's preferred when facing frailer offensive teams due to the significant recoil drawback of Wave Crash. However, Waterfall is worth considering for its possible flinch chance.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet allows Floatzel to maintain offensive presence outside of rain, as well as being a great response to opposing priority moves, such as Kingambit's Sucker Punch.

  • Rain Setter: Pelipper's rain is mandatory for both Swift Swim and maximum damage output.

Tera Types

  • Water: Tera Water massively bolters Floatzel's damage output, and the weasel simply doesn't have the bulk needed for more defensive options.

EV Spreads

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 196 Spe:196 Speed EVs are used to outspeed the entire tier in rain, including Choice Scarf Dragpault.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximum Speed investment outspeeds Hydreigon and Mimikyu outside of rain, in addition to tying with Salamence, at the cost of having less buffer HP for Wave Crash recoil.

Garchomp.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sweeper.description:
• Thanks to its good bulk, unique Speed tier, and excellent use of Terastallization, Garchomp is a solid offensive threat.

  • Scale Shot: While the Defense drop is troublesome against priority users like Chien-Pao, the Speed boost makes Garchomp far more difficult to revenge kill overall.

  • Iron Head: While Iron Head only deals 10 extra base power of damage against Fairy-types, it works great with Tera Steel and lets Garchomp get past Tera Fairy Levitate Pokemon like Latias.

Other Options

  • Stealth Rock: Despite the offensive nature of this set, Garchomp is still a great setter of Stealth Rock, especially when using Focus Sash.

  • Fire Fang: If your team is extremely weak against Tera Steel Latias or the rare Corviknight or Skarmory, Fire Fang is the only way past them without Terastallization.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / Low: While Garchomp isn't slow, it's typing leaves it very vulnerable to major speedy threats like Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Iron Bundle, which is an issue Terastallization can flip on its head. If using Focus Sash, Terastallization becomes far less needed.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type has excellent synergy with Garchomp's typing, letting it more effectively tackle faster Dragon-types, Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, Mimikyu, and Normal-type priority from Dragonite, Entei, and Ogerpon-H.

  • Fire: While the Stealth Rock weakness is unfortunate against bulkier teams, a Fire Tera type still gives out a vital Fairy and Ice resistance, and gives a powerful Tera Blast against levitating Tera Steel Pokemon like Latias.

  • Fairy: Fairy is an even stronger option against Dragon-types, and gives Garchomp a better matchup against Urshifu-S.

  • Water: Tera Water not only gives that sweet Ice resistance to Garchomp, but it makes Choice Scarf Urshifu-R regret ever using Surging Strikes thanks to Rough Skin!

Items

  • Loaded Dice: Loaded Dice keeps Scale Shot at its most reliable damage output, making it the ideal tool for sweeping.

  • Focus Sash: Surviving shocking attacks with Focus Sash gives Garchomp new sweeping and revenge killing potential, and makes it a reliable setter of Stealth Rock if needed.

  • Life Orb: If used with Tera Steel and Iron Head, Life Orb's damage boost can potentially push Garchomp past the dreaded Charm Flutter Mane with a 2HKO even after the Attack drop!

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Garchomp deal with major Yawn users more easily, such as Swampert and Hippowdon.

Entry Hazard Setter.description:
• While Garchomp is known for its offensive prowess, its access to incredible tools like Rough Skin, Dragon Tail, and a good Speed stat make it a viable alternative to Archaludon and Ting-Lu for setting entry hazards and phazing.

  • Dragon Tail: Dragon Tail has marvelous synergy with setting up hazards, making it the prime choice for a Dragon-type STAB despite the lowered priority.

  • Rock Tomb: Garchomp's solid speed tier means it can fully take advantage of the Speed drops Rock Tomb provides itself, not just as support for teammates.

  • Substitute: Substitute severely punishes foes that rely on Yawn like Hippowdon and Swampert.

  • Iron Head: Beyond pairing well with Tera Steel, Iron Head prevents Garchomp from being walled by Tera Fairy Latios and Latias.

  • Spikes: thanks to its Speed and Dragon Tail, Garchomp is arguably one of the few viable Spikes setters in the metagame! Just make sure using it is worth the cost of losing coverage for the team.

Other Options

  • Bulldoze: Rock Tomb is a good alternative speed control option over Rock Tomb for its higher reliability and STAB, but it can make Garchomp rather passive.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: This Garchomp's bulk means it can set up hazards against a wide variety of foes, but Terastallization will be needed to take on some major physical threats, such as Chien-Pao, Urshifu formes, and

  • Water: Tera Water gives Garchomp a vital Ice and Steel resistance without making it weak to Fighting, making it a fantastic option against Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type provides Garchomp with an immunity to Dragon-type attacks, making Dragonite less of an awkward guessing game and a solid check to Urshifu-S.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type makes Garchomp resist Dragon-, Ice- and Fairy-type attacks, making it a safer lead against opposing Dragon-type leads and Iron Bundle, at the cost of being vulnerable to Ursaluna-B and Urshifu formes.

EV spreads

  • 252 HP / 244 Def / 12 Spe with Impish: This simple looking EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash when Garchomp has Terastallized, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom and the rare Timid Magnezone.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 Spe with Jolly: While this spread doesn't take physical hits as well, it lets Garchomp outspeed Modest Chi-Yu and Adamant Urshifu formes.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Combined with Rough Skin, Rocky Helmet severely punishes contact moves, with Choice Scarf Urshifu-R in particular being a big target.

  • Sitrus Berry: This prevents Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R from 2HKOing Impish Garchomp.

  • Red Card: With Red Card, Garchomp will be able to phaze foes Terastallizing into a Fairy type once, like Archaludon.

All-Out Attacker.description:
• Garchomp's fantastic Speed tier and power means it doesn't have to set up to be dangerous.

  • Scale Shot: Choice Band appreciates the Speed boost, giving Garchomp another option for late-game cleaning. Even on Choice Scarf sets, Scale Shot is a less risky Dragon-type attack over Outrage, and outspeeding extremely fast threats like Booster Energy Iron Bundle is welcome.

  • Iron Head: With Tera Steel, Iron Head lets Choice Band Garchomp 2HKO Charm Flutter Mane, who can otherwise edge out a victory with Pain Split and repeated Attack drops.

  • Stone Edge versus Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb is fairly weak, but the speed control can be very useful on Choice Scarf variants if sacrificing Garchomp. Stone Edge deals massive damage to common Tera Flying Pokemon such as Gholdengo, and it prevents it from being walled by Tera Fairy Levitate Pokemon like Latias.

Other Options

  • Fire Fang While weak, this is Garchomp's best option against Corviknight and Tera Steel Latiias when not Tera Fire.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / Low: When using the slower Choice Band variants, Terastallization becomes important for avoiding revenge kills. If using Choice Scarf Garchomp, it's fully capable of revenge killing threats without needing Terastallization, only worrying about Ice Shard from Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a fantastic defensive Tera Type for Garchomp with key resistances to Ice and Fairy, and it makes Iron Head a much more powerful option.

  • Fire: When combined with Tera Blast, Tera Fire lets even Choice Scarf Garchomp 2HKO Tera Steel Latias. The Fairy and Ice resistance is also very helpful.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy goes all in on the Dragon immunity, no longer being worried about common Fire and Ground coverage from other Dragon-types like Dragonite.

  • Ground: The incredible power boost Earthquake gets from Tera Ground is worth considering, with Choice Band possibly 2HKOing physically defensive Porygon2 and Dondozo with it.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band trades revenge killing for wallbreaking, letting Garchomp deal massive damage to Porygon2 and Ursaluna-B with Outrage.

  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Garchomp is able to revenge kill several other major Choice Scarf users, such as Gholdengo, Landorus-T, and Chi-Yu.

Extreme Speed.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Special Attacker.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Hippowdon.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Hippowdon remains a solid Stealth Rock setter, distinguishing itself from Ting-Lu with access to Yawn and consistent recovery.

  • Sand Stream: The passive damage caused from Sandstorm is excellent for breaking Focus Sashes and Multiscale on Dragonite, but be careful as the same applies to your own team if Hippowdon leaves the field prematurely.

  • Whirlwind: This is a more direct phazing option than Yawn, and it is helpful against dangerous setup sweepers that may run Lum Berry, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Slack Off: Slack Off greatly increases Hippowdon’s longevity and is useful if you need it to repeatedly switch into physical attackers like Dragonite, but Hippowdon is often more focused on support than walling, so it isn’t always worth sacrificing a moveslot.

Other Options

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb not only provides helpful speed control, but also pops Air Balloon on foes Hippowdon would otherwise struggle with, such as Gholdengo.

  • Fissure: Hippowdon isn't quite as good at using Fissure as Dondozo and Garganacl, and it can be difficult to fit in, but it does severely punish passive play.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Hippowdon’s typing and immense bulk already make it very difficult to dislodge, but Tera is an option if needing to cushion off some of the most powerful sweepers the meta has on offer.

  • Water: Tera Water improves the lead matchup with Chien-Pao by resisting Icicle Crash, and overall is a strong defensive type that still takes good advantage of Hippowdon’s imposing bulk.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives several key resistances and allows specially defensive Hippowdon to avoid a 2HKO from Iron Bundle that lack Choice Specs. It’s also notable for letting Hippowdon retain immunity to its own Sandstorm chip.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry’s burst recovery is what allows properly invested Hippowdon to avoid 2HKO’s from some of the meta’s strongest attackers.

  • Leftovers: If Hippowdon is able to execute an extended Yawn loop, Leftovers passive recovery is a great boon. Such loops can often force the opponent to sacrifice something to sleep to prevent Hippowdon from healing up to full.

  • Rocky Helmet: While Hippowdon’s support focus makes this a less common item choice, Slack Off combined with smart usage of Terastallization can make this item work to surprising effect.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: Patching up Hippowdon's weaker Special Defense is extremely useful against special attackers. With this maximized spread, Hippowdon has a 6.3% chance of surviving Timid Gholdengo's +2 Make It Rain, always survives Modest Chi-Yu’s unboosted Overheat, and avoids the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane’s Moonblast if using Sitrus Berry.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish: A physically defensive spread means not even Choice Band Dragonite’s Outrage will be able to 2HKO Sitrus Berry Hippowdon.

Magnezone.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Pivot.description:
• Magnezone stands out as one of the best pivots in the metagame, having the tools to deal with dangerous threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Dondozo, and Corviknight.

  • Mirror Coat: If using Sturdy, Mirror Coat can get a shocking KO on powerful Special Attackers that Magnezone struggles to KO, such as Chi-Yu and Iron Moth.

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is insanely powerful if sacrificing Magnezone's life is worth it.

Tera Types

  • Water: Offensively, Water Tera Blast nails Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon. It also gives Magnezone a much-appreciated Fire resistance for Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, Skeledirge, and Volcarona, and lets Magnezone take on Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump.

  • Flying: Flying has wonderful defensive synergy with Magnezone, reversing its Ground and Fighting weaknesses, and lets Tera Blast hit Grass-types harder.

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera Blast is very useful against common Dragon-types, most notably Garchomp and Roaring Moon, and hitting bulky Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, and Umbreon hard.

  • Fighting: Gaining a resistance to Dark allows Magnezone to surprise and defeat Kingambit, Roaring Moon, and Hydreigon, in addition to dealing plenty of damage to Ting-Lu.

  • Grass: Grass has excellent defensive and offense synergy with Magnezone, especially through its utility against Ground-type attackers and Spore immunity. Most notably, Tera Blast Grass can OHKO max SpD Hippowdon with Choice Specs.

  • Steel: The boost from Tera Steel makes Steel Beam absurdly powerful, with Analytic letting Choice Specs Magnezone OHKO even offensive Multiscale Dragonite!

  • Ground: Tera Ground helps against opposing Magnezone, OHKOs Iron Moth, and deals good damage against Gholdengo and Kingambit.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe with Modest: Magnezone's excellent typing means investing in bulk is a great idea. However, note that some important targets such as Corviknight and Skeledirge are a tad faster than it.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: With maximum Special Defense investment and Assault Vest, Magnezone becomes a good soft check against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, and one of the best pivots in the metagame.

  • 252 HP / 76 SpA / 180 Spe with Modest: While this spread sacrifices a large amount of power, in exchange it outspeeds Adamant maximum Speed Kingambit, who can threaten to deal massive damage otherwise.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: If using Sturdy, Magnezone can run maximum Speed to outspeed unexpected foes, such as Specially Defensive Annihilape.

Items

  • Assault Vest: The increase in special bulk helps Magnezone against the myriad of Choice item special attacking Dragon-types, like Hydreigon and Dragapult. If using Calm, Magnezone can even take on Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle!

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs gives Magnezone a devastating amount of power, with even Clodsire having trouble handling it.

  • Air Balloon: The temporary Ground-type immunity helps Magnezone against foes like Garchomp and Dragonite without Terastallizing.

Abilities

  • Analytic: A Magnezone boosted by both Choice Specs and Analytic is incredibly hard to switch into, making it easier for Magnezone to generate momentum.

  • Sturdy: With Sturdy's guaranteed survivability and Magnezone's high damage output, Magnezone will very likely take down at least one Pokemon per game. Sturdy also helps Magnezone play around Dondozo, as it can safely come in on Fissure and use Volt Switch against it, which renders Yawn moot. However, if Magnezone switches into a Yawn and not Fissure, it should be noted that Dondozo often runs Protect to block Volt Switch and ensure Magnezone falls asleep.

Glis.description:
• With its great typing and incredible longevity thanks to Poison Heal, Gliscor is a frustratingly potent defensive threat in Regulation E.

  • Toxic: Gliscor is one of few Pokemon to be given Toxic via TM, allowing it to put opposing walls on a timer while it stays healthy itself.

  • Protect + Substitute: Stalling turns with Protect + Substitute allows Gliscor to keep itself healthy despite not having access to a manual healing move. This also pairs well with Toxic to keep Gliscor safe as the opponent succumbs to poison.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake allows Gliscor to threaten Steel- and Poison-types that are otherwise immune to its Toxic-stalling antics.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: Knock Off’s item removal can allow Gliscor to be more of a team player, removing items such as Leftovers and Rocky Helmet to assist a teammate’s sweep.

  • Baton Pass: Gliscor’s immense longevity makes it particularly well suited to passing Substitutes, bolstering its team’s defense while giving them turns to set up.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 180 Def / 76 Spe with Impish: This Spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom while maintaining good physical bulk.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe With with: Maximizing Speed allows Gliscor to be more of a nuisance against faster-paced teams at the cost of some survivability.

Tera Types

  • Water: Tera Water gives Gliscor crucial Ice- and Water-type resistances, allowing it to get emergency Toxics off against threats like Baxcalibur and Urshifu-R.

  • Steel: Tera Steel allows Gliscor to resist Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-type moves, giving it increased survivability against a wider array of threats, but Steel leaves it more vulnerable to Fighting-types like Urshifu and Fire-types like Ogerpon-H.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Gliscor a Dragon immunity, allowing it to stand in the way of threats like Garchomp and Baxcalibur, and block attempts to bypass Substitute with Scale Shot while maintaining its Fighting-type resistance for Urshifu.

All-out Attacker.description:
• With its wide range of moveset options and its offense-boosting ability Sharpness, Gallade is excellent at dueling a wide variety of threats.

  • Shadow Sneak versus Feint: Shadow Sneak is far more consistent as a priority move and deals good damage to targets like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. Feint is used mostly for winning Focus Sash duels against Chien-Pao's Ice Shard and Sucker Punch.

  • Night Slash versus Knock Off: Night Slash's consistent power is best for pure offense, potentially 2HKOing targets like Bold Gholdengo, assuming they can't stall with Recover and Rocky Helmet. If more utility is desired, Knock Off can be used for removing opposing items.

  • Leaf Blade: Fully invested Sharpness Leaf Blade has a 75% chance of OHKOing 252 HP Azumarill and is Gallade's best hope of muscling past Dondozo.

Other Options

  • Aqua Cutter: Aqua Cutter benefits from Sharpness, but it doesn't add a lot of extra coverage.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Gallade uses Focus Sash or Assault Vest as its main tool for cushioning a big hit and has great natural coverage. Therefore, Tera is reserved mostly for emergency situations.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost's immunity to Normal- and Fighting-type moves can thwart revenge kill attempts from Mach Punch users and Extreme Speed Dragonite, giving Gallade an opportunity to break Multiscale on the latter.

  • Grass: Tera Grass improves the lead matchup versus Breloom; if Gallade successfully baits a Spore, most sets can beat Breloom without losing Focus Sash. Leaf Blade also becomes an easy 2HKO on Dondozo.

  • Steel: Tera Steel flips Gallade's weakness to Fairy-type attacks to a resistance. The Ice resistance can also be used in a pinch to keep Baxcalibur's Icicle Spear from OHKOing Gallade through Focus Sash.

Items

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Gallade duels opposing Focus Sash users with its hard-hitting STAB attacks and priority moves.

  • Assault Vest: Gallade has enough Special Defense to make good use of Assault Vest if Focus Sash is already taken, comfortably surviving unboosted hits from targets like Chi-Yu. Furthermore, Assault Vest isn't rendered useless by Stealth Rock chip, making Gallade a safer mid- or late-game option.

  • Scope Lens: While Scope Lens is risky due to Gallade's average bulk and Speed, it pairs well with the increased critical hit ratio many of Gallade's attacks have.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Adamant: A maximum offense spread is standard for Focus Sash and Speed ties with offensive Adamant Dragonite.

  • 196 HP / 252 Atk / 60 Spe with Adamant: For sets that run Assault Vest over Focus Sash, this slower spread avoids the OHKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash after Stealth Rock damage. The Speed investment gets the jump on 4 Speed Rotom formes, letting Gallade deal as much damage as possible before getting hit with a burn.

Choice Scarf.description:
• With both Trick and Knock Off, Gallade is a decent anti-lead against several early-game setups.

  • Trick: Trick with Choice Scarf lets Gallade permanently cripple setup Pokemon like Annihilape and Garganacl.

  • Knock Off versus Night Slash: Knock Off remains a strong disruption move with or without Trick, provided you exercise caution if you've already used Trick. Night Slash has more offensive presence than Knock Off and is a good choice if you really need to hit Gholdengo with consistent damage.

  • Leaf Blade: Leaf Blade is a great coverage option and, if Trick isn't available, your best move against Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Choice Scarf Gallade normally isn't a strong user of Tera. It is best used in situations where Gallade already has momentum and needs to preserve it.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost grants immunity to Mach Punch and Extreme Speed, letting Gallade keep its speed advantage against several targets.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can surprise Spore users like Breloom, letting Gallade score an easy KO or cripple them with Trick. Leaf Blade also becomes a 2HKO against Dondozo.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a no-nonsense option for making Sacred Sword hit harder.

  • Psychic: Tera Psychic boosts Psycho Cut while removing Gallade's Fairy weakness.

Rotom-Heat.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Rotom-H sets itself apart from other Fire-types, with its Ground immunity and Volt Switch pivoting. When compared to Rotom-W, it is also much more effective at pressuring Flutter Mane, Gholdengo and Wo-Chien.

  • Trick: Trick gives Rotom-H an excellent tool against defensive foes, such as Dondozo and Skeledirge.

  • Using a neutral nature with a Timid mint: Make sure to get a Rotom-H with a neutral nature and then use a Timid Mint on it. This way, it can't be confused by any Berries given with Trick.

Other Options

  • Discharge: While weaker than Thunderbolt, the 30% paralysis chance can be devastating for some of Rotom-H's more troublesome matchups, such as Chi-Yu. Do note though that Choice Scarf Rotom-H will have a much harder time 2HKOing Assault Vest Azumarill and certain variants of Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: If not running Tera Blast, Rotom-H normally wants to keep its unique typing for defensive purposes, allowing it to switch into several key threats. The most common exception to this is sets that run Tera Fairy for Dragon-type matchups.

  • Electric: Electric is an easy Tera type to recommend, as it increases damage output and removes all of Rotom-H's weaknesses.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera typing with Tera Blast makes Rotom-H much better equipped to handle normally problematic Dragon-types, such as Garchomp, Roaring Moon, and Dragapult.

  • Fire: When paired with Tera Blast, Rotom-H now has a much more reliable Fire-type STAB move than Overheat, but at the cost of retaining all of its normal weaknesses.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-H outspeed normally problematic threats such as Iron Bundle.

  • Choice Specs: The extra power makes Rotom-H far more difficult to wall, with defensive Skeledirge getting 2HKOed by Thunderbolt.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Rotom-W's defensive set might be the more known one, but Rotom-H's key resistances to Fairy-type attacks and U-turn, plus its ability to put serious pressure on Gholdengo, make it a good alternative as a bulky pivot.

  • Foul Play: Foul Play is a must-have, as otherwise, Rotom-H is extremely passive against Baxcalibur, which is likely to switch in for an Attack boost from Overheat.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Thunder Wave: Will-O-Wisp is the preferred status move, potentially shutting down major physical threats such as Dragonite, Mimikyu, and Iron Hands. Thunder Wave is still a reasonable choice, though, stopping special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Iron Moth in their tracks.

  • Trick and Flame Orb: This one-use method of burning may seem silly, but taking away important items can be devastating against certain Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, and Rotom-H can use this to get rid of troublesome Choice items if it's taken a Trick as well. Note that Rotom-H will burn itself if it Terastallizes while holding Flame Orb, which is generally not good outside of blocking sleep or Toxic poison.

  • Using a Neutral Nature with a Bold Mint: If using Trick, it's best to run a neutral nature such as Serious and change the stat boosts with a Bold Mint. This way, Rotom-H won't get confused by any Berry it receives.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Rotom-H's defensive typing is very valuable, so Tera is normally reserved for very specific situations.

  • Steel: Tera Steel with Levitate is a sublime defensive typing, letting Rotom-H better handle huge threats like Dragonite, Garchomp, and Baxcalibur.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is an alternative option to soak up Dragon-type attacks, and it also gives Rotom-H a better matchup against Great Tusk and Iron Hands.

  • Ghost: While this unfortunately makes Gholdengo a much bigger issue, Tera Ghost is still worth considering for making Rotom-H immune to Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Iron Valiant's Close Combat. It also lets Rotom-H switch out of trapping moves without using Volt Switch.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is Rotom-H's ticket to staying around the longest, usually avoiding 2HKOs from powerful unboosted attacks such as Dragonite's Outrage and Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rotom-H's typing makes it a good user of Rocky Helmet, passively punishing physical Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Iron Valiant and making it a good response to expected uses of U-turn.

Rotom-Wash.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• Rotom-W's Speed access to Volt Switch and great typing make it an excellent pivot and revenge killer.

  • Trick and Neutral Natures: If using a Choice item, Trick is seriously worth considering for its ability to cripple defensive Pokemon such as Garganacl and Dondozo. Make sure Rotom-W is a neutral nature that has had a Timid Mint used on it. This way, Rotom-W can eat any Berry without getting confused.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Rotom-W's excellent typing means its fully functional without Terastallizing, but thanks to Levitate, it's still a powerful user of it.

  • Fairy: When combined with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type lets Rotom-W take on Chien-Pao Dragon-types such as Dragapult and Roaring Moon far more effectively.

  • Electric: Not only does the damage boost from Tera Electric come in handy, but it also removes any weaknesses Rotom-W has.

  • Ghost: Terastallizing back to its Ghost-type roots gives Rotom-W a vast array of immunities, helping against Dragonite and Great Tusk in particular. It also makes Shadow Ball viable for picking off Ghost-types with Choice Scarf.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs tends to be safer to Trick than Choice Scarf, and it gives a big power boost.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-W outspeed major threats such as Iron Bundle, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao.

  • Assault Vest: Increasing Rotom-W's special bulk gives it a far better matchup against foes like Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, Iron Bundle, and Gholdengo.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: This spread sacrifices Rotom-W's revenge killing potential, but, in exchange, it makes it a better pivot, and the better bulk makes Rotom-W more suited to finding the right time to cripple a wall with Trick.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Maximizing Rotom-W's Special Attack is part of what makes it an effective revenge killer if using a Choice Scarf.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 108 SpA / 140 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: This spread is meant for Assault Vest, letting Rotom-W avoid a 3HKO from Modest Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Levitate and excellent status moves make Rotom-W a clean choice for a bulky pivot!

  • Foul Play: Foul Play is essential for hitting Baxcalibur hard, since it's immunity to burns would otherwise let it set up on Rotom-W.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Thunder Wave: Will-O-Wisp's ability to cripple top-tier physically offensive threats such as Dragonite, Chien-Pao, and Scizor as well as punish the otherwise problematic Iron Hands makes it the best support option. However, Thunder Wave does provide additional insurance against Baxcalibur and punishes special attackers such as Flutter Mane.

  • Hydro Pump: Hydro Pump gives Rotom-W offensive presence against foes that don't care about the rest of the moveset, like Garganacl, Chi-Yu, Volcarona, and Skeledirge.

Other Options

  • Discharge: Giving Rotom-W an Electric STAB attack to better deal with Flying-types like Corviknight and Tera Flying Roaring Moon is useful, but it can be tricky to fit into the set.

  • Hex: If using Tera Ghost, Hex gives Rotom-W a much fiercer offensive kick than usual after inflicting status.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Defensive Rotom-W works fine without Terastallizing, but some Tera types do make it harder to break through.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Rotom-W an incredible defensive typing, vastly improving its matchups against Pokemon that rely on Ground-type coverage such as Dragonite, Baxcalibur, and Garchomp. It also provides a useful Freeze-Dry resistance against Iron Bundle.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy guards against fearsome powerful Dark, Dragon, and Fighting attacks that Rotom-W can have trouble handling and lets it use Tera Blast to hit Dragonite and Chien-Pao hard.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost offers Rotom-W a vast array of immunities with Levitate, enabling it to defeat certain Dragonite sets and do much better against Iron Hands and Iron Valiant when Rotom-W lacks Will-O-Wisp. Being a Ghost-type also prevents Rotom-W from getting trapped, letting it escape faster trappers without Volt Switch.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry will turn many powerful, unboosted attacks such as Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Crunch, Dragonite's Outrage and Baxcalibur's Glaive Rush into 3HKOs. Just make sure to run an even HP stat so that Sitrus Berry activates with one use of Ruination.

  • Leftovers: If Sitrus Berry is already in use, Leftovers is a reasonable alternative.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet's extra chip damage can make Rotom-W a less passive pivot.

Nasty Plot.description:
• With a great typing, ability, and good bulk, Rotom-W makes for an effective user of Nasty Plot.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: This move is essential for getting past Dragon-types like Dragapult and Roaring Moon. Even when not Terastallized, it's a decent coverage move.

  • Hydro Pump versus Substitute: Hydro Pump is by far Rotom-W's strongest STAB, but it can be worth sacrificing for Substitute, which lets Rotom-W effectively defeat most Garganacl and defensive Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While this Rotom-W can sweep on its own, Terastallization can prevent revenge kills from the likes of Iron Bundle.
  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Rotom-W can turn the tables on its Dragon-type adversaries, as well as catch Crunch Chien-Pao off guard.

Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Rotom-W easily set up on Hippowdon, and avoid getting put to sleep by Dondozo.

  • Sitrus Berry: If Sleep isn't a big issue, Rotom-W appreciates the burst recovery Sitrus Berry provides. Make sure to run an even HP stat so it activates after Rotom-W gets hit by Ruination once.

  • Covert Cloak: If using Hydro Pump, this is Rotom-W's best way around Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: Maximizing Speed with a Timid nature gives Rotom-W the jump on Gholdengo. If Gholdengo isn't an issue, a Modest nature will still outspeed Jolly Breloom.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: Rotom-W's good bulk can be maximized instead of outspeeding Breloom; this spread avoids the 2HKO from Timid Gholdengo's Shadow Ball.

  • 244 HP / 180 Def / 84 SpA with Bold: This Sitrus Berry optimized spread avoids a 2HKO from Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao and Timid Flutter Mane.

Cresselia.overview:
This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

For more information on Battle Stadium Singles, visit the format page!

Serene Queen (Calm Mind).description:
• With its great bulk and the advent of Terastallization, Cresselia is a formidable defensive presence with the ability to take over late in the game.

  • Calm Mind: Calm Mind allows Cresselia to bolster its defensive profile while also increasing its damage output.

  • Moonblast: While lacking STAB, Moonblast has no immunities, which makes it Cresselia’s most reliable offensive move.

  • Stored Power: While blanked by Dark-types, Stored Power allows Cresselia to threaten walls like Unaware Dondozo and more reliably win Calm Mind wars against foes like Flutter Mane. It also allows Cresselia to potentially beat Heatran with sheer power should it accrue enough boosts.

  • Thunderbolt - Thunderbolt allows Cresselia to immediately threaten Urshifu-R and is a great general attacking move if used with an Electric Tera.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam allows Cresselia to immediately threaten the many Ice weak Pokémon in the metagame, such as Dragonite, Landorus-T, and Ting-Lu

Other Options

  • Substitute: While difficult to fit, Substitute can protect Cresselia from debilitating status from the likes of Dondozo and Clodsire, giving it a wider reach against slower paced teams without relying on Covert Cloak as much.

  • Lunar Dance: While seemingly odd on a defensive set, Lunar Dance allows Cresselia to bring back a battered teammate in the event it itself cannot finish the game, giving formidable partners such as Chien-Pao and Ursaluna a second chance to break down the opponent.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak guards Cresselia from adverse effects such as flinches and Defense drops that would otherwise impede its ability to take over the endgame. It also negates the passive damage from Garganacl’s Salt Cure, allowing Cresselia to heavily punish it.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers’s passive recovery allows Cresselia to better conserve its limited Moonlight PP, more safely set up against powerful attackers like Flutter Mane, and be a more active presence on the field by not mandating it use a turn to heal off every hit it takes manually.

Tera Types

  • Electric-type: Thanks to Levitate, Tera Electric grants Cresselia a complete lack of weaknesses, giving it an extremely diverse defensive profile courtesy of its immense bulk. It also guards against paralysis, minimizing the chance of an ill-timed lost turn ruining a sweep.

  • Poison-type: Tera Poison protects Cresselia against Toxic, allowing it to more safely set up against Pokémon like Clodsire. It also grants security against even Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane by allowing Cresselia to resist Fairy.

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy grants Cresselia a crucial resistance to Dark, allowing it to better take on foes like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu.

Serperior.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon is a new addition from the Indigo Disk that happens to be relevant!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Regal Attacker.description:
• With STAB Leaf Storm paired with its incredible ability in Contrary, Serperior is a formidable wallbreaker and potential sweeper.

  • Leaf Storm: Thanks to Contrary, Leaf Storm will boost Serperior’s Special Attack by two stages, rather than lowering it, allowing Serperior to become more of a threat simply by attacking.

  • Glare: Glare allows Serperior to spread paralysis with 100% consistency, even to Ground-types, giving it a unique niche as a paralysis spreader unperturbed by the likes of Landorus-T.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast provides Serperior with coverage for its poor matchups, depending on its Tera Type.

  • Substitute: When paired with Glare, Substitute allows Serperior to take advantage of the potential free turns afforded by paralysis to become even more of a threat and dodge debilitating status from the likes of Porygon2 and Dondozo.

Other Options

  • Dragon Pulse: Dragon Pulse is difficult to fit in, but it allows Serperior to threaten foes like Dragonite without relying on Terastallization.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers grants Serperior passive recovery, allowing it to spam Glare more often and make successful Substitute attempts even more punishing.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash enables Serperior to get successful Glares off against faster foes, such as Choice Scarf Chi-Yu.

  • Sitrus Berry: If Leftovers is being used by another team member, Sitrus Berry is a decent alternative.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 180 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread optimizes Serperior’s HP value for use of Leftovers, while maintaining maximum Speed to spam Glare.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Tera Fire allows Serperior to resist opposing Fire-type attacks, as well as Scizor’s Bullet Punch, and grants it coverage against other Grass-types.

  • Rock: Tera Rock enables Serperior to more consistently threaten Fire-types and Flying-types and resist their attacks.

  • Stellar: Stellar Tera grants Serperior perfect neutral coverage, as well as another way to boost its Special Attack with Stellar Tera Blast. This is a purely offensive Tera type and provides Serperior with no defensive utility; however, it is arguably the best choice for maximizing overall damage output.

Defensive.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread: This spread lets Serperior outspeed Jolly Urshifu formes.

Dual Screens.description: • This set's write-up has not started yet.

Amoonguss.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Pivot.description:
• Amoonguss has a great defensive profile compared to most other Toxic Spikes absorbers, and this set can help it even further with a slow switch to another teammate once per game.

  • Pivoting with Leaf Storm: After using Leaf Storm, Eject Pack activates and Amoonguss is switched out; however, it can also be activated by other stat drops, such as Intimidate and Special Defense drops from Shadow Ball.

  • Sludge Bomb versus Clear Smog: Sludge Bomb is preferred for breaking Tera Fairy Wo-Chien's Substitutes and dealing good chip damage against Chi-Yu, but Clear Smog does a great job of clearing boosts from bulky sweepers such as Palafin-H.

  • Bold versus Relaxed: Using Relaxed with a Speed IV of 0 gives Amoonguss the slowest possible pivoting, mostly against mirror matches. However, if both are Terastallized, this means the slower Amoonguss could get hit by Spore, and Amoonguss is already slower than the vast majority of the metagame with Bold.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Amoonguss has a good defensive typing, it'll need Terastallization to deal with some top tier threats like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Amoonguss a key resistance to Ice- and Fire-type attacks, making the matchup against Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Chi-Yu much more reasonable.

  • Steel: Tera Steel makes the Iron Bundle match up tilt in Amoonguss's favor, with even Focus Sash Iron Bundle being unable to catch Amoonguss if Eject Pack is intact.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type grants a Psychic-type immunity, along with a STAB Foul Play.

  • Poison: A Poison Tera type removes Amoonguss's Ice-, Fire-, and Flying-type weaknesses; and makes Clear Smog stronger due to its Base Power being increased to 60 along with the bonus STAB; however this increases its vulnerability to Ground-type attacks. Tera Poison also still retains Amoonguss's Toxic Spikes absorbing utility.

  • Fire: Fire isn't the best defensive typing, but it's a way to retain a Fairy resistance if dealing with Ice- and Fire-type attacks is needed.

Defensive.description:
• With good bulk, a solid defensive typing, the ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, and access to Spore and Regenerator, Amoonguss is a fantastic support and disruptor option.

  • Sludge Bomb versus Clear Smog: Sludge Bomb gives Amoonguss a decent STAB to use against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and breaks Wo-Chien's Substitute when its weak to it. On the other hand, Clear Smog prevents Amoonguss from getting set up on unless the opponent is Steel-type or has a Substitute up.

  • Giga Drain: Unlike Sludge Bomb, Giga Drain OHKOs Iron Bundle after Stealth Rock damage, and doesn't have to worry about Tera Water.

Other Options

  • Toxic: Toxic's conflicts with Spore make it a lesser option, but it's a devastating option against some bulky Spore absorbers such as Wo-Chien and Annihilape.

  • Hex: Hex both punishes foes put to sleep by Spore and hits Air Balloon Gholdengo and Flutter Mane.

  • Stomping Tantrum: Stomping Tantrum deals decent damage to Gholdengo and Magnezone.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Amoonguss's solid defensive typing, several major threats such as Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur will require Terastallization to deal with.

  • Water: Tera Water is Amoonguss's ticket for dealing with Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur.

  • Dark: Tera Dark removes its weakness to Psychic-type attacks and makes Foul Play stronger.

  • Poison: Tera Poison retains Amoonguss's ability to use Black Sludge and absorb Toxic Spikes, at the cost of being weak to the common Earthquake.

  • Steel: While it makes Amoonguss weak to Ground- and Fighting-type attacks, it also grants Amoonguss a better matchup against Iron Bundle, especially if using Giga Drain.

Items

  • Leftovers: The extra recovery from Leftovers pairs well with the free turns Spore often grants Amoonguss.

  • Black Sludge: Black Sludge is a great way to get around Item Clause if Leftovers is already in use. Note, if Amoonguss Terastallizes into a type that isn't Poison, it will take damage instead.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves with residual damage, potentially breaking Focus Sash from foes like Breloom and Great Tusk in the process.

Haxorus.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

Mold Breaker Funny Moments Compilation.description:
• With its workable Speed, sky-high Attack stat, and the ever-valuable Mold Breaker, Haxorus is notable as one of the few setup sweepers not bothered by Mimikyu or Unaware.

  • With one Dragon Dance, it can outspeed most unboosted foes, but Choice Scarf users still cause issues, notably Hydreigon and Play Rough Meowscarada.

  • Dragon Claw may be worth using in place of Outrage to avoid locking Haxorus in.

  • Earthquake is extremely valuable on Haxorus due to Mold Breaker nullifying Levitate and Earth Eater, allowing Haxorus to hit foes like Rotom-W and Hydreigon hard without the need to lock into Outrage, and giving it a way to hit Orthworm hard at all

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets Haxorus deal damage much more effectively at the cost of recoil

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Haxorus safely set up against a foe that may use crippling status moves such as Will-O-Wisp and Spore.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Steel grants good security against opposing Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-types.

  • Fairy: Fairy maximizes Haxorus's security against opposing Dragon-types, specifically.

  • Electric: Electric provides a surefire way of dealing with Dondozo thanks to Tera Blast.

Hydreigon.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

HARBINGER (Choice Item).description:
• With access to the incredible Levitate, Hydreigon sets itself apart from Roaring Moon as a dangerous offensive force that effectively utilizes Terastallization.

  • Flash Cannon: This is Hydreigon's best option to hit Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Flutter Mane.

  • Flamethrower versus Fire Blast: Flamethrower is usually good enough for hitting Steel-types such as Scizor and otherwise decent Dark Pulse switch-ins like Meowscarada. On the other hand, Choice Specs Fire Blast is capable of OHKOing bulky Gholdengo and Corviknight.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs Hydreigon is a nuclear wallbreaker that can pummel unsuspecting teams.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf patches up Hydreigon's somewhat lackluster Speed, allowing it to threaten a wider portion of the metagame with its high-powered attacks.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Hydreigon has a lot of competition from other Dragon-types, as well as having to face down strong Dark-resists like Chien-Pao. Terastallization is it's best way to flip these matchups when absolutely necessary.

  • Steel: Tera Steel can be used to get around the many Dragon and Fairy-types that try to revenge kill Hydreigon, though it is still vulnerable to Mach Punch from Breloom.

  • Poison: Tera Poison has great synergy with Hydreigon's former typing, making it do especially well against Great Tusk.

  • Fire: Tera Fire will grant Hydreigon a resistance to Fairy-types while removing its weakness to Fighting-types and powering up Flamethrower or Fire Blast. However, unlike Tera Steel it does not grant a resistance to Dragon, and it also gives Hydreigon a few new weaknesses.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosts Dark Pulse into an absurdly powerful weapon, and when coupled with its flinch rate, Tera Dark Hydreigon can potentially muscle its way out of otherwise hopeless situations.

Versatile Attacker.description:
• Hydreigon's useful support movepool can add quite a bit of unpredictability to its offensive potential.

  • Note that this Hydreigon is fully capable of running three attacking moves with one support move.

  • Nasty Plot: Nasty Plot makes Hydreigon a surprisingly dangerous sweeper against slower teams and pairs particularly well with Substitute.

  • Substitute: Substitute is excellent for scouting Terastallization and punishes common status users such as Yawn Dondozo as well as Leech Seed Wo-Chien.

  • Taunt: Taunt can stop setup from defensive foes such as Hippowdon, Wo-Chien and Clodsire, and is especially dangerous if they lack coverage to hit back effectively.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Hydreigon sets of this kind normally prey on bulkier targets, using its support tools to overwhelm them. However, Hydreigon will likely still have to deal with its Dragon-type brethren, so Terastallization is sometimes necessary.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type has fantastic synergy with Levitate, helping Hydreigon against Dragon- and Fairy-types without the dreaded Ground weakness.

  • Poison: With a Poison Tera type, Hydreigon can do well against Fairy-types without fear of powerful Fighting-type attacks. Thanks to Levitate, it also matches up well into Great Tusk.

  • Fire: When using Flamethrower, a Fire Tera type is handy for both the Fairy resistance and a better matchup against Kingambit.

Items

  • Leftovers: If using Substitute, Leftovers's extra bit of recovery helps reduce its risk.

  • Life Orb: A simple power boost still comes in handy, even if only using two attacks.

  • Black Glasses: If a teammate is already using Life Orb, Black Glasses is a good compromise.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Hydreigon's new access to Stealth Rock makes it a surprisingly effective offensive support Pokemon.

  • Taunt: Taunt effectively shuts down common support leads like Ting-Lu, Hippowdon, and Clodsire.

  • Thunder Wave: This is a powerful deterrent against offensive foes and can even stop sweepers in emergency situations when used with Focus Sash.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: If running Focus Sash, Terastallization is generally not needed. For other items, Terastallization is sometimes more necessary.

  • Steel: Thanks to Levitate, a Steel Tera type is an incredible defensive typing for Hydreigon, giving it an advantage over Fairy- and Dragon-types.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a good alternative to Steel, with fewer resistances but an important Fighting-type resistance for targets like Great Tusk and Iron Hands.

  • Fire: Fire-type Hydreigon is better against Kingambit and Fairy-types.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes setting up Stealth Rock a much easier task against offensive teams. Be warned that it doesn't stop Dragapult's Dragon Darts.

  • Leftovers: If using Taunt, Leftovers is the best choice for giving Hydreigon longevity against defensive foes such as Corviknight.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets Hydreigon be played more offensively if setting Stealth Rock isn't needed.

  • Dark Glasses: Dark Glasses work if a teammate is using Life Orb.

Volcarona.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Bulkarona.description:
• With recovery and massive investments in bulk, Volcarona is capable of setting up multiple Quiver Dances, making it a potent sweeper.

  • Tera Blast: Even before Terastallization, Tera Blast can come in handy for hitting Chi-Yu and Roaring Moon

  • Giga Drain: Giga Drain is Volcarona's best shot at beating Water-types such as Rotom-W and Palafin; note that Dondozo is not 2HKOed.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Burning foes is great for letting Volcarona set up against powerful foes like Chien-Pao and Great Tusk.

  • Substitute: Though it can be difficult to fit-in, Substitute allows Volcarona to punish users of status moves, such as sleep moves from Breloom and Gholdengo's Thunder Wave.

Other Options

  • Bug Buzz: This is Volcarona's best tool against foes behind a Substitute like Wo-Chien, and it hits physically defensive Ting-Lu hard.

  • Psychic: Psychic 2HKOs Toxapex, who can otherwise be problematic with Haze, and it hits Iron Moth hard.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While the massive Rock-type weakness often pressures Volcarona to Terastallize, Volcarona's useful resistances to Fighting and Fairy mean this isn't always the right play.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera type, Volcarona can now 2HKO most Dondozo with Giga Drain and is better insulated against revenge kills from Water-types like Azumarill and Palafin-H.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type lets Volcarona take on powerful Dark and Dragon attacks from the likes of Chien-Pao and Choice Band Dragonite, and gives it powerful coverage against them with Tera Blast.

  • Water: Besides removing all of Volcarona's old weaknesses, a Water Tera type also massively improves the match up against Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, and Skeledirge with Tera Blast.

  • Flying: While a Flying Tera Type isn't a huge help defensively, the immunity to Fissure makes Volcarona better equipped to handle Dondozo.

  • Fire: A Fire Tera type simply gives Fiery Dance more power, and makes sense if not using Tera Blast.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Stealth Rock is common enough that this is the safest item for Volcarona to hold.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry gives Volcarona more durability against teams that lack hazards, and with an even HP stat, it'll eat Sitrus Berry right away after switching into Sealth Rock.

  • Lum Berry: This allows Volcarona to recover from status once against threats like Spore Breloom, Yawn Dondozo, and Thunder Wave Dragonite.

  • Covert Cloak: If Terastallized against Garganacl, Covert Cloak stops it from beating Volcarona with Salt Cure.

  • Safety Goggles: This allows Volcarona to handle Spore from Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Amoonguss without Terastallizing.

EV Spreads

  • All of the given EV spreads except for the last one will outspeed offensive Iron Bundle and OHKO it with Fiery Dance after one Quiver Dance. If using Giga Drain, feel free to redistribute the SpA EV's.

  • Odd HP versus Even HP: Volcarona will usually prefer an odd HP stat to take less residual damage, with Stealth Rock no longer 2HKOing being the most important. However, if using Sitrus Berry, move 8 Defense EV's to HP so that one hit from Ruination or Stealth Rock activates it.

  • 244 HP / 204 Def / 12 SpA / 4 SpD / 44 Spe with Timid: This EV spread is the standard for outspeeding Iron Bundle after Quiver Dance, while simultaneously maximizing Volcarona's bulk.

  • 244 HP / 188 Def / 76 Spe with Timid: This EV spread sacrifices some physical bulk for being able to outspeed Dragapult after one Quiver Dance. If 8 Def EV's are moved to HP for the Sitrus Berry variant, this EV spread guarantees that Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Crunch triggers Sitrus Berry, always avoiding a 2HKO.

  • 244 HP / 236 Def / 28 Spe with Bold: This EV spread outspeeds Iron Valiant after Quiver Dance, and gives Volcarona a very strong chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao even without Sitrus Berry.

Offensive Quiver Dance.description:
• This far speedier approach to sweeping with Volcarona is more risky, but can catch more passive teams by surprise with its greater coverage.

  • Giga Drain: Giga Drain is the best coverage option for Volcarona, as it helps it deal with Water-type Pokémon, as well as recover a good amount of HP.

  • Bug Buzz versus Psychic: Bug Buzz's ability to ignore Substitute and hit Ting-Lu and Roaring Moon hard make it a reasonable consideration. Psychic's coverage isn't amazing, but it does help Volcarona deal with Iron Moth and Toxapex.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: This Volcarona is heavily pressured to start sweeping after it sets up, so Terastallization can widen the opportunities to do so.

  • Water: Terastallizing into the Water typing nullifies Volcarona's most common weakness in Rock-type, and Water-type Tera Blast is also the best option Volcarona has to hit Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, Skeledirge.

  • Grass: The Grass typing strengthens Giga Drain and nullifies Volcarona's weakness to Water-types, most notably helping against Dondozo, Azumarill, and Palafin-H.

  • Rock: Tera Rock is Volcarona's at covering Chi-Yu, Dragonite, Iron Moth, and Skeledirge with one move, especially with the useful Extreme Speed resistance. When used with Hippowdon's Sand Stream, it also makes Volcarona quite specially bulky.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a big help against powerful Dragon-type attacks such as Choice Band Dragonite's Outrage, and it gives Volcarona good coverage against it too.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: It is the best option on Volcarona, as it circumvents its crippling Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Lum Berry: This Volcarona's more offensive nature makes it especially vulnerable to status moves from the likes of Dragonite and Focus Sash Breloom, so Lum Berry is a reasonable way around this.

  • Sitrus Berry: If used with an even HP stat, Sitrus Berry will restore Volcarona's health the moment it switches into either Stealth Rock or gets hit by Ruination.

Thundurus-Therian.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

Pivot.description:
• Thanks to Volt Absorb, Thundurus-T is an excellent offensive pivot that makes masterful use of Terastallization!

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot is highly recommended for dealing massive damage to Ground-types, such as Ting-Lu and Ursaluna, without Terastallizing in addition to being a secondary attack to hit Urshifu-R while Choice locked into an attack.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast has reliability issues, but it's Thundurus-T's best shot of dealing big damage to Hisuian Goodra and Wo-Chien.

  • Sludge Bomb: Sludge Bomb is a more niche option, giving Thundurus-T a more reliable way to deal damage to Wo-Chien and Meowscarada at the cost of doing nothing to Hisuian Goodra.

  • Timid versus Modest: Timid is the best nature, allowing Thundurus-T to outspeed key threats, such as Urshifu-R, and at least Speed tie with opposing Thundurus-T. Modest is usable with Choice Specs, allowing Thundurus-T to outspeed up to Jolly Baxcalibur and Great Tusk, and the extra power can be handy in some situations, such as usually 2HKOing specially defensive Clodsire with Tera Blast Flying.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Thundurus-T is perfectly fine with its base typing, it makes such good use of Terastallization that it'll often Terastallize.

  • Flying: Tera Flying makes Tera Blast a powerful STAB option with very few resistances while gaining no extra weaknesses thanks to Volt Absorb.

  • Ice: Not only does Tera Ice give Thundurus-T powerful coverage against Ground- and Grass-types like Landorus-T and Wo-Chien, it also gives an important resistance to Iron Bundle's and Chien-Pao's Ice-type attacks.

  • Water: Tera Water is a fantastic defensive option, turning Thundurus-T into an excellent check against Regieleki and Zapdos while still giving it a good coverage option against Landorus-T. However, it still retains Thundurus-T's weakness to Freeze-Dry.

Items

  • Choice Specs versus Choice Scarf: Choice Specs makes Thundurus-T difficult to wall without an extremely sturdy special wall, with even Pokemon like Clodsire and Cresselia at risk of a 2HKO. Choice Scarf, on the other hand, allows Thundurus-T to double as a good revenge killer, outspeeding major threats like Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao.

  • Assault Vest: While Thundurus-T isn't known for its bulk, Volt Absorb means Assault Vest makes Thundurus-T more effective at checking other Electric-types, especially when using bulkier EV spreads.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 228 Spe with Timid: This Assault Vest spread outspeeds both Urshifu formes and takes 70% maximum from Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without sacrificing power.

  • 188 SpA / 68 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid or Modest**: This spread is optimized for Assault Vest, letting Thundurus-T survive Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without Terastallizing.

Minor Optimizations

  • 0-3 Attack IV: Foes that commonly run Foul Play such as Amoonguss and Rotom-W have more powerful moves to use against Thundurus-T, but there's no drawback to minimizing Foul Play's damage.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Thundurus-T's massive Special Attack stat and array of immunities make it a good user of Nasty Plot.

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot is integral for potentially OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu after a boost and usually OHKOing offensive Ursaluna.

  • Life Orb versus Sitrus Berry: Life Orb is great for wallbreaking, allowing Thundurus-T to potentially OHKO Ting-Lu with a boosted Grass Knot. Sitrus Berry is still a good option, though allowing Thundurus-T to instantly restore some health after being hit by Ruination, as long as its maximum HP is an even number.

Other Options

  • Substitute: When paired with Tera Water, Substitute lets Thundurus-T set up on Garganacl.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast's unreliability makes it hard to recommend for most teams, but it's the only way Thundurus-T will break through Hisuian Goodra without Terastallization.

  • Taunt: Giving up coverage is risky, but Taunt shuts down a lot of defensive counterplay against Thundurus-T such as Whirlwind Ting-Lu and Toxic Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Thundurus-T's typing is totally functional for sweeping and wallbreaking, but Terastallization makes it far harder to revenge kill thanks to Volt Absorb.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gives Thundurus-T a powerful STAB option, letting it cleave through specially bulky foes, like Water Absorb Clodsire, particularly easily.

  • Water: While Tera Water does leave Thundurus-T vulnerable to certain Pokemon, such as Water Absorb Clodsire and Hisuian Goodra, it's a fantastic defensive Tera type that lets it deal with other common Electric-types that Terastallize like Regieleki and Zapdos.

  • Ice: Tera Ice is a great offensive option, letting Thundurus-T cleave through most Ground-types that aren't weak to Grass such as Landorus-T and Clodsire. Thundurus-T even makes good defensive use of it, resisting Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 4 Def / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread lets Thundurus-T survive Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry, if it doesn't have an offensive item, making it a good choice for more defensive items Thundurus-T may use such as Sitrus Berry.

Minor Optimizations

  • 0-3 Attack IV: Thundurus-T isn't getting hit by Foul Play that often, but a lower Attack IV is marginally useful regardless.

Sylveon.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• With its good natural bulk, Sylveon can serve as a potent special attacker and decent revenge killer.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast serves as a good alternate STAB attack once Sylveon has Terastallized, providing highly valuable coverage against the Steel-types that could otherwise exploit it, like Scizor. It also gets around potential users of Throat Chop before Terastallization, such as Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon.

  • Psyshock: This is Sylveon's best shot of dealing with Iron Moth.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball hits foes such as Mimikyu, Flutter Mane, and Gholdengo super effectively, and it means Sylveon does not have to Terastallize to hit Gholdengo for good damage.

  • Quick Attack: Though it is weak, Quick Attack gives valuable priority for picking off weakened threats, and thanks to Pixilate, surprise users of Tera Ghost aren't able to absorb it. A Quiet nature can be used to increase its power, though this risks Sylveon getting outsped by Kingambit.

Other Options

  • Psychic: Psychic deals more damage to physically defensive Toxapex and Amoonguss, but its lower damage output against Iron Moth makes it disappointing if not using Tera Ground.

  • Hyper Beam: Despite the serious risks from the recharge turn, Hyper Beam's extreme power makes it a good filler move.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest lets even offensive Sylveon be specially resilient.

  • Choice Specs: With the boost from Choice Specs, Sylveon is a surprisingly potent wallbreaker, making the most out of its many opportunities to switch in.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA: This spread capitalizes on Sylveon's good natural bulk while maximizing its power.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: While no bulk investment makes Sylveon more difficult to safely get in, Speed investment allows it to outrun and threaten a wider range of foes, such as Scizor and Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Sylveon suffers coverage issues on its own, so its heavily reliant on either Tera Blast or the sheer power of Tera Fairy Hyper Voice to break past them.
