  • Fire: Tera Fire allows Sylveon to break past troublesome Steel-types, like Gholdengo and Kingambit, and gives it a key resistance to Ice and Fire attacks from Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu respectively.

  • Water: Tera Water gives good coverage against Fire-types like Iron Moth and Skeledirge, in addition to surprising Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu by resisting their strongest STAB attacks.

  • Ground: Tera Ground doesn't match up quite as well against Steel-types as Tera Fire, but it lets Sylveon turn the tables on Iron Moth, and deal massive damage to Toxapex and Skeledirge.

  • Fairy: Getting an extra boost on Hyper Voice and Hyper Beam makes Choice Specs Sylveon far more difficult to wall, with even resists such as Gholdengo and physically defensive Skeledirge getting 2HKOed by Hyper Voice!

Items

  • Assault Vest: Giving Sylveon extra special bulk lets it take on powerful threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle more reliably.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs turns Sylveon into a surprising wallbreaker, especially if using Tera Fairy.

  • Throat Spray: With Hyper Voice activating Throat Spray, Sylveon could potentially break apart slower foes in the late-game, though it only gets one shot at this Special Attack boost. This is best used with Tera Blast to give Sylveon an alternative STAB attack that doesn't activate Throat Spray.

CUTESY CRUSADER (Defensive).description:
• With its good bulk and Special Attack and a reasonable healing move in Wish, Sylveon is a good choice for a bulky Fairy-type.

  • Hyper Voice: Hyper Voice gives Sylveon a reliable STAB even when Terastallized, and hits through common Substitute users like Iron Bundle and Wo-Chien. While It's possible to drop this attack for Tera Blast in an attempt to run more coverage, this seriously worsens Sylveon's matchup against Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu.

  • Tera Blast: Beyond just Terastallization, Tera Blast is still impacted by Pixilate, making it a good move to use against foes that sometimes carry Throat Chop, like Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon.

  • Protect: Protect pairs excellently with Leftovers, and makes Wish a more reliable recovery move.

  • Yawn: Sylveon's good bulk makes it a great choice for phazing with Yawn.

  • Psyshock: Psyshock is Sylveon's best hope for Iron Moth switch-ins.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball offers important coverage on Gholdengo without demanding that Sylveon Terastallize.

  • Leftovers versus Sitrus Berry: Leftovers is the preferred recovery item for its synergy with Protect and Wish, but Sitrus Berry is a reasonable alternative if Protect isn't wanted, or if another teammate needs Leftovers more.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Sylveon's coverage issues are much easier to deal with when using Terastallization, but this set can still be used well defensively without it.

  • Fire: A Fire Tera type grants Sylveon resistances to Steel and Fairy, allowing it to take on foes it would otherwise have to run from, such as Gholdengo, and a good STAB to hit Chien-Pao hard with if not using Hyper Voice. It also works against Scizor, but note that Tera Water is common on that foe. Tera Fire also makes Sylveon far more vulnerable to Ting-Lu.

  • Water: Tera Water is a great mono-attacking option, making it ideal if only running Tera Blast to do decently well against Steel-types. It also gives Sylveon a better matchup against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and is a safer option against Ting-Lu and Tera Water Scizor.

  • Fairy: If not using Tera Blast, Fairy becomes a reasonable option for boosting Hyper Voice's damage output. Note that Tera Blast is not needed to justify a different Tera Type.

  • Ground: Tera Ground worsens Sylveon's matchup with Chien-Pao, but it does let it deal big damage to Iron Moth, Gholdengo, and Toxapex.

Goodra-Hisui.overview:
This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

For more information on Battle Stadium Singles, vist the format page!

Assault Vest.description:
• Hisuian Goodra's incredible special bulk, typing, and useful immunity to Spore via Sap Sipper make it one of the prime choices for Assault Vest!

  • Flash Cannon versus Heavy Slam: Flash Cannon has great synergy with Acid Spray and is a reliable STAB move in general. While Heavy Slam isn't very useful against heavy targets, it's worth using for OHKOing offensive Flutter Mane, one of the biggest threats in the metagame.

  • Draco Meteor versus Ice Beam: Draco Meteor's power makes switching offensive threats like Urshifu-R into Hisuian Goodra tricky, and it is notable for 2HKOing Dondozo. Ice Beam lets Hisuian Goodra punish important Ground-types.

  • Acid Spray: Acid Spray is a useful wallbreaking tool, capable of making even specially bulky foes like Clodsire risk taking massive damage after the Special Defense drop.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt is another way to 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo and OHKO offensive Urshifu-R and pairs very well with Ice Beam in terms of coverage.

  • Earthquake: While not particularly strong, Earthquake is highly recommended for 2HKOing Heatran and 3HKOing opposing Assault Vest Hisuian Goodra, as both of these will wall this set otherwise.

  • Flamethrower: For other Steel-types like Gholdengo and Scizor, Flamethrower will deal much more damage than Earthquake.

  • Modest versus Quiet: The importance of mirror matches makes Modest an appealing option for Hisuian Goodra, but Quiet will ensure that all but the bulkiest Flutter Mane will need to Terastallize to avoid an OHKO from Heavy Slam.

Other Options

  • Surf: Surf is a decent option to hit Ground-types and Heatran with one attack, but Surf will, at best, usually only 3HKO Heatran.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Hisuian Goodra's superb typing, its common weaknesses to Ground and Fighting make Terastallization a valuable route for it.

  • Flying: Tera Flying covers Hisuian Goodra's former weaknesses fantastically, even giving it an out against Fissure Dondozo. This comes at the cost of doing much worse against Iron Bundle, Thundurus-T, Zapdos, and Rotom-W though.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy still gives Hisuian Goodra a vital Fighting resistance, as well as being a good defensive typing in general.

  • Water: Tera Water has good synergy with Sap Sipper, giving Hisuian Goodra a sole weakness to Electric, in addition to gaining a useful Ice resistance against Chien-Pao, at the cost of doing worse against Iron Bundle.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: If using Heavy Slam, there is a a chance that Hisuian Goodra can become infatuated by the very rare Cute Charm Enamorus, making a female gender very slightly superior.

Armor Press.description:
• Hisuian Goodra's bulk lends itself naturally to boosting its Defense for Body Press, especially with a useful immunity to critical hits that gives it a great matchup against Urshifu formes after Terastallization.

  • Heavy Slam: As Flutter Mane is the most dangerous Special Attacker in the format, Heavy Slam is the best Steel-type STAB move, OHKOing all but the most defensive Flutter Mane if they don't Terastallize.

  • Protect: Protect has good synergy with Leftovers for extra healing, though Urshifu formes can ignore it.

  • Draco Meteor versus Ice Beam: If using a Sassy or Relaxed nature, Draco Meteor can threaten to 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo. Ice Beam, on the other hand, is a safer and stronger option against Landorus-T and Garchomp.

Other Options

  • Rest and Chesto Berry: Rest and Chesto Berry combine to give Hisuian Goodra a great way to restore health, though the combination is only reliable once.

  • Life Dew: Life Dew doesn't restore much health even with Leftovers, but it can help Hisuian Goodra last longer against some physical threats after setting up.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Hisuian Goodra's fantastic typing doesn't make Terastallization a requirement, but it does make setting up against major physical threats like Urshifu-R and Landorus-T much more feasible.

  • Flying: Tera Flying not only covers all of Hisuian Goodra's former weaknesses, but it also means Fissure is no longer an option to break through its boosts from the likes of Dondozo or Ting-Lu. The new weaknesses to Electric and Ice can harm it though, since Electric- and Ice-type coverage moves are commonly special.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Hisuian Goodra shielding from both Urshifu formes without giving it the harmful Electric and Ice weaknesses that Flying does, though it can harm mirror matches against Assault Vest Hisuian Goodra.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful or Sassy: This specially defensive spread is Hisuian Goodra's best shot at avoiding a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast, assuming extra Leftovers recovery from Protect.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish or Relaxed: Maximum physical bulk means Hisuian Goodra won't check Flutter Mane nearly as well, but it let will let Body Press become a better sweeping tool.

Minor Optimizations

  • Acid Armor: Acid Armor is the best option for boosting Defense due to its higher PP, but it requires Hisuian Sligoo to evolve while knowing the move in either Scarlet or Violet, as it's not able to be relearned by Hisuian Goodra. Shelter is still a viable, albeit strictly inferior, option.

  • Female Gender: While very rare, Heavy Slam being a contact move means Hisuian Goodra does risk of activating Enamorus's Cute Charm, making a female gender a marginally better choice.

Avalugg.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Sturdy Support.description:
• With incredible Defense and the ability Sturdy, Avalugg finds a niche on stall-based teams as a physical wall that prevents fishing for OHKOs.

  • Icicle Crash versus Avalanche: While Avalanche has bigger damage potential when Avalugg is attacked head on, its defensive profile normally forces switches. This makes Icicle Crash the more consistent option for overall damage.

  • Toxic Support Partners: Even though Avalugg stops foes such as Dondozo from using Fissure, it lacks the power to cleanly beat these targets on its own. Common stall teammates such as Toxapex and Clodsire can bring Toxic or Toxic Spikes to spread status, allowing Avalugg to simply stall while poison wears down the opposition.

  • EV Spread: Full investment into HP and Defense give Avalugg insane physical bulk. Even Choice Band Chien-Pao’s Sacred Sword isn’t a reliable 2HKO!

Other Options

  • Mirror Coat: Combined with Sturdy, Mirror Coat is a tempting last resort against the special attackers that Avalugg can’t wall. However, this almost assuredly destroys Avalugg’s survivability afterwards, which can compromise the defensive cycle of its team.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Situational: Most commonly a member of stall-based teams, Avalugg’s bad matchups are supposed to be covered by the team’s defensive cycle. Tera is normally only used if it is necessary to prevent the collapse of said defensive cycle.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting balances offense and defense, making dealing with physical Fighting- and Rock-type attacks much more manageable and giving a sizable boost to Avalugg’s best attack in Body Press.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost lets Avalugg escape from precarious situations against trapping moves and Gothitelle. It also outright walls Close Combat from the likes of Iron Hands and Iron Valiant, although the new Dark-type weakness significantly worsens its matchup with Chien-Pao.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is another option for weakening Fighting-type moves directed at Avalugg while also blocking Toxic and allowing for Toxic Spikes absorption later in the match.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Since Avalugg can expect to do a lot of switching, removing its vulnerability to Stealth Rock damage is extremely important for its longevity and preservation of Sturdy.

  • Rocky Helmet: Avalugg can punish many physical attackers it switches into with Rocky Helmet chip, slowly wearing them down without having to be offensively involved.

Pivot.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish or Relaxed: Maximizing Defense gives Incineroar around a 90% chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Choice Band Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword. A lower Speed IV can be used to underspeed more threats, but this can be risky against Ursaluna-B.

  • 252 HP / 44 Def / 212 SpD with Careful or Sassy: When used with Sitrus Berry, this spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

Toxapex.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated for Regulation D! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

For more information on Battle Stadium Singles, visit the format page!

Return Of The Pex.description:
• With the rise of powerful defensive Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Dragonite, Toxapex stands out as a masterful spreader of poison to support its teammates!

  • Toxic: Toxic is the most reliable way to spread the deadliest version of poison and is especially effective against Taunt users like Annihilape if using Mental Herb.

  • Toxic Spikes: Toxic Spikes makes the team less reliant on Toxapex to spread status directly, and acts as excellent support for stalling teammates like Ting-Lu, Dragonite and Gholdengo.

  • Haze: Even with Toxapex's great bulk, powerful setup sweepers like Chien-Pao and Dragonite quickly get out of control for it, so Haze is the best solution to prevent Toxapex from being setup bait.

  • Liquidation versus Chilling Water: Liqudation isn't particularly strong but it allows Toxapex to 2HKO Chi-Yu and is the best option for breaking Substitute against targets like Flutter Mane. Chilling Water with a Bold or Impish nature gives Toxapex another tool against physical sweepers, but makes it much more vulnerable to Substitute in general.

  • Baneful Bunker: If using Black Sludge or Leftovers, Baneful Bunker is a fantastic way to spread poison against physical attackers and get some extra recovery with one moveslot, but keep in mind that this won't work against Urshifu-R. It's also key for scouting dangerous uses of Trick from the likes of Gholdengo and Rotom-W.

  • Physically Defensive versus Specially Defensive: Physically defensive Toxapex does well against some hard-to-check threats, such as Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao. Specially defensive Toxapex, on the other hand, has a better shot of beating Heatran and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu.

Other Options

  • Infestation: Infestation is Toxapex's best chance of doing chip damage to Toxic-immune threats, such as Corviknignt and Gholdengo, and the trapping works fairly well against foes that do have problems with Toxic. It also prevents double switching from being an issue for Toxapex.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization can help Toxapex beat a new set of threats, its bulk and good defensive typing usually makes it a rare occurrence compared to its teammates.

  • Poison: Besides making Toxapex far less vulnerable to Electric, which some foes like Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur may Terastallize into, Tera Poison retains the ability to restore health with Black Sludge.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy removes all of Toxapex's weaknesses and can save it from taking massive damage from Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse. It also does well against powerful Dragon-type attacks such as Choice Band Dragonite's Outrage and Choice Specs Dragapult's Draco Meteor.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can prevent Breloom and Amoonguss from being disastrous with Spore, in addition to doing well against Rotom-W. It also gives an important Ground-type resistance against targets such as Ting-Lu and Dragonite.

  • Normal: While Normal isn't an impressive defensive type, Tera Normal can punish Choice locked Ghost-types, such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

  • Bug: While the Stealth Rock weakness can be an issue, Tera Bug is a niche way to resist Ground-type attacks while being neutral to both Ice- and Electric-type moves, unlike other methods.

  • Flying: Tera Flying not only protects Toxapex from its irritating Ground-type weakness but also means bulky users of Fissure, such as Dondozo and Ting-Lu, will no longer pressure Toxapex. However, this typing makes Toxapex much worse into general offense.

Items

  • Black Sludge versus Leftovers: Having passive healing is wonderful, especially with Baneful Bunker. Black Sludge is a clever way to get around Item Clause, but Leftovers gives Toxapex more freedom in choosing its Tera type.

  • Rocky Helmet: While Urshifu-R often has contact protection, other physical attackers such as Chien-Pao can be gradually worn down through Rocky Helmet chip.

  • Mental Herb: With Mental Herb providing one-time protection from Taunt, Toxapex can surprise foes like Annihilape and Ting-Lu with Toxic, which is especially helpful if not running an attack.

Mimikyu.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Swords Dance.description:
• Thanks to Disguise, Mimikyu is a premier revenge killer and sweeper in Battle Stadium Singles, being particularly apt at revenge killing Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak.

  • Shadow Claw: While not a particularly powerful STAB, Shadow Claw is Mimikyu's most reliable attack against Poison-types such as Iron Moth and Toxapex.

  • Drain Punch: If using Tera Fighting, Drain Punch is a good coverage move against Steel-types such as Kingambit and Magnezone.

  • Fire Tera Blast: Tera Blast is a risky option due to making your team commit to Terastallizing Mimikyu, but it can be worth it for muscling through Mimikyu's usual checks, such as Corviknight and Tera Steel Pokemon.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization can clinch in some key win conditions in certain situations, but Mimikyu functions perfectly fine without it.

  • Ghost: The extra damage on Shadow Sneak gives Mimikyu an easier time sweeping late-game, particularly helpful once sturdy physical walls like Corviknight and Toxapex are worn down.

  • Fighting: The boosted power of Drain Punch gives Mimikyu a far better matchup against certain targets weak to it, such as Iron Bundle, Kingambit, and bulky Chi-Yu.

  • Fairy: A boosted Play Rough lets Mimikyu clean through weakened bulky Pokemon like Dondozo more easily.

  • Fire: With Tera Blast, Jolly Mimikyu has a 75% chance to OHKO Corviknight after Swords Dance, which means most other Steel-types will have a far more difficult time dealing with Mimikyu.

  • Normal: Tera Normal doesn't help Mimikyu offensively and makes Mimikyu vulnerable to Mach Punch and Dragon Darts, but the Ghost-type immunity could give it a surprise set-up or revenge kill opportunity against other Ghost-types.

  • Electric: While not as effective against Steel-types as Tera Fire, it still deals massive damage to Corviknight, and gives Mimikyu better chip damage to Dondozo.

Curse Stall.description:
• The combination of Curse, Substitute, and Pain Split is devastating against key defensive Pokemon such as Dondozo and Wo-Chien.

  • Play Rough versus Shadow Claw: Play Rough is the most consistent option due to having no immunities, and doing well against the large amount of Dark and Fighting Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu. Shadow Claw is Mimikyu's best shot at dealing damage to Gholdengo, at the cost of doing poorly against Normal-types.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt does an even better job of shutting down defensive foes, but makes Mimikyu totally useless against Gholdengo and vulnerable to faster uses of Taunt itself.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Mimikyu rarely Terastallizes, but it can be useful in a few situations.

  • Fairy / Ghost: Terastallizing this Mimikyu for extra damage output is fairly situational, but getting a bit of extra power can help late game.

  • Steel: Besides being a good defensive typing, Tera Steel means Mimikyu can get around Toxic Spikes later in the match.

  • Flying: Against common users of Fissure such as Dondozo, this gives Mimikyu a situational way to stall them out more easily while healthy.

  • Poison: Tera Poison lets Mimikyu absorb Toxic Spikes, which seriously threaten this strategy otherwise.

Items

  • Life Orb: Despite this set's focus on stalling, Life Orb's offensive boost is worth considering to give Mimikyu the potential to clean up weakened teams, as well as OHKO frail foes such as Chien-Pao with Play Rough.

  • Salac Berry: Salac Berry gives Mimikyu a new option for cleaning up teams late-game. Note that unlike almost any other user of Salac Berry, this Mimikyu will prefer to use Substitute as much as possible to fully take advantage of Curse, so using an HP stat divisible by 4 is not recommended.

  • Figy Berry: Figy Berry and it's other counterparts give Mimikyu another method of healing after using Substitute enough times.

  • Bright Powder: While not particularly reliable, even one miss against Mimikyu can be devastating!

EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 220 Atk / 12 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe This EV spread lets Mimikyu maintain its Substitute against 4 Attack EV Garganacl's Salt Cure, The odd HP number is relevant if Mimikyu uses Curse without its Disguise being broken, keeping Mimikyu's HP stat odd so that it can use Substitute twice after using Curse, or use Curse twice in a row without KOing itself.

  • 244 HP / 12 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: This bulkier EV spread gives Mimikyu an odd HP number that it can take advantage of if it uses Curse without its Disguise being broken, letting it use Curse again without KOing itself the next turn or using Substitute twice after using Curse. The rest is place in Defense to take priority attacks better.

Trick Scarf.description:
• Mimikyu might seem like an odd user of Choice Scarf with its low offenses, but with Trick and Disguise, it becomes a very disruptive Pokemon against defensive foes like Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, Dondozo, and Corviknight.

  • Shadow Sneak: Shadow Sneak is a reasonable option to give Mimikyu priority after using Trick, which is especially helpful against Flutter Mane.

  • Wood Hammer hits Water-types such as Rotom-W and Iron Bundle very hard.

  • Thunder Wave, Will-O-Wisp, and Curse: Thunder Wave, Will-O-Wisp, or Curse let Mimikyu further disrupt Pokemon after using Trick, or can be used as an emergency way to stop a sweeper while still holding Choice Scarf.

  • Using a neutral Nature with a mint: Mimikyu should have a neutral nature with a Jolly Mint used on it. This way, Mimikyu can't be confused by eating any Berry after using Trick.

Other Options

  • Destiny Bond: Mimikyu's good Speed makes it a good option for making trades with Destiny Bond.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Mimikyu's supportive nature means it'll only Terastallize under specific conditions.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives enough of a boost to Play Rough to OHKO Chien-Pao and deal over 50% to Ting-Lu that don't invest in Defense.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost gives Mimikyu a good chance to OHKO Dragapult with Shadow Claw, and a boosted Shadow Sneak has situational value in the late-game.

  • Grass: With Wood Hammer being boosted, Mimikyu OHKOes offensive Rotom-W.

  • Normal: While this makes Mimikyu far more vulnerable to Breloom, it is useful for catching other Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane off guard.

Corviknight.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Pivot Knight.description:
• Corviknight's fantastic typing makes it one of the best pivots in the metagame; it easily gets dangerous teammates such as Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult in.

  • Body Press versus Iron Head: Body Press has decent damage output and helps massively against common Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Kingambit. Meanwhile, Iron Head ensures that Corviknight will not be walled by Flutter Mane, Mimikyu, and Dragapult.

  • Taunt: Corviknight might not be fast, but it's fast enough to shut down most other defensive Pokemon with Taunt, such as Dondozo and Toxapex.

  • Brave Bird: Brave Bird can be difficult to fit in, but it's a fantastic response against Breloom, and means Corviknight doesn't have to be passive against Amoonguss and Brute Bonnet.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Corviknight's defensive typing is fantastic, so don't Terastallize too hastily, or else it'll lose to threats it normally checks.

  • Dragon: Dragon and Fairy weaknesses are devastating, but in the late-game, resisting Electric and Fire can give Corviknight new win conditions against old foes such as Rotom-W, and a shot to seriously damage Chi-Yu with Body Press. Just note that Modest Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu can still OHKO with Overheat.

  • Fighting: Getting STAB on Body Press can give Corviknight a surprisingly decent chance at cleaning weakened teams, with being able to 3HKO specially defensive Ting-Lu being a highlight.

  • Water: With Tera Water, Corviknight consistently survives all but Modest Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat, letting it deal serious damage with Body Press. It also gains a key resistance to Ice for Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur.

  • Flying: While this set doesn't always use Brave Bird, Tera Flying lets Corviknight keep its typing while using Roost, meaning Earthquake and Fissure can no longer hit Corviknight while its restoring health.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: This lets Corviknight wear down physical threats more quickly while pivoting.

  • Safety Goggles: Safety Goggles ensures Corviknight won't be impacted by Spore from Breloom, Amoonguss, or Brute Bonnet, regardless of having Taunt.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's consistent recovery can be quite helpful for taking repeated hits from Ruination when attempting to stall it out with Pressure.

Abilities

  • Mirror Armor: Mirror Armor's ability to punish Flutter Mane for using Mystical Fire makes it the best ability choice on Corviknight.

  • Pressure: Corviknight's excellent bulk makes Pressure a good alternative for stalling out foes such as Dondozo, and is particularly good at stalling out Ruination from Ting-Lu and Wo-Chien.

IronPress.description:
• Corviknight stands out as one of the best choices around for sweeping with Iron Defense and Body Press, thanks to its excellent typing and Roost.

  • Taunt: This lets Corviknight effectively shut down slower defensive Pokemon, such as Dondozo and Clodsire.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head helps Corviknight check Mimikyu more easily, especially if not running Rocky Helmet. It also prevents Corviknight from being walled by Flutter Mane and Dragapult.

  • U-turn: While U-turn with this set may seem strange, Corviknight is still a decent pivot even if it must give up Taunt.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Corviknight has a fantastic defensive typing, so only Terastallize if you need to win certain matchups, especially since it becomes vulnerable to Toxic.

  • Fighting: With a Fighting Tera type, Body Press is easier to sweep with, with many Ting-Lu variants now being 2HKOed by boosted Body Press.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Corviknight a way to resist both Chien-Pao's and Chi-Yu's most powerful STAB attacks, though Modest Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu can still OHKO with Overheat.

  • Dragon: A Dragon Tera type lets Corviknight resist common attacks aimed at it, such as Electric- and Fire-type attacks. However, the new weaknesses to Fairy and Dragon make this an especially reactive Terastallization.

  • Flying: A Flying Tera type lets Corviknight retain its Flying typing even when using Roost, making it a more reliable check to Fissure users such as Dondozo and Garganacl.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: The passive damage from Rocky Helmet against Mimikyu gives Corviknight a much easier time using Taunt over Iron Head.

  • Covert Cloak: When paired with Taunt, Covert Cloak makes Corviknight an effective Garganacl check, though note Corviknight will no longer drop Flutter Mane's Special Attack with Mirror Armor.

  • Safety Goggles: With Safety Goggles blocking Spore, this Corviknight is now an excellent check against most offensive Breloom, just watch out for the occasional Tera Fire Breloom.

  • Sitrus Berry versus Leftovers: Since this Corviknight attempts to sweep, Sitrus Berry's burst of quick recovery can make it less pressured to spend a turn using Roost. Leftovers on the other hand, will still keep healing Corviknight even after being hit by Ruination, so it can make sense with Pressure.

Abilities

  • Mirror Armor: Mirror Armor means Flutter Mane can't use Mystical Fire without getting its Special Attack dropped, unless Corviknight is holding Covert Cloak.

  • Pressure: Corviknight's ability to take powerful, low PP moves such as Close Combat after Iron Defense makes Pressure a viable alternative, in addition to giving Corviknight a better chance of dealing with Ruination from Ting-Lu and Wo-Chien effectively.

Bulk Up.description:
• With Bulk Up giving an Attack boost, Corviknight is free from having to use Body Press for good damage output, making it easier to run Taunt against defensive foes without fear of being walled by Ghost-types.

  • Iron Head versus Brave Bird: Iron Head reliably 2HKOs Chien-Pao without a boost, while Brave Bird is the only hope of 2HKOing Chi-Yu.

Other Options

  • Power Trip: Power Trip takes several boosts to get powerful, but it's Corviknight's best shot at dealing decent damage to Gholdengo. It's also an important aspect of Espathra Baton Pass teams, but Ting-Lu has made this team archetype much more difficult to use compared to past regulations.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Remember that most of Corviknight's good Tera types leave it vulnerable to Toxic, so Terastallize carefully and only win a win condition is clear.

  • Flying: This Tera type lets Corviknight retain its Flying typing while using Roost, meaning Fissure users such as Dondozo are much easier to handle.

  • Water: Tera Water is an effective tool against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, though note that Choice Specs Chi-Yu can OHKO with Tera Fire boosted Overheat.

  • Dragon: Once Fairy-, Ice-, and Dragon-types are out of the way, the Dragon Tera type allows Corviknight to get around Electric- and Fire-type attacks.

  • Dark: If using Power Trip, Tera Dark is highly recommended to boost its damage output.

Abilities

  • Mirror Armor: In addition to punishing Flutter Mane for using Mystical Fire when not using Covert Cloak, Mirror Armor also protects Corviknight from Charm, Chilling Water, and Intimidate.

  • Pressure: Pressure is a reasonable alternative for whittling down PP, which can be especially helpful against Ting-Lu's troublesome Ruination.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: When paired with Taunt, Corviknight can effectively take down Garganacl.

  • Safety Goggles: While Substitute and Taunt are effective against slower users of Spore like Amoonguss, Breloom's Speed means Safety Goggles are required to truly check it.

  • Sitrus Berry versus Leftovers: Sitrus Berry is preferred due to the quicker burst of recovery better fitting a sweeper, but Leftovers can work very well with Pressure in an attempt to out-stall Ruination.

Grimmsnarl.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Dual Screens.description:
• With Prankster and the movepool to use it, Grimmsnarl is one of the best dual screens setters, as it is useful for setting up dangerous sweepers such as Dragonite or Iron Valiant.

  • Parting Shot: Parting Shot is not only useful for dropping stats, but the pivoting action can let Grimmsnarl come in later to set up screens if it's in a bad matchup.

  • Thunder Wave: This is a reasonable alternative for crippling fast foes that may be problematic for sweeps.

  • Taunt: Taunt shuts down phazers and opposing Taunts that could stop the dual screens from being set up.

  • Spirit Break versus Foul Play: Hitting foes like Great Tusk and Roaring Moon makes Spirit Break a good offensive move. Alternatively, Foul Play is notable for breaking Gholdengo's Substitute and punishing physical setup sweepers.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Grimmsnarl should almost never Terastallize, since it's trying to support sweepers rather than deal serious damage on its own. Still, a Grass Tera type is a reasonable choice for blocking Spore from Breloom and Amoonguss.

Offensive.description: This set will be up for reservation once the analysis process for Series 2 begins.

Dragapult.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Physical Attacker.description:
• Dragapult's blistering Speed makes it a very effective hit-and-run attacker.

  • Phantom Force: This is risky due to the two turns making Dragapult vulnerable to Normal-types and surprise Terastallization, but it still makes an effective late-game cleaning move.

  • Sucker Punch: Despite Dragapult's dynamite Speed stat, Sucker Punch still makes sense to pick off common Choice Scarf holders like Gholdengo, and play around priority from other foes.

  • Shadow Ball: With a Naive nature, Shadow Ball is an easy way to 2HKO Gholdengo, Flutter Mane, and incoming Skeledirge.

Other Options

  • Dragon Dance: Dragon Dance is fairly difficult to set up without Focus Sash, and it can lead to coverage issues. That being said, outspeeding Pokemon that commonly have their Speed boosted via an item, such as Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and Iron Bundle, can lead to surprising win conditions.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragapult's cleaning capabilities are improved quite a bit by Terastallization, though it doesn't need to rely on it to be functional.

  • Dragon: Boosting the power of Dragon Darts makes Dragapult very effective at shredding through Focus Sash Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, in addition to removing the annoying Sucker Punch weakness.

  • Steel: Steel has a fantastic synergy with Dragapult's former typing, giving it a far better match-up against foes such as Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Mimikyu.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost is notable for letting Dragapult use a less risky STAB move in Tera Blast.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives a valuable Fairy-type resistance and is a more powerful tool against Steel-types at the cost of a Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Dragon-type immunity can help win Tera wars against foes like Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Roaring Moon.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting vastly improves Dragapult's match-up against Kingambit, Chi-Yu, Chien-Pao, and Choice Scarf Meowscarada.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band guarantees that Breloom is OHKOed through its Focus Sash with Dragon Darts, and gives a 75% shot to the same happening to Chien-Pao.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Sucker Punch a less risky option.

  • Focus Sash: Dragaoult's bulk isn't terrible, but Focus Sash will save it from the huge amount of top tier Pokemon that are capable of OHKOing it, such as Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Gholdengo.

  • Choice Scarf: This may seem like overkill, but Choice Scarf gives Dragapult the edge over Booster Energy users such as Iron Bundle, Roaring Moon, and Flutter Mane, and other Choice Scarf foes such Gholdengo.

Special Attacker.description:
• Despite the lower offensive stat, the higher base power of Dragapult's special attacks makes it a serious threat.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt is the recommended coverage move for hitting Corviknight and Dondozo hard.

  • U-turn: Even though it's weak, U-turn is a reasonable consideration for pivoting and breaking Mimikyu's Disguise.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Dragapult can use Terastallization to surprise its checks, the high power of Draco Meteor and good coverage Shadow Ball provides mean it isn't reliant on it to function.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon makes Draco Meteor nearly impossible to wall without a resistance, with even specially defensive Ting-Lu taking nearly 50% from it!

  • Fire: The Fairy-type resistance and powerful Flamethrower can make the Stealth Rock weakness worth it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel covers much of Dragapult's common weaknesses, and gives it a good Tera Blast to use against Fairy-types.

  • Ghost: Powering up Shadow Ball is perfect for cleaning up late-game, with only Normal-types and bulky resistances such as Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, and Garganacl taking it well.

  • Fighting: The resistance to Sucker Punch Tera Fighting provides can be key in stopping Chien-Pao and Kingambit.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy improves Dragapult's match-up against other Dragon-types, Great Tusk, and resists Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch.

Bulky Status.description:
• With usable bulk bolstered by Will-O-Wisp, this Dragapult can severely punish its weaker offensive checks, and surprise common users of Sucker Punch such as Kingambit and Chien-Pao.

  • Disable and Substitute: Disable makes Dragapult rely on Will-O-Wisp for Normal-types, but when combined with Substitute, it defeats Choice-locked foes and those that rely on one specific move to beat Dragapult.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor improves Dragapult against other Dragon-types, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Flamethrower: This lets Dragapult deal decent unconditional damage to Steel-types, with Kingambit being the biggest target.

  • Dragon Darts: With a Naive nature, Dragon Darts gives Dragapult a consequence-free Dragon-type attack and decent mixed attacking potential.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragapult's typing gives it a lot of weaknesses, so Terastallization can help it stick around much longer, though the lack of good recovery means this isn't always the correct choice.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Dragapult preforms better against Dark-types it may still struggle with after Will-O-Wisp, such as Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu.

  • Steel: Steel Tera type is great for general defense and Fairy-types such as Azumarill and Mimikyu.

Dual Screens.description:
• Dragapult's high Speed combined with Reflect and Light Screen make it an effective dual screens lead.

  • Curse: Curse reduces Dragapult's HP to get it off the field quickly once it has set up screens. It also forces opponents to use recovery moves or switch out, allowing Dragapult's teammates to get in and set up safely. Curse is Dragapult’s best option to bypass Substitute, Protect, and Mimikyu.

  • Shadow Ball: This breaks Focus Sash, hits Ghosts like Gholdengo and Flutter Mane that normally threaten it, and breaks Mimikyu's Disguise. Notably Gholdengo stops Curse with Good as Gold, making Dragapult totally helpless against it if it does not carry Shadow Ball.

  • Dragon Darts: Dragon Darts can be used for more power to make Dragapult more self-sufficient when it has to stay on the field, and breaks Focus Sash as well. Its dual-hit nature makes it bypass most Substitutes.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Will-O-Wisp can be used to cripple physical attackers. In tandem with Reflect, this can be a potent strategy to allow the next Pokemon to set up nearly risk-free.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: As a dual screens lead, Terastallizing can compromise its teammates sweeping abilities, so it should only be done in emergencies.

  • Ghost / Dragon: If you are in a bad spot, Ghost and Dragon power up its STAB move of choice.

  • Steel: A defensive typing like Steel can allow Dragapult to survive certain moves like Iron Bundle's Ice Beam, boosted Cloyster's Icicle Spear, and boosted Baxcalibur's Glaive Rush and retaliate.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type is useful for enemy Infiltrator Dragapult's Dragon Darts.

Items

  • Focus Sash: While Light Clay is standard, Focus Sash nearly guarantees setting at least one screen without having to Terastallize, in the event Dragapult leads off against Choice Scarf users like Gholdengo, Hydreigon, and Meowscarada.

Urshifu.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Dancing Bear.description:
• After boosting its power through Swords Dance, Urshifu-S can leverage its complementary set of STAB moves to smash through the opposing team.

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Close Combat offers Urshifu-S the maximum sweeping power. However, if using Focus Sash or a defensive Tera type, Drain Punch is handy for restoring enough health after a boost to prevent priority attacks from easily knocking Urshifu-S out.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Typically, Urshifu-S will utilize Terastallization offensively to bolster the power of its Dark-type moves, but this set can benefit more from a defensive Tera type in order to stay on the field longer and make use of its ability to switch moves, which the Choice-locked attacker set cannot.

  • Dark: Tera Dark strengthens Wicked Blow and allows Urshifu-S to power its way through opposing walls. After a Swords Dance boost, Tera Dark-boosted Wicked Blow is a guaranteed OHKO on physically defensive Zapdos, while Close Combat has a high chance to OHKO Ting-Lu.

  • Poison: This Tera type allows Urshifu-S to survive common Fairy-type and Fighting-type attacks that would otherwise threaten to KO Urshifu-S.

  • Ghost: For Focus Sash sets, Tera Ghost blocks Normal-type priority from the likes of Dragonite, Ogerpon formes, or Entei from picking Urshifu-S off.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash can help Urshifu-S more reliably get off a Swords Dance boost. It can survive hits from Fairy-types like Flutter Mane as well as powerful special attackers like Iron Bundle. With an Adamant nature, Urshifu-S can reliably beat offensive Tera Fairy Flutter Mane with Wicked Blow + Sucker Punch, provided Focus Sash is still intact.

  • Black Glasses versus Punching Glove: Both items boost the power of Urshifu-S's signature move, Wicked Blow. Black Glasses gives a slightly stronger boost, while Punching Glove helps to protect Urshifu-S from contact effects like Rocky Helmet and Zapdos's Static. Urshifu-S is much less vulnerable to these effects compared to Urshifu-R due to lack of a multi-hit move. Finally, despite the name, Punching Glove does not boost the power of Sucker Punch, while Black Glasses does.

One Punch!.description:
• Urshifu-S can punch holes in the opposing team with its strong combination of STAB moves. Additionally, Urshifu-S can benefit from team preview against opponents who mistakenly assume it to be Urshifu-R.

  • U-turn: This move allows Urshifu-S to pivot out of bad matchups and scout out potential Tera types.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head can cover opposing Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, which threaten Urshifu-S.

  • Poison Jab: Poison Jab is Urshifu-S's strongest option against Primarina and the rare Azumarill.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Generally, Urshifu-S will utilize Terastallization offensively in order to extend the reach of its signature move Wicked Blow.

  • Dark: Tera Dark allows Urshifu-S to supercharge its Wicked Blow and muscle its way past various physically defensive foes. Notably, it gives Choice Band Urshifu-S a high chance to 2HKO Dondozo through Leftovers recovery, giving Urshifu-S an advantage against many stall teams.

  • Poison: This is a defensive Tera type that removes Fairy-type and Fighting-type weaknesses, and also absorbs Toxic Spikes.

  • Steel: This Tera type allows Urshifu-S to resist Fairy-type attacks and additionally boosts the power of Iron Head.

Urshifu-Rapid-Strike.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive.description:
• With its excellent typing and Surging Strikes breaking through Focus Sash, Urshifu-R is among the premier physical attackers of the metagame!

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Close Combat's power makes it worth the defensive drops most of the time, but consider Drain Punch if using Swords Dance. Even if running Focus Sash, Urshifu-R can restore enough health with boosted Drain Punch that it can save itself from being chipped off by weak priority moves, such as Aqua Jet from Primarina and opposing Urshifu-R.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet is perfect for picking off weakened foes that are faster than Urshifu-R, such as Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, but this does come at the cost of coverage or a setup move.

  • Swords Dance: With Swords Dance, Urshifu-R becomes far more difficult to wall, with Surging Strikes now 2HKOing even the bulkiest Cresselia.

  • Ice Punch versus Ice Spinner: While Ice Spinner is more powerful when not using Punching Glove, Ice Punch can still make sense because it reveals less information about Urshifu-R's set.

  • Thunder Punch: Thunder Punch is overpowered by Close Combat even against foes that are weak to it, but it can potentially 3HKO Dondozo when using Tera Electric and Punching Glove and is a safer option against opposing Urshifu-R than Close Combat. This is also Urshifu-R's most powerful attack against Primarina.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: Jolly is preferred for outspeeding Landorus-T and Mimikyu, key targets of Surging Strikes. Adamant can make sense if using Swords Dance and Aqua Jet together, having a better chance of sweeping late-game against fast threats that often run some bulk investment, such as Flutter Mane and Choice Band Chein-Pao.

Other Options

  • Bulk Up: Bulk Up takes advantage of Urshifu-R's underrated physical bulk, though it will fail to wallbreak defensive foes like Cresselia as easily.

  • Trailblaze: While difficult to fit in coverage-wise, Trailblaze's Speed boost can be a shocking win condition considering Urshifu-R's decent Speed, letting it outspeed even Iron Bundle!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Urshifu-R is able to function perfectly fine without Terastallization, though it has both offensive and defensive uses for it.

  • Water: The Tera Water boost to Surging Strikes makes Urshifu-R even more difficult to wall, with even Ting-Lu that lack Sitrus Berry being OHKOed by +2 Surging Strikes. It also makes Aqua Jet a more effective cleaning move.

  • Poison: Tera Poison gifts Urshifu-R a key Fairy and Fighting resistance, in addition to absorbing Toxic Spikes.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a strong defensive option for Urshifu-R, letting it take on Fairy, Grass, Flying, and Psychic attacks that normally threaten to OHKO it. It also means Iron Bundle will no longer OHKO Urshifu-R with Freeze-Dry. However unlike Tera Poison, it's an issue when fighting opposing Urshifu formes.

  • Electric: When paired with Thunder Punch, this is Urshifu-R's best shot of breaking through Primarina and wearing down Dondozo, in addition to giving it a useful Electric-type resistance and paralysis immunity.

Items

  • Punching Glove: Punching Gloves protects Urshifu-R from taking devastating damage by hitting Rocky Helmet or Rough Skin with Surging Strikes, in addition to boosting other punching moves. Just note that these moves will now be blocked by Protect and other variants.

  • Focus Sash: While it might seem strange with Urshifu-R's good physical bulk, Focus Sash lets it survive extremely powerful physical moves such as Chien-Pao's Electric Tera Blast and Landorus-T's Flying Tera Blast and powerful special attackers such Flutter Mane and Latios.

  • Protective Pads: Protective Pads are a niche alternative to Punching Glove, not boosting any attacks but letting Surging Strikes bypass Protective moves from foes like Garganacl.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 20 Atk / 156 Def / 36 SpD / 52 Spe with Impish: This bulky EV spread allows Urshifu-R to survive a wide variety of useful attacks, usually allowing to survive Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's super effective Tera Blast and allowing Tera Water or Tera Electric Urshifu-R to survive Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast. The Speed EVs outspeed Adamant Breloom, and the Attack EVs give Urshifu-R a high chance to OHKO Focus Sash Chien-Pao with Tera Water Surging Strikes.

Choice Item Attacker.description:
• Thanks to U-turn, Urshifu-R is a strong option for a Choice item pivot.

  • Ice Punch versus Ice Spinner: Urshifu-R greatly appreciates having a move that prevents it from being walled by Dragonite. While Ice Spinner is more powerful, Ice Punch reveals less about Urshifu-R's set.

  • Thunder Punch: If using Tera Electric, Thunder Punch deals good damage to Dondozo and is its best way of dealing big damage to Primarina,

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet is a good way for Choice Band Urshifu-R to clean up weakened teams.

  • Choice Scarf versus Choice Band: Choice Scarf transforms Urshifu-R into an effective revenge killer, outspeeding important threats such as Chien-Pao and even Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle that lack Booster Energy. Choice Band, on the other hand, makes Urshifu-R a far more effective wallbreaker, letting it deal massive damage to foes like Tera Fairy Porygon2 and Ting-Lu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Urshifu-R has both offensive and defensive uses for Terastallization, but it isn't vital for it to function.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Surging Strikes a healthy boost in power, letting Choice Scarf Urshifu-R OHKO Focus Sash Chien-Pao and Choice Band Urshifu-R 2HKO Tera Fairy Porygon2.

  • Electric: Not only does Tera Electric make Thunder Punch a good option against Primarina and Dondozo, it also gives Urshifu-R a vital immunity to paralysis.

  • Poison: Tera Poison offers a vital Fairy and Grass resistances to combat Flutter Mane and Ogerpon formes, and makes Urshifu-R a decent absorber of Toxic Spikes.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a great defensive option, letting Urshifu-R survive Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry and Flutter Mane's Moonblast. However unlike Tera Poison, it does poorly against opposing Urshifu formes and Ogerpon formes

Assault Vest Lure.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Purpose: This set uses Assault Vest to survive foes that would normally revenge kill Urshifu-R, such as Choice Specs Chi-Yu, and uses Terastallization to even flip the tables on Flutter Mane.

  • EV Spread: The Attack investment matches the same Attack stat as Jolly Urshifu-R to conceal this set's true nature, while having enough Speed to outspeed Jolly Dragonite.

  • Tera Type: Tera Poison provides the extremely important Fairy to avoid a 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast. Tera Steel also works but has a worse match-up against opposing Urshifu formes. Tera Water doesn't lure as well, but does more damage overall.

Kleavor.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

Timber!.description:
• While Stone Axe's accuracy can be off-putting if reliable Stealth Rock setting is a must, Kleavor's unique form of role compression makes it an effective alternative to more defensive setters.

  • Night Slash: Night Slash is Kleavor's best way of dealing big damage to Gholdengo and is a reliable option against weakened Flutter Mane.

  • Feint: Feint's increased priority over other priority attacks make it a great way to pick off Focus Sash foes like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle. Kleavor being faster means it'll even outpace Dragonite's Extreme Speed!

  • Trailblaze: While Kleavor isn't known for easily sweeping, it's fast enough to outspeed Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle after Trailblaze, and Trailblaze is especially useful when using Tera Grass against Urshifu-R.

  • X-Scissor versus Close Combat: While X-Scissor's coverage on paper isn't impressive, the boost from Sharpness lets it 2HKO Cresselia and Ting-Lu that lack Sitrus Berry.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: If using Feint, Adamant is the best nature choice for maximizing the amount of targets it can pick off after using Stone Axe. For Trailblaze variants, Jolly is preferred to outspeed Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and even Dragapult. Jolly also ensures it outspeeds all Gholdengo that lack Choice Scarf.

Other Options

  • Tailwind: Tailwind is an unusual move for Battle Stadium Singles, but Kleavor's disposable nature with Focus Sash can make it justified as a move to use before fainting.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Kleavor's entry hazard setting nature may not make Terastallization seem important, but its archnemesis, Urshifu-R, makes it worth considering, since it can threaten to OHKO Kleavor through its Focus Sash.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a good response against Urshifu-R, not only resisting its deadly Surging Strikes, but also boosting Trailblaze.

  • Water: Tera Water isn't as offensively useful, but it's still a good way to resist both Surging Strikes and powerful Steel-type attacks like Heatran's Flash Cannon.

  • Bug: Tera Bug isn't great defensively, but it allows Kleavor to 2HKO even Impish Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu with X-Scissor.

  • Ghost: Despite Kleavor's resistance to Extreme Speed, Dragonite often picks off Focus Sash variants, so Tera Ghost is a huge shock for it, though a rather risky Terastallization choice. It also blocks Rapid Spin from Great Tusk, even if it's not particularly common.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes Kleavor a good lead against a wide variety of foes such as Iron Bundle and lets it easily justify the maximum Speed investment needed to outspeed Gholdengo.

  • Assault Vest: Kleavor's special bulk is mediocre at best, but Stone Axe's entry hazard setting powers can justify using Assault Vest to survive certain attacks that are otherwise impossible without Focus Sash.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • 28 HP / 204 Atk / 4 Def / 204 SpD / 68 Spe with Adamant: This more specially bulky spread usually survives Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast, and Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while outspeeding Garchomp after one use of Trailblaze.

  • 28 HP / 108 Atk / 4 Def / 204 SpD / 164 Spe with Jolly: This spread has enough Speed to outspeed Iron Bundle after using Trailblaze once while usually surviving Timid Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane, Non-Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, and Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 140 HP / 52 Atk / 4 Def / 244 SpD / 68 Spe with Adamant: This more extreme spread usually lets Kleavor survive even Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain, almost always avoids a 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse, and avoids an OHKO from Adamant Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while still outspeeding Garchomp after one use of Trailblaze.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: While very rare, Cute Charm Enamorus can potentially impact Kleavor, meaning there are no drawbacks to using a female gender.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Kleavor has a very unique niche of being a decent revenge killing pivot that can set up Stealth Rock at the same time!

  • Night Slash: Night Slash is Kleavor's best move against Gholdengo, making it highly recommended, since Kleavor outspeeds it.

  • X-Scissor versus Close Combat: Despite offering less coverage, X-Scissor's sheer power with Sharpness makes it a great option, dealing heavy damage to Cresselia and Ting-Lu and being a strong cleaning option. Close Combat isn't as reliable, but it can let Kleavor more reliably revenge kill threats such as Tera Normal Dragonite and Ursaluna. It's also Kleavor's easiest option to use for revenge killing Urshifu-R.

Other Options

  • Aerial Ace: Aerial Ace isn't particularly strong despite the boost from Sharpness, but it does deal massive damage to Urshifu-R, especially if using the easily accessible Tera Flying.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is still a major concern, this set's other purpose means that setting up Stealth Rock is required for success, making Terastallization less important.

  • Bug: If using X-Scissor, Tera Bug lets Kleavor 2HKO even Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu, making for an effective late-game cleaner.

  • Grass: If Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is a major concern, Tera Grass is a decent way around it in addition to getting an advantage against Breloom leads.

  • Flying: Tera Flying should only be used with Aerial Ace, which gives Kleavor a 75% chance of OHKOing Urshifu-R after taking Stealth Rock damage.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare and not important, but it does mean that a female gender is slightly preferred on Kleavor.

Ursaluna.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

Guts Attacker.description:
• With Flame Orb, Guts, and an incredible Attack stat, Ursaluna is an extremely brutal wallbreaker!

  • Earthquake versus Headlong Rush: Earthquake is an easier move to recommend, avoiding contact with Rocky Helmet and preserving Ursaluna's hefty bulk. However, Headlong Rush's extra power can better fit the playstyles of Ursaluna that may aim for a sweep rather than just wallbreaking, such as Trick Room and Jolly variants.

  • Drain Punch versus Close Combat: Drain Punch doesn't offer much extra coverage, but it's Ursaluna's only decent way of restoring health. Close Combat's sheer power does make it decent coverage though and can particularly punish Heatran for Terastallizing into a Grass-type.

  • Ice Punch versus Play Rough: Once Ursaluna is burned, Ice Punch will deal so much damage to Dragonite that even the bulkiest sets can not restore all their health with Roost. Play Rough isn't nearly as effective against Dragonite, but when used with Tera Fairy, Ursaluna can now OHKO Urshifu-R before Flame Orb kicks in.

  • Protect: While Ursaluna is powerful, it needs the Flame Orb activation to truly wallbreak, so Protect can help when switching it in isn't easy.

  • Bulk Up versus Swords Dance: Bulk Up is the prefered setup move for making Ursaluna difficult to revenge kill with physical attacks, but Swords Dance does offer some truly absurd wallbreaking potential, allowing Ursaluna to OHKO even physically defensive Ting-Lu with Facade! Swords Dance can also be a better fit on Trick Room teams due to the limited amount of turns Ursaluna has to sweep.

  • Trailblaze: If using Jolly Ursaluna, Trailblaze lets it outspeed key threats such as Zapdos, both Urshifu formes, Mimikyu, and even Speed tie with Timid Thundurus-T!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Ursaluna benefits from Terastallization, but it's not integral to its wallbreaking prowess.

  • Normal: Beyond getting rid of Ground's annoying weaknesses, Tera Normal turns Ursaluna into an even more fearsome wallbreaker,

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy does a great job of protecting Ursaluna from powerful Fighting-type attacks and Dragonite's Outrage.

  • Ghost: While Tera Ghost does make the matchup against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo worse, the Fighting immunity can turn a match around in the blink of an eye.

  • Water: Tera Water is the prime Tera type to use when in need of an Ice and Water resistance, which is helpful against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fighting: If using Drain Punch, Tera Fighting is a reasonable option for restoring even more health, at the cost of being rather weak against Flutter Mane.

  • Grass: Tera Gass is a niche option that lets Ursaluna deal extra damage with Trailblaze while resisting Water-type attacks and taking Spore before Flame Orb activates.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • Brave and a 0 Speed IV versus Adamant: On a Trick Room team, this lets Ursaluna underspeed some major Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Dondozo. However, some Trick Room teams may still prefer Adamant to outspeed such slow Pokemon if they also function outside Trick Room.

  • 140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 SpD with Adamant or Brave: This more specially defensive EV spread survives some powerful attacks even after burn damage, including Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast, Thundurus-T's Grass Knot, Timid Greninja's Hydro Pump, and Modest Chi-Yu's Overheat.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed may seem strange on such a slow Pokemon, but Ursaluna makes fantastic use of it, making Trailblaze viable due to outspeeding even offensive variants of Zapdos after a boost and letting it wallbreak common Pokemon that often don't invest in enough Speed such as Dragonite and Heatran.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: Since Ursaluna uses contact moves, a female gender will prevent it from being attracted to the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

Bulky Bear.description:
• Ursaluna's great overall bulk makes it a good choice for either spreading Yawn or setting up Bulk Up.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best Attack against both Urshifu formes, which are common switch-ins to bulkier Ursaluna sets.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is the most reliable option for dealing big damage to Dragonite, but Avalanche deals so much damage if Ursaluna is attacked that even Defensive Mulsticale Dragonite is unable to Roost back to full health.

  • Protect: Protect has great synergy with Yawn and Leftovers, letting Ursaluna put foes to sleep with less risk to itself.

  • Drain Punch: In addition to being a decent option for Ursaluna to restore its health with, it can be especially effective with Bulk Up, making Ursaluna difficult to take down.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt's a great support move for shutting down common support Pokemon like Ting-Lu, but it's rather difficult to fit in.

  • Flame Orb and Facade: Using Guts on a bulkier set may be very counter-intuitive, but with Yawn, this can make Ursaluna very difficult to check.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna is fully capable of functioning without Terastallization, but with it, it has far fewer weaknesses.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a fantastic response against the Fighting-type attacks that threaten Ursaluna and means Choice Band Dragonite can no longer 2HKO with Outrage.

  • Water: Tera Water is Ursaluna's best shot against Chien-Pao thanks to the Icicle Crash resistance, and it helps against Urshifu-R as well.

  • Fighting: If using Bulk Up and Drain Punch, Tera Fighting gives Ursaluna a prime opportunity to keep restoring its health, though at the cost of doing far worse against Flutter Mane and Mimikyu.

Abilities

  • Guts: Guts is a fantastic option for punishing Will-O-Wisp from foes like Rotom-W and works well for punishing Toxic Spikes.

  • Bulletproof: This more niche option gives Ursaluna immunity to several major moves, such as Focus Blast, Bullet Seed, Sludge Bomb, and Shadow Ball when Terastallized, particularly helping against Gholdengo if using Tera Water or Fighting.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • *140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 SpD with Adamant This more specially bulky spread allows Ursaluna to take on major special threats, avoiding KOs from the likes of Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain, and Timid Greninja's Hydro Pump.

  • 252 HP / 20 Def / 236 SpD with Careful: This spread allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Leftovers recovery.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Maximizing Ursaluna's physical defense means Tera Water will usually avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Urshifu's Close Combat after Leftovers recovery.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: A female gender is slightly optimal for avoiding infatuation from the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

Assault Vest.description:
• Ursaluna's excellent power and bulk make it a good, if unexpected, user of Assault Vest.

  • Drain Punch: Drain Punch's bit of extra healing is useful even without being a STAB move.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best option for punishing Urshifu-R switching in.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is preferred due to its reliable base power, but Avalanche can threaten to damage Multiscale Dragonite past the ability to recover HP back with Roost.

  • Facade: While Facade is rather weak without the reliability of Flame Orb, it's a devestating way to punish status moves and Toxic Spikes.

  • EV Spread: The bulk investment allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage. Some other Special Attacks it takes on include avoiding a 2HKO from defensive Rotom-W's Hydro Pump, avoiding a 2HKO from two consecutive Make It Rains from Choice Specs Gholdengo, and avoiding an OHKO from Tera Water Iron Bundle.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization isn't needed for Ursaluna to make good use of Assault Vest, but it can help against some common physical threats.

  • Water: Tera Water covers Ursaluna's big Water and Ice weaknesses, helping a great deal against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Ursaluna's best choice for a Fighting resistance, in addition to helping against powerful users of Outrage such as Choice Band Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Ghost: If using Bulletproof, Tera Ghost is a good way to flip the tables on Fighting-types without compromising Ursaluna against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Guts: Even if Guts isn't guaranteed to be activated, switching Ursaluna into status moves like Will-O-Wisp can turn it into a wallbreaker in a pinch.

  • Bulletproof: Bulletproof gives Ursaluna a very useful immunity to some attacks that hit it hard, such as Bullet Seed and Focus Blast. The Sludge Bomb and Shadow Ball immunity is also fantastic when Terastallized.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: While Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare, there's no drawback in using a female gender to become immune to this ability.

Ursaluna-Bloodmoon.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Freddy (Offensive).description:
• With its great bulk, power, and coverage thanks to high-powered Normal-type STAB moves and amazing ability in Mind’s Eye, Ursaluna-B is a formidable special attacker.

  • Blood Moon: Blood Moon gives Ursaluna-B incredibly high neutral damage. It's a great way to cover a switch or predicted Terastallization, but it requires some forethought to maximize efficiency because it cannot be used on consecutive turns.

  • Vacuum Wave: Vacuum Wave is highly valuable for revenge killing foes, notably hitting Chien-Pao. It can hit Gholdengo due to Mind's Eye.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power gives great coverage against the Steel-types that resist Blood Moon, making Ursaluna-B nearly unwallable except by non-grounded Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Hyper Voice: Hyper Voice is a more spammable Normal-type STAB move that can bypass Substitute, allowing Ursaluna-B to thwart attempts to Substitute stall out Blood Moon, like Tera Garganacl.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna-B often uses Terastallization to compensate for its lackluster defensive typing; however, it is often capable of functioning without Tera. Because many different Tera types are viable on it, it can play guessing games with opponents.

  • Normal: Tera Normal removes all weaknesses associated with Ursaluna-B’s Ground typing and boosts Blood Moon to phenomenal levels of power, making it ideal on Trick Room teams.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy allows Ursaluna-B to handle the Urshifu formes and Choice Band Dragon-types like Dragonite and Gouging Fire better while generally being a very solid defensive Tera type.

  • Poison: Tera Poison improves Ursaluna-B’s matchup against Flutter Mane, all Ogerpon formes' Horn Leech, and all Urshifu formes, while preventing Toxic from wearing Ursaluna-B down.

  • Water: Tera Water allows Ursaluna-B to fare better against the likes of Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest remedies Ursaluna-B's middling Special Defense, allowing this slow but hard-hitting Pokemon to survive longer.

  • Silk Scarf: Silk Scarf can be used instead of Assault Vest to boost the power of Ursaluna-B’s Normal-type STAB attacks, making it more difficult to switch into, though this makes match-ups against Special Attackers like Flutter Mane shakier.

  • Life Orb: If using Ursaluna-B on a Trick Room team, Life Orb can be worth the recoil for the highest possible chance of sweeping.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash may sound absurd with Ursaluna-B's bulk, but it can allow more offensive variants to turn the tables on extremely powerful Special Attackers like Choice Specs Chi-Yu, and more easily justify faster EV spreads.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • 36 HP / 228 SpA / 244 SpD with Modest: This spread survives an opposing Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Tera Normal Blood Moon.

  • 100 HP / 164 SpA / 244 SpD with Modest: This spread survives Timid Tera Water Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, even if Ursaluna-B doesn't Terastallize!

  • 244 HP / 52 Def / 196 SpA / 12 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This spread will never be OHKOed by Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes unless it Terastallizes.

Other Item EV Spreads

  • 148 HP / 4 Def / 132 SpA / 220 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This EV spread gives Ursaluna-B enough bulk to survive Tera boosted Choice Specs Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast on all but the highest damage roll, as well as the same odds for surviving Jolly Urshifu-R's Close Combat. If used with paralysis support, 32 EVs can be moved from Special Attack to Speed to outspeed paralyzed Modest Chi-Yu.

** 20 HP / 4 Def / 172 SpA / 60 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid** This outspeeds up to -1 Speed Garchomp, and also often outspeeds Pokemon that focus on bulk such as Dragonite, Scizor, and Primarina. The defensive EVs survive Choice Specs Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Life Orb Adamant Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword if Ursaluna-B sticks with Tera Normal.

Hibernation (Yawn).description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • This set uses Yawn to punish Pokemon that try to commonly take advantage of Blood Moon's cool-down turn, such as Dragon Dance Dragonite.

  • EV Spread: This spread survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera-boosted Moonblast, as well as Jolly Urshifu-R's Close Combat.

Smarter than the Average Bear (Calm Mind.description:
• With its immense defensive profile and access to reliable recovery, Ursaluna-B lends itself very well to a Calm Mind set.

  • Blood Moon: Even though the cool down time can be annoying for a Calm Mind set, the massive amount of power is still strongly recommended for being able to OHKO Urshifu-R without a boost using the given EV spread.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt can be used to shut down utility moves and attempts to stall out Ursaluna-B from the likes of Cresselia and slow Dragonite.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus berry allows Ursaluna-B to recover a significant chunk of health, which can be useful to set up boosts against special attackers. Of particular note is

  • Leftovers: Leftovers improves Ursaluna-B's general longevity.

  • Kee Berry: Kee Berry boosts Ursaluna-B's physical bulk, allowing it to keep pace with physical threats such as Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite its immense bulk, Ursaluna-B’s typing leaves it vulnerable to many common attacks, so a good defensive Tera type is essential for survivability and durability.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides a good defensive typing that synergizes well with Ursaluna-B's natural weaknesses, allowing it to stick around.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants an immunity to Toxic, Making Toxic Spikes less of an issue. It also grants a Fighting resistance, allowing it to better handle Urshifu.

  • Normal: Tera Normal boosts the power of Blood Moon, which improves the matchup against opposing Calm Mind Flutter Mane. It leaves only a Fighting weakness, making Ursaluna-B quite hard to KO.

  • Water: Tera Water aids against both Chien-Pao and Choice Specs Gholdengo, in addition to being a great defensive typing in general.

Offensive.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 244 Atk / 68 SpD / 252 Spe: This spread should be used with Assault Vest, avoiding a OHKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Manes Shadow Ball, which can potentially be an early game upset!

  • This is the set to be used on Drizzle Teams, with Life Orb being the preferred item for this.

  • Tera Types: Water and Ghost are better for late-game sweeping, but consider Tera Fairy for resisting Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch.

Agility.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Substitute: This is for punishing attempts to revenge kill with Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S. It can also be used with Custap Berry to get one powerful priority attack.

Sneasler.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

GottaGoFast (Unburden Sweeper).description:
• With its good Speed tier and access to Unburden, Sneasler is one of the most potent cleaners in the metagame.

  • Dire Claw: Dire Claw is Sneasler’s preferred Poison STAB move due to its highly disruptive secondary effects, making it a very difficult move to switch into, even for Pokemon that wall it like Dondozo.

  • Fake Out: With a Normal Gem, Fake Out offers both good chip damage and the ability to safely activate Unburden.

  • Swords Dance: While it can be difficult to fit and somewhat risky to go for, Swords Dance allows Sneasler to increase its damage output and clean through teams more reliably.

  • Acrobatics - Acrobatics is a natural pairing with Unburden, providing a massively powerful Flying-type attack once Sneasler’s item is used.

  • Shadow Claw: Shadow Claw is an option to allow Sneasler to better handle otherwise problematic foes, such as Gholdengo.

  • Female Optimization: With the presence of Cute Charm Enamorus, it is recommended that physical attackers be female to avoid potential infatuation upon attacking Enamorus.

Items

  • Normal Gem: When combined with Fake Out, this is Sneasler’s safest way to activate Unburden.

  • White Herb: While less easily activated, not relying on a specific move to activate Unburden allows Sneasler to diversify its move selection more, becoming more of a threat.

EV Spreads

  • 92 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD/ 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread allows Sneasler to outspeed up to Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle well as Choice Scarfed Dragapult once Unburden is active without compromising on Power.

  • 76 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Adamant: This spread sacrifices some Speed to survive Jolly Urshifu-R’s Surging Strikes and and Modest Gholdengo’s Make It Rain, at the cost of no longer outspeeding Choice Scarf Dragapult with Unburden.

  • 60 HP / 228 Atk / 60 Def / 4 SpD / 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread survives Jolly Urshifu-R’s Surging Strikes and Modest Gholdengo’s Make It Rain without compromising on Speed; however, it loses out on immediate power.

Tera Types

  • Flying-type: Tera Flying gives Sneasler an immunity to Ground-type attacks, allowing it to set up on foes such as Landorus while also boosting the power of Acrobatics even further.

  • Ghost-type: Tera Ghost grants Sneasler an immunity to Extreme Speed, notably allowing it to more consistently beat Dragonite.

  • Ice-type: When used alongside Tera Blast, Tera Ice allows Sneasler to more reliably beat foes like Landorus-T and Dragonite.

Meowscarada.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Focus Sash.description:
• With its good Speed and wide movepool, Meowscarada makes for a potent lead.

  • Triple Axel: Triple Axel prevents Meowscarada from getting set-up on by Dragonite, and deals massive damage to Landorus-T and Roaring Moon.

  • Sucker Punch: Sucker Punch allows Meowscarada to better handle fast and priority using foes such as Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Bullet Punch Metagross.

  • Toxic Spikes: Meowscarada is an excellent offensive choice to lay Toxic Spikes, since it puts immense pressure on Ting-Lu, Urshifu-R, and Ursaluna-B leads.

  • Taunt: Thanks to its good Speed, Meowscarada makes particularly excellent use of Taunt, shutting down other entry hazard leads such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon. It's also the best Meowscarada can muster against Archaludon, though beware of Body Press.

  • Protean versus Overgrow: Protean offers the most offensive flexibility, and is especially useful on Triple Axel sets to put Tera Flying Choice Scarf Landorus-T into Sucker Punch's KO range. For more supportive sets with Toxic Spikes, Overgrow is preferred to keep STAB on its attacks after it uses its support moves.

Other Options

  • Play Rough: While Triple Axel deals with most Dragon-types better, Play Rough can be a huge upset against Urshifu-S!

  • Low Kick versus Brick Break: Low Kick is worth considering if your team struggles with Kingambit, but Brick Break will deal far more damage to Chi-Yu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Meowscarada has very little use for Terastallization, only using it in late-game situations where it can sweep.

  • Grass: When paired with an Overgrow boost, Tera Grass lets Flower Trick deal a huge amount of damage.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar is the more flexible option for late-game sweeping. Just remember that moves only get the double BP boost if they match Meowscarada's current typing.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost saves Meowscarada from Normal-type priority, which can flip the match on unsuspecting Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, or Entei!

CRITTY CAT.description:
• With its good Attack, Speed, and access to Flower Trick and Knock Off, Meowscarada is a potent cleaner that is also hard to switch into.

  • Flower Trick: With its guaranteed critical hit, Flower Trick is a dangerous cleaning move once resistances to it have been sufficiently chipped.
