  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Flamigo outspeeds major threats such as Dragapult and Hydreigon, making it a more effective late-game cleaner.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Flamigo deal massive damage, giving it a shot at 2HKOing Skeledirge with Close Combat.

Dondozo.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

OHKO Fisher.description:
• With immense bulk, Yawn, and Unaware, Dondozo is not only an impressive defensive Pokemon, but one of the most dangerous OHKO fishers in the game.

  • Wave Crash: Despite the recoil, Wave Crash is the preferred option over Liquidation in most cases, purely for the damage output.

  • Protect: Protect is not only useful for scouting for unexpected Tera types, but pairs well with Yawn and Leftovers to give Dondozo more longevity.

  • Rest and Sleep Talk: If Leftovers isn't possible to use, these two move are an alternative way to keep Dondozo healthy.

  • Avalanche: Avalanche can be used to deal more consistent damage against Dragon-types.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake deals massive damage to Magnezone, and punishes some Tera Electric Pokemon that may attempt to mess with Dondozo, such as Baxcalibur and Chien-Pao.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Dondozo's defensive typing is fantastic, so Terastallization is only needed in rather rare situations.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type is useful enough for covering Dondozo's weaknesses, and the Spore immunity makes it capable of beating Breloom and Brute Bonnet too.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type lets Dondozo take on powerful Dragon-type attacks much more easily, and is just a good defensive typing in general.

  • Flying: Flying may seem like an odd Tera type, but it can lead to your Dondozo winning mirror matches thanks to the Fissure immunity.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP versus 252 HP: If using Leftovers, running 244 HP will give Dondozo one extra HP of recovery, which is easy to take advantage of with Protect. However, if not using Leftovers, 252 HP is better for taking less damage from Stealth Rock.

  • 244 HP / 148 Def / 116 SpD with Impish: This EV spread makes Dondozo extremely likely to avoid a 2HKO from Adamant Baxcalibur's Electric Tera Blast with Leftovers recovery, while still giving Dondozo decent Special Defense.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Impish: This more extreme spread helps against powerful Tera users, with the ability to avoid a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Electric Tera Blast or Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult's Dragon Darts with Leftovers. This comes at the cost of being much more vulnerable to weaker special attackers.

  • 252 Def / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: With Dondozo's massive HP stat, it's still able to take physical hits fairly well with this spread, while now avoiding a 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast if it lacks an offensive boosting item.

BIG FLOPPA (Assault Vest).description:
• Dondozo's good power and bulk lend it nicely to an Assault Vest set, and is particularly good at punishing otherwise troublesome special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu

  • Avalanche: Avalanche punishes Flying- and Dragon-types with super effective coverage.

  • Body Press: This is valuable Fighting-type coverage for most foes that would otherwise be a good switch in to Dondozo, such as Meowscarada, Wo-Chien, Magnezone, Kingambit, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fissure: Fissure allows Dondozo to potentially cheese its way through something that might otherwise wall it.

  • Heavy Slam: Dondozo is heavy enough to deal serious damage to Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Flutter Mane. Just note that Chien-Pao is shockingly heavy, so Body Press or Wave Crash is preferred against that threat.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake offers more reliable Ground-type coverage at the cost of not being an instant KO like Fissure.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization will help against some specific checks to Dondozo, it's typing is great for general purposes.

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Dondozo’s usual set of weaknesses and allows it to absorb spore from the likes of Amoonguss, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy grants Dondozo a new set of resistances to take advantage of with its phenomenal bulk and also grants it a powerful STAB to hit Dragon- and Fighting-types with if it runs Tera Blast.

  • Steel: When paired with Heavy Slam, Dondozo can now 2HKO Iron Bundle without Stealth Rock support, in addition to gaining a fantastic defensive typing.

  • Ground: Terastallizing into a Ground-type allows Dondozo to block the Electric-type attacks commonly aimed at it while also giving it STAB on Earthquake.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon gives Dondozo a resistance to both Electric- and Water-type attacks, allowing it to stand up to Rotom-W much better.

EV Spreads

  • 44 HP / 212 Atk / 252 SpD with Careful: This EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse.

  • 252 Atk / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This more offensive spread makes sense if you have better options for Chi-Yu.

Curse.description:
• With Unaware, Dondozo becomes an effective and difficult to break Curse user.

  • Fissure: Even with Curse being the point of this set, Dondozo can still effectively fish for OHKOs with Fissure when it's not in a favorable set-up position.

  • Avalanche: Many foes will Terrastallize into a Flying-type to avoid an expected Fissure, which makes Avalanche a particularly useful coverage move.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake helps against Magnezone and common users of Tera Electric such as Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Water is an excellent defensive typing, so Dondozo won't need to Terastallize often.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera Type, Dondozo can effectively set up on Breloom and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fairy: The Dragon immunity that Tera Fairy provides makes setting up on powerful foes like Choice Band Dragapult and Roaring Moon much easier.

  • Flying: If using Fissure, Tera Flying is a good choice for potentially beating other Dondozo.

Annihilape.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Bulk Up.description:
• Thanks to great bulk and the dangerous Rage Fist, Annihilape is one of the premier bulky set-up sweepers of Battle Stadium Singles.

  • Taunt: Taunt helps you deal with annoying Pokemon like Whirlwind Ting-Lu, Dondozo, Will-O-Wisp Skeledirge, and Hippowdon, to mention a few, forcing them to attack and boost Rage Fist. This can work on Toxapex, but be warned that Toxapex commonly carries Mental Herb, which could get Annihilape poisoned if it doesn't Terastallize.

  • Encore: Encore is an interesting alternative to Taunt, not able to directly shut down defensive answers to Annihilape, but it severely punishes them when Annihilape switches into a support move.

  • Vital Spirit: With Vital Spirit, Annihilape can absorb Spore from foes like Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Amoonguss.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization is quite helpful at saving Annihilape from certain extremely powerful wallbreakers such as Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Flutter Mane, but Annihilape is perfectly functional without it.

  • Fire: In addition to giving a useful resistance to Fairy, Fire, and Ice attacks from dangerous foes like Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao, Tera Fire also prevents Will-O-Wisp from hitting.

  • Steel: Steel turns Annihilape's Psychic and Fairy weakness into resistances, as well as being an excellent defensive type overall. It lets Annihilape set up freely on Amoonguss and Toxapex, gives it a better chance of defeating Flutter Mane, and resisting Flower Trick means Meowscarada has a much harder time revenge killing it.

  • Poison: While not as sturdy of a defensive typing as Tera Steel, Tera Poison offers a better matchup against Flutter Mane, does well against Meowscarada, and lets Annihilape freely switch into Toxic and Toxic Spikes later in the match. This also drastically reduces the risk of Taunting Toxapex, which makes this Tera type a menace against stall teams!

  • Flying: Flying helps a lot to avoid Fissure from Dondozo and Ting-Lu, forcing it to attack with moves that boost Rage Fist. It also improves Annihilape's match-up against Great Tusk, and makes Hippowdon an easy foe to set up on.

  • Water: Tera Water is a good choice against Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Palafin-H.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's residual recovery eases the long-game of setting up.

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: Reducing the HP EVs to 244 gives Annihilape an even HP stat, which lets Annihilape recover its health with Sitrus Berry the moment it gets hit by Ruination. This makes dealing with Ting-Lu and Wo-Chien an easier task.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak makes Annihilape immune to being Salt Cured, making it a great check against Garganacl. It also gives peace of mind, avoiding potential flinches from Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, or Special Defense drops from Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • Punching Glove: Removing contact damage from Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin is helpful against defensive Pokemon such as Garchomp and Dragonite.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximum Speed mainly helps Annihilape outspeed Gholdengo, Great Tusk, Baxcalibur, and Modest Chi-Yu. With Bulk Up and Rage Fist improving its offense, Annihilape can invest in HP over Attack.

  • 252 HP / 244 SpD / 12 Spe with Careful: More special bulk can make it much more difficult for special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu to revenge kill Annihilape. This spread in particular has a 62.5% chance of surviving Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 244 HP / 164 Def / 100 SpD with Careful: This EV spread avoids an OHKO from +2 Chien-Pao, which can be especially helpful with Covert Cloak blocking the flinch chance.

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and Cloyster while still giving Annihilape good special bulk.

  • 252 HP / 196 Def / 60 Spe with Impish: This physically defensive spread will survive Tera Flying Adamant Dragonite's Tera Blast, while outspeeding 4 Speed EV Mimikyu and Jolly Brute Bonnet.

Stealth Rock Setter.description:
• Annihilape's good bulk and significant offensive presence makes it an easy to use Stealth Rock setter.

  • Rage Fist: Rage Fist is Annihilape’s strongest move; its power and coverage often lets Annihilape either defeat or significantly chip one of the opponent’s Pokemon on top of getting Stealth Rock up.

  • Drain Punch versus Close Combat: The huge amount of Dark-types in this metagame necessitates a Fighting STAB attack. Drain Punch is preferred in most cases for the extra recovery, but Close Combat makes plenty of sense if using Focus Sash and an offensive EV spread.

  • Taunt: Taunt gives Annihilape a strong matchup into bulky walls such as Ting-Lu and opposing setup foes like Volcarona, while also making it easier to boost Rage Fist’s power.

  • Final Gambit: Annihilape's impressive HP stat makes Final Gambit into a powerful KO trading tool, being able to take out bulky foes like Garganacl, Corviknight, Wo-Chien, and Toxapex.

  • Rock Tomb versus Bulldoze: Rock Tomb is an excellent Speed reducing move for its ability to hit Dragonite, and threaten Volcarona and Iron Bundle. Its low accuracy should be noted as a risk, however. Bulldoze trades hitting Dragonite in exchange for dealing good damage against Gholdengo and Iron Moth.

Other Options

  • Encore: Encore is an incredibly powerful move that can lock the opponent into an attacking move to boost Rage Fist's power. Alternatively, it can lock the opponent into a status move.

  • Fling and Light Ball: This gives Annihilape a chance to paralyze a foe, including Gholdengo that lack Covert Cloak, and break potential Focus Sashes too.

  • Curse: This is an excellent way for Annihilape to retire itself from the battle while putting significant pressure on the opponent to switch out and shutting down gimmicks such as Baton Pass.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Annihilape is often used quite early in the game to set up Stealth Rock, so Terastallization is often not needed unless it must check a specific threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has excellent defensive synergy with Annihilape thanks to the Fairy resistance and doing particularly well on spreads that are faster than -1 Chien-Pao to move before Sacred Sword lands.

  • Fire: Beyond offering a valuable Fairy resistance, the Ice and Fire resistances make Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu easier to deal with.

  • Normal: Ghost-type attacks are incredibly common. Pokemon such as Gholdengo, Dragapult, and opposing Annihilape all struggle against an unexpected Tera Normal.

  • Poison: Tera Poison has a good matchup against Flutter Mane, and lets Annihilape deal with Toxic and Toxic Spikes without needing to Taunt.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Even when using bulky EV spreads, Focus Sash is useful for surviving an attack from foes that can be difficult to EV for, such as Flutter Mane.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry can be used with specialized spreads to avoid certain 2HKOs. Just make sure to have an even HP stat, to ensure that Sitrus Berry activates after getting hit by Ruination.

  • Roseli Berry: Roseli Berry works well on specially defensive EV spreads designed defeat Flutter Mane leads that lack Focus Sash.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: Vital Spirit adds to Annihilape’s reliability as a lead. Immunity to sleep moves from common Pokemon such as Breloom, Brute Bonnet, Dondozo, Hippowdon, and Skeledirge lets Annihilape thrive with more defensive EV spreads.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate Pokemon are far from common from the format, Defiant can take advantage opposing Speed control moves.

  • Inner Focus: This niche ability prevents flinches from Chien-Pao and Dragonite from happening.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 172 HP / 4 Atk / 212 Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Jolly: This Speed drop based spread allows Annihilape to outspeed -1 Iron Bundle and avoids getting 2HKOed by Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: If using Focus Sash and Close Combat together, maximizing Attack and Speed will win the most matchups.

  • 220 HP / 244 SpD / 44 Spe with Careful: This Roseli Berry based spread lets Annihilape survive Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball and outspeed -1 Garchomp and 4 Speed EV Tinkaton.

Sitrus Berry EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 180 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This Sitrus Berry optimized EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom.

  • 244 HP / 244 Def / 20 Spe with Impish: This defensive spread is Annihilape's best chance at being a soft check to Chien-Pao, though note that Swords Dance and Terastallization together can still overwhelm Annihilape.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Thanks to Final Gambit and a decent Speed stat, Choice Scarf Annihilape can cause shocking upsets by revenge killing even bulky sweepers, such as Dragonite!

  • Shadow Claw versus Rage Fist: Shadow Claw is weak, but it's a reliable Ghost-type STAB move that can reliably OHKO Flutter Mane even when using minimum Attack investment. If you can manage to get Annihilape into a weak attack, though, Rage Fist has much more reward associated with it.

  • Final Gambit: If using maximum HP, Final Gambit can potentially OHKO major defensive threats if Annihilape is healthy, such as Garganacl and Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: Since Annihilape often sacrifices itself with Final Gambit, Terastallization is usually a bad idea unless absolutely needed for a highly specific, match dependent win condition.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type makes Shadow Claw OHKO Dragapult, as well as giving it a 56.3% chance of OHKOing 4 HP Gholdengo.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Annihilape an immunity to Ghost-type attacks, potentially getting it a revenge kill against a bulky Flutter Mane it wouldn't otherwise.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: The immunity to Spore gives Annihilape a good opportunity to switch into Breloom, and it need not worry about Yawn.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate is not particularly common, punishing that and Speed drops can lead to devastating surprise sweeps.

Clodsire.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Special Wall.description:
• Clodsire trades the physical bulk of Dondozo and Skeledirge for incredible special bulk, while boasting an equally fantastic support movepool.

  • Yawn: Yawn is very effective at forcing switches, which is especially dangerous if Stealth Rock is set up.

  • Curse: Curse is a powerful setup option when paired with Unaware, patching up Clodsire's weaker base Defense while also boosting Earthquake's power.

  • Protect: In addition to benefiting from Leftovers, Protect can pair well with either Yawn or Toxic.

Other Options

  • Stockpile: Stockpile is a more defensive but passive option to Curse, and is better suited for defensive or stall-based teams than offensive teams.

  • Rock Tomb: Besides providing valuable Speed control for its teammates, Rock Tomb lets Clodsire hit Air Balloon and Tera Flying users that might otherwise wall it, such as Gholdengo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Clodsire's fantastic defensive typing gives it a lot of opportunities to switch in, but its Ground- and Ice-type weakness are exploitable by many sweepers such as Chien-Pao.

  • Water: Tera Water's limited weaknesses make it an excellent defensive type, and it provides a critical resistance to Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Poison: With Tera Poison, Clodsire not only becomes a better check to Grass- and Water-types such as Meowscarada and Rotom-W, but it can also safely run Black Sludge to punish users of Trick.

  • Fire: Tera Fire pairs particularly well with Water Absorb, removing the Water-type weakness and letting it shut down Iron Bundle's offense with ease. The Ice- and Fairy-type resistances for Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane are also great to have.

  • Dark: Espathra's Stored Power is a big issue for Clodsire, so Tera Dark can flip the tables on it. Don't use this to block Psyshock, however, as most users of it also have Fairy-type coverage; a Tera typing neutral to Psyshock is normally enough.

  • Electric: Tera Electric doesn't have as many benefits as other Tera types, but it is notable for being the most stable option into Gholdengo, a very common check to Clodsire. It not only provides a critical Make It Rain resistance but also blocks Thunder Wave from defensive sets. Its important to run a coverage move to hit Air Balloon and Tera Flying Gholdengo, however, such as Rock Tomb or Tera Blast.

Items

  • Black Sludge versus Leftovers: Black Sludge may seem appealing, but it punishes Clodsire for Terastallizing unless it becomes Tera Poison, so Leftovers is preferred unless Leftovers is already on something else.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak makes Clodsire even more stable as a defensive check. It shuts down Garganacl's Salt Cure, prevents flinches from Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse and stops the occasional Special Defense drop from Flutter Mane's and Gholdengo's Shadow Ball.

Abilities

  • Unaware: If you're planning to use Clodsire to its fullest defensive potential, Unaware is the best bet against setup foes.

  • Water Absorb: Water Absorb sacrifices overall defensive potential in exchange for being able to wall Rotom-W without needing to Terastallize, but it is also useful with Tera Fire since it nullifies the Water-type weakness.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is Clodsire's best hope for handling powerful special attackers such as Choice Specs Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Clodsire's Defense may be mediocre, but with maximum investment, it can pull stunts such as usually avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Dragonite's Outrage with Leftovers.

Support.description:
• While Clodsire is lacking in physical bulk compared to Dondozo and Skeledirge, it makes up for it in having a fantastic support movepool.

  • Yawn: Yawn is very effective at forcing switches, which is especially dangerous if Stealth Rock is set up.

  • Protect: In addition to benefiting from Leftovers, Protect pairs well with Yawn.

  • Low Kick: This prevents Clodsire from being totally walled by Tera Steel Hydreigon.

  • Amnesia: With Amnesia, Clodsire has a far better match-up against powerful special attacking foes such as Hydreigon and Iron Bundle.

  • Black Sludge versus Leftovers: Black Sludge may seem appealing, but it punishes Clodsire for Terastalliizing unless it becomes Tera Poison, so Leftovers is preferred unless Leftovers is already on something else.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, Clodsire no longer has to worry about Earthquake or Fissure.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type allows Clodsire to take on powerful Dragon-type attacks, without the worry of Gholdengo dealing massive damage.

  • Poison: With Tera Poison, Clodsire not only becomes a better check to Grass- and Water-types such as Meowscarda and Rotom-W, but it can also safely run Black Sludge to punish users of Trick.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type will stop powerful Dragon-type attacks cold without making Clodsire weak to Earthquake, but it comes at the cost of compromising its ability to check Gholdengo.

  • Dark: Espathra's Stored Power is a big issue for Clodsire, so Tera Dark can flip the tables on it.

Abilities

  • Unaware: If you're planning to use Clodsire to its fullest defensive potential, Unaware is the best bet against setup foes.

  • Water Absorb: Water Absorb sacrifices overall defensive potential in exchange for being able to wall Rotom-W without needing to Terastallize. If setting up Stealth Rock is important, this can be worth it.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is Clodsire's best hope for handling powerful special attackers such as Choice Specs Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Clodsire's Defense may be mediocre, but with maximum investment, it can pull stunts such as usually avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Dragonite's Outrage with Leftovers.

Kingambit.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Kingambit sets itself apart from most other Dark-types with its bulk and typing, which make it a reasonable check against Gholdengo that lack Focus Blast, and less vulnerable to Flutter Mane.

  • Guillotine: This makes Kingambit far more difficult to wall with foes such as Dondozo and Ting-Lu.

  • Brick Break versus Low Kick: Low Kick is Kingambit's best option against Tera Normal Dragonite and other Kingambit, but Brick Break is preferred because it deals far more damage to Chi-Yu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Kingambit has a good typing, but its vulnerability to Fighting-type attacks or need to boost its power for late-game sweeps means it benefits a lot from Terastallization.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type makes Kingambit even harder to wall and removes its irritating Ground weakness, though powerful Fighting attacks can still be a problem,

  • Flying: This Tera type covers Kingambit's issues with Fighting- and Ground-type attacks very well and lets it deal big damage to Fighting-types like Annihilape and Great Tusk with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type and Tera Blast, Kingambit improves its matchup against Chien-Pao and can deal serious damage to Iron Hands and Great Tusk, but it becomes vulnerable to Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Supreme Overload: This ability makes Kingambit a deadly cleaner in late-game scenarios, and is generally the most consistent ability.

  • Defiant: Defiant prevents Kingambit from falling to Charm Flutter Mane, and is a good option for punishing speed control options like Rock Tomb.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 252 Atk / 148 Spe: This EV spread has enough Speed to outspeed most Corviknight and Skeledirge, and it still has enough bulk to survive one unboosted Body Press from Corviknight. Since this is a fairly congested Speed range, feel free to move some Attack EVs to Speed.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Using maximum Speed might seem absurd on such a slow Pokemon, but outspeeding most Skeledirge, Corviknight, and opposing Kingambit can make this worth it.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Kingambit's bulk is perfect for Assault Vest, letting it preform well against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

  • Black Glasses: While its boost to Dark-type attacks isn't as high as Life Orb's, Black Glasses is a better fit for Kingambit's bulk due to the lack of recoil.

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: The burst of recovery helps Kingambit check Gholdengo better. Make sure to run 244 HP EVs to have an even HP stat. This will make Sitrus Berry activate after one use of Ruination.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Kingambit's excellent bulk and offensive presence make it a good, if unexpected, setter of Stealth Rock.

  • Brick Break versus Low Kick: While weak, Brick Break is the preferred fighting move for hitting Chi-Yu hard. Low Kick does more damage to Ting-Lu, other Kingambit and Tera Normal Dragonite.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave isn't a particularly common move on Kingambit, potentially letting it surprise some switch-ins like Iron Moth and Annihilape.

Other Options

  • Guillotine: With Guillotine, passive play from foes like Corviknight and Dondozo becomes far more risky.

  • Taunt: Taunt is effective at shutting down common support Pokemon such as Dondozo and Toxapex.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Fairy Blast is Kingambit's best shot against Iron Hands, one of its biggest checks. It also makes sense with Tera Flying to hit Great Tusk hard.

  • Metal Burst: If using Focus Sash, Metal Burst deals serious damage against a wide variety of leads.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization is fully viable, this Kingambit's focus on setting up Stealth Rock early means its not needed to function.

  • Flying: Tera Flying covers Kingambit's Fighting- and Ground-type weaknesses, making it do especially well against

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy can help prevent Iron Hands, one of the best Kingambit checks in the game, from OHKOing it.

  • Dark: When using Sucker Punch, Tera Dark gives Kingambit some late-game cleaning potential.

Items

Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's quick burst of recovery keeps Kingambit more relevant in the later stages of the game. Make sure to use an even HP stat so that Ruination will activate Sitrus Berry.

  • Black Glasses: Kingambit's bulk and support options make Black Glasses a preferable option over Life Orb for more power, especially when using Sucker Punch.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash will let Kingambit survive even the strongest Fighting-type attacks, if Stealth Rock desperately needs to be set up.

  • Chople Berry: Chople Berry eases Kingambit's devastating Fighting-type weakness, though note powerful STAB users of Close Combat such as Iron Hands require massive Defense investment to survive. 252 HP and 12 Defense EVs can be used to survive Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

Abilities

  • Supreme Overlord: Even though this Kingambit is often set out early-game to set up Stealth Rock, Supreme Overlord gives it the flexibility to function later in the game if Stealth Rock isn't needed or if it manages to set up Stealth Rock without much harm to itself.

  • Defiant: Besides punishing the rare use of Intimidate, Defiant lets Kingambit defeat Charm Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 4 Spe: This EV spread gives Kingambit an even HP stat, letting Sitrus Berry activate on the first use of Ruination.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximizing Speed lets Kingambit get the jump on opposing Kingambit and slower variants of Wo-Chien, Skeledirge, Corviknight, and Iron Hands.

Great Tusk.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• Great Tusk's primal physical prowess and great support options make it a good choice for a bulky Fighting-type.

  • Earthquake versus Headlong Rush: Headlong Rush's defensive drops and vulnerability to Rocky Helmet make it a riskier option than Earthquake, but the extra power OHKOes maximum HP Gholdengo.

  • Ice Spinner: This is highly recommended to avoid getting walled by Dragonite before it Terastallizes, while also dealing good damage to common Tera Flying Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Kingambit.

  • Rapid Spin: Great Tusk is one of the best Rapid Spin users, being able to take advantage of it offensively and heavily pressuring Ting-Lu to Terastallize or switch out.

  • Knock Off: Beyond the usefulness of removing items, this is Great Tusk's best move against Air Balloon Gholdengo.

Other Options

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb is a good speed control option, great for breaking through Dragonite's Multiscale while nullifying its potential Speed boost, while letting other teammates take advantage of speed control. It also lets Great Tusk hit troublesome Focus Sash Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and Gengar, something Rapid Spin can't do.

  • Iron Head: If using Tera Steel, Iron Head is a decent option for OHKOing Flutter Mane without using Headlong Rush, and it deals heavy damage to Baxcalibur and Tera Fairy Rotom-W.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization can help with Great Tusk's poor special bulk by resisting certain hits, but it works fine without it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel greatly aids against the many Fairy-, Ice-, and Flying-types that would otherwise prey on Great Tusk, such as Mimikyu, Iron Bundle, and Tera Flying Dragonite.

  • Water: Tera Water massively improves the matchup against Chien-Pao, and can let Great Tusk survive an encounter with offensive Iron Moth or Chi-Yu that lack Choice Specs.

  • Ground: The furious increase in power Tera Ground provides can be useful late game, giving Earthquake a high chance to OHKO even defensive Gholdengo and Headlong Rush the ability to 2HKO Terastallized Skeledirge.

  • Fighting: Not only does Tera Fighting improve the Chien-Pao matchup, but it OHKOs even the bulkiest Ting-Lu with Close Combat.

Items

  • Assault Vest: This patches up Great Tusk's poor Special Defense, which can be paired with the correct Tera Type to help against foes like Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Iron Moth, and Chi-Yu.

  • Booster Energy: When saving Great Tusk for late-game sweeps, Booster Energy is preferred over Life Orb for preserving its HP against priority attacks.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash on such a bulky Pokemon may seem wasteful, but it vastly improves Great Tusk's matchups against special attackers such as Rotom-W and makes setting up Stealth Rock a far simpler task. If using Focus Sash, consider using the first alternate EV spread below.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 12 Def / 236 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread survives Adamant Focus Sash Meowscarada's Flower Trick followed by Sucker Punch, making it a good spread to use if using Focus Sash and Rapid Spin.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • All of these EV spreads will at least avoid a 2HKO from Modest Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire if using Tera Steel. If using a different Tera type, 16 Special Defense EVs can be redistributed.

  • 52 HP / 148 Atk / 4 Def / 164 SpD / 140 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom, and the rare Timid Abomasnow.

  • 4 HP / 44 Atk / 4 Def / 164 SpD / 244 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread is for Rapid Spin, outspeeding Iron Bundle after a Speed boost.

Bulk Up.description:
• Great Tusk's fantastic Defense stat makes it a great option for setting up Bulk Up late-game.

  • Taunt versus Substitute: Taunt preys on defensive Pokemon such as Wo-Chien and Corviknight, while Substitute protects Great Tusk from Garganacl's Salt Cure. Dragon Tail from Garchomp and Dragonite, and OHKO moves from the likes of Dondozo and Kingambit.

  • Ice Spinner: Dragonite is such a problematic foe that hitting it hard is worth more than a Fighting-type STAB move.

Other Options

  • Body Press: Although it is difficult to fit in without sacrificing utility or coverage, Body Press is a reasonable option if a Fighting-type STAB move is needed.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat does not gel well with the defensive nature of this set, but it deals far more damage to Ting-Lu than any of Great Tusk's other options.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Great Tusk is a good bulky sweeper on its own, but Terstallization makes it far more difficult to revenge kill.

  • Water: Not only is Tera Water an excellent option against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, but it also means Dondozo will never break Great Tusk's Substitute with Wave Crash, and Assault Vest Azumarill become an easy target to set up on.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a great option for dealing with Great Tusk's weaknesses, such as Fairy-types and makes Iron Bundle usually fail to 2HKO specially defensive Great Tusk without Choice Specs.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a decent alternative to Tera Steel, providing the vital Fairy-type resistance without the weaknesses to Fighting- and Fire-type attacks and an extremely useful immunity to being poisoned that eases the match-up against Toxic Spikes foes such as Clodsire and Meowscarada.

  • Fire: Fire is not a great defensive type; however, not only does it do well against Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane, it also protects Great Tusk from fast Will-O-Wisp users such as Dragapult, Mimikyu, and Volcarona.

Items

  • Leftovers: The residual recovery from Leftovers best suits the slow set-up of this set, especially if using Substitute.

  • Booster Energy: Depending on the EV spread, Booster Energy can boost Attack or Speed to increase Great Tusk's late-game cleaning potential.

  • Covert Cloak: If a Garganacl check is desperately needed, Covert Cloak Great Tusk is up for the task.

EV Spreads

  • 188 HP / 140 Atk / 4 Def / 36 SpD / 140 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and the rare Timid Abomasnow, survives Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry, and has a very good chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Azumarill after using Bulk Up. The Attack EVs OHKO Chien-Pao and defensive Gholdengo with Earthquake after Bulk Up.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread gains a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, making Great Tusk an even better late-game sweeper at the cost of physical bulk.

  • 244 HP / 20 Atk / 84 Def / 20 SpD / 140 Spe with Impish: This EV spread is meant for use with Tera Steel or Tera Poison, maintaining Great Tusk's Substitute against Dondozo's Wave Crash after Terastallization. It also outspeeds Adamant Breloom and the rare Timid Abomasnow, and survives Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 SpD with Careful: Maximum investment in special bulk makes Great Tusk much more difficult to revenge kill with the likes of Gholdengo and Iron Bundle. The 4 Attack EVs gives an Attack boost from Protosynthesis, which is preferred for improving the Skeledirge matchup and sweeping more easily.

Choice Item.description:
• Great Tusk's high power attacks make it a fine Choice item holder.

  • Headlong Rush versus Earthquake: Headlong Rush is preferred for stampeding over maximum HP Gholdengo, but Earthquake avoids chip damage from Rocky Helmet and makes Great Tusk far less vulnerable to priority attacks from foes like Dragonite, Chien-Pao, and Palafin-H.

  • Ice Spinner: Great Tusk should never leave its cave without a move to hit Dragonite hard!

  • Knock Off: Knock Off deals massive damage to Air Balloon Gholdengo and is almost guaranteed to OHKO offensive Dragapult after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: A Jolly nature ensures that Great Tusk outspeeds Gholdengo, and Choice Scarf variants outspeed Dragapult. Adamant is still a reasonable option for more power since Great Tusk will still outpace Breloom, and if using Choice Scarf, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao.

Other Options

  • Iron Head: If using Tera Steel, this is a reasonable option over Knock Off if Tera Fairy Rotom-W is an issue.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization can help it clean more easily, it's not an important aspect of this set otherwise.

  • Ground: Tera Ground is the best option for late-game cleaning, dealing significant damage to Dondozo and OHKOing Dragapult with Headlong Rush.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting threatens to 2HKO Corviknight, an otherwise decent check to Great Tusk, and OHKO even the bulkiest Ting-Lu.

  • Steel: While Great Tusk's special bulk is mediocre, Tera Steel can prevent it from being OHKOed by foes such as Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Since it outspeeds other major Choice Scarf Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Rotom-W, Great Tusk makes for a good revenge killer.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band is a more niche option due to being extremely vulnerable to revenge kills, but does a much better job of wall-breaking, with Tera boosted Great Tusk even being able to 2HKO a maximum Defense Dondozo with Close Combat or Headlong Rush!

Trick Room Support.description:
• Scream Tail's bulk, Speed and diverse support options make it a great all-in-one Trick Room support Pokemon.

  • Misty Explosion : Misty Explosion may limit Scream Tail's offensive reach, but it's key for bringing in sweepers safely after setting Trick Room.

  • Encore: Encore is great at disrupting foes trying to set up in front of Scream Tail.

  • Trick Room Sweepers: Ursaluna-B is the most popular partner for Trick Room setups, but other semi-slow sweepers like Basculegion-M can work as well.

  • EV Spread: The special bulk guarantees that Scream Tail survives Shadow Ball from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. If using Sitrus Berry, the physical bulk guarantees that both formes of Choice Band Urshifu will fail to 2HKO Scream Tail with their signature moves.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Scream Tail's bulk and typing make it easy to set up without having to rely on Terastallization.

  • Water: Tera Water's Steel-type and Fire-type resistances can be key at surviving big attacks from Gholdengo and Chi-Yu.

  • Steel: Tera Steel can help Scream Tail set up against Tera Flying and Extreme Speed Dragonite, while still providing a key Steel-type resistance.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Taunt Flutter Mane can be a big problem for Scream Tail, but Mental Herb can help guarantee that it gets to set Trick Room at least once.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's healing can give Scream Tail a stronger chance at getting both Stealth Rock and Trick Room down.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Scream Tail's incredible support movepool and bulk makes it a fine Stealth Rock supporter.

  • Thunder Wave versus Fling: Thunder Wave is the easiest form of paralysis to fit in, but with Light Ball, Fling can paralyze Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Garchomp, and Gholdengo that lack Covert Cloak, at the cost of leaving Scream Tail extremely vulnerable to Encore. Fling can also get rid of devastating Choice items from Trick users such as Rotom-W.

  • Encore: Scream Tail's great Speed tier makes it an especially effective user of Encore, letting it punish foes that attempt to set up, such as Roaring Moon.

  • Perish Song: Perish Song is another way for Scream Tail to threaten setup sweepers such as Dragonite, and it can become a win condition late in the game. It's also a fantastic response to Baton Pass foes such as Espathra and opposing Scream Tail.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb's additional Speed control is helpful against threats that boost their Speed, such as Dragonite and Baxcalibur.

  • Dazzling Gleam: While a rather weak STAB move, Dazzling Gleam threatening to 2HKO offensive Great Tusk can make it a good way to punish Rapid Spin use.

Other Options

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower 2HKOes Scizor, though it does not 2HKO Gholdengo, making Recover sets still problematic.

  • Disable: Disable is particularly apt at ruining Choice item foes that need a specific move to 2HKO Scream Tail, such as Scizor, though compared to Encore, it's less useful against support moves.

  • Psychic Fangs: In addition to 2HKOing Iron Moth, Psychic Fangs breaking dual screens can be extremely useful, though this doesn't work against Grimmsnarl.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal might seem like an underwhelming defensive option, but taking on Ghost-type attacks while avoiding a 2HKO from Gholdengo can be valuable.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives a vital Steel resistance and is a great defensive typing in general.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy improves Scream Tail's matchup against Dark-types such as Hydreigon.

  • Fire: If using Flamethrower, Tera Fire Scream Taill will have a 97.3% chance to 2HKO Tera Steel Scizor, making it an effective lure.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Blocking the first use of Taunt makes Scream Tail an extremely reliable setter of Stealth Rock.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is the safest way to increase Scream Tail's longetivity, and it can avoid certain 2HKOs depending on the EV spread, such as that from Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump with specially defensive spreads.

  • Light Ball: Light Ball is a requirement when using Fling, ensuring Scream Tail can inflict paralysis once and get rid of Choice items with one move.

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy being instantly consumed makes Scream Tail less flexible, but boosting Speed lets it outspeed key threats such as Dragapult. This item can also be used with bulkier EV spreads to make Scream Tail even bulkier, pulling off incredible stunts such as surviving Timid Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

EV Spreads

  • Scream Tail has an incredible number of viable EV spreads at its disposal: consider these as mere examples rather than all of its viable EV spreads!

  • 180 HP / 156 SpD / 172 Spe with Calm or Careful: This EV spread outspeeds Baxcalibur and Great Tusk and survives Timid Choice Specs Iron Moth's Sludge Wave 93.7% of the time.

  • 180 HP / 124 SpD / 204 Spe with Calm or Careful: The Speed investment outspeeds Jolly Annihilape, and Scream Tail avoids OHKOs from Timid Gholdengo and Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • 220 HP / 220 Def / 68 SpD with Calm or Careful: This EV spread avoids an OHKO from Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain after Stealth Rock damage, and Scream Tail has a 93.7% chance of surviving Tera Steel Scizor's Choice Band Bullet Punch. If outspeeding Baxcalibur and Great Tusk is a must, a Speed-boosting nature and 68 Speed EVs can be used instead.

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid or Jolly: With maximum Speed investment, Scream Tail outspeeds not only Iron Moth, but also major Encore targets such as Garchomp and Annihilape.

Baton Pass.description:
• Scream Tail's diverse setup options and bulk make it one of the most unpredictable Baton Pass Pokemon in the metagame.

  • Encore: Encore is perfect for punishing passive play, giving Scream Tail many new setup opportunities.

  • Sing: Sing is a high-risk, high-reward option to set up in otherwise impossible situations, and it is especially effective with Blunder Policy.

  • Substitute: Not only is Substitute useful to pass with Baton Pass, but it makes weak Pokemon such as Garganacl into easy setup bait.

Other Options

  • Flamethrower: When using Calm Mind, Flamethrower can threaten Gholdengo and Scizor.

  • Psychic Fangs: Psychic Fangs 2HKOes Clodsire and, after a Bulk Up boost, can OHKO Iron Moth that don't invest in Defense. However, Grimmsnarl holds back its dual screens-breaking potential.

  • Drain Punch: Drain Punch gives Scream Tail some offensive presence against Kingambit.

  • Stored Power: When combined with Calm Mind and Blunder Policy, Stored Power can threaten Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal gets rid of Scream Tail's key weakness to Steel, and it performs well against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo in particular.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Scream Tail a fantastic defensive typing, resisting Scizor's Bullet Punch in particular.

  • Dark: If Grimmsnarl is particularly problematic for your team, Tera Dark will block its Prankster Taunt from stopping Scream Tail.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Mental Herb is the most reliable option for getting Baton Pass off against faster Taunt users.

  • Blunder Policy: When paired with Sing, Scream Tail can pass Speed when Sing misses.

  • Sitrus Berry: A burst of recovery from Sitrus Berry eases setup in general.

  • Booster Energy: While it's impossible to pass Protosynthesis boosts via Baton Pass, either outspeeding disruptive foes such as Iron Bundle, or surviving Choice Specs holders like Iron Moth and Gholdengo, can be a deadly surprise.

General EV Spreads

  • 220 HP / 220 Def / 68 SpD with Careful or Calm: This EV spread gives Scream Tail enough bulk to survive Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain after Stealth Rock damage, and it has a 93.7% chance of surviving Tera Steel Choice Band Scizor's Bullet Punch.

  • 180 HP / 124 SpD / 204 Spe with Calm or Careful: This spread outspeeds Jolly Annihilape, and with Blunder Policy, it can even outspeed Booster Energy Iron Bundle after missing Sing. The bulk lets Scream Tail survive a hit from Timid Gholdengo and Choice Specs Flutter Mane after Stealth Rock damage.

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly or Timid: Maximizing Speed lets Scream Tail outspeed high-profile targets such as Iron Moth and Garchomp.

Blunder Policy-Specific EV Spreads

  • 220 HP / 220 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 60 Spe with Careful or Calm: This spread gives Scream Tail enough bulk to usually survive Tera Steel Choice Band Scizor's Bullet Punch, and it also outspeeds Booster Energy Iron Valiant after missing Sing. The remaining 8 EVs can only boost Special Defense and an offensive stat of your choice.

  • 180 HP / 212 SpD / 116 Spe with Jolly or Timid and 180 HP / 100 SpD / 228 Spe with Careful or Calm: These functionally identical stat spreads let Scream Tail outspeed even Choice Scarf Dragapult after missing Sing! The Special Defense investment lets Scream Tail survive a hit from Timid Gholdengo and Choice Specs Flutter Mane after Stealth Rock damage.

Dual Screens.description:
• Scream Tail's bulk and impressive Speed make it a great dual screens setter.

  • Encore: Encore punishing setup is extremely valuable considering Scream Tail's passive nature compared to other dual screens setters.

  • Perish Song: Perish Song can ruin Baton Pass attempts from the likes of Espathra or opposing Scream Tail, and it does well against most setup sweepers, except Gholdengo.

  • Light Clay versus Mental Herb: Light Clay is the preferred choice, but Mental Herb can save Scream Tail from some particularly difficult users of Taunt such as Corviknight and Annihilape.

Tera Types

  • The extreme support focus of this set means that Terastallization should only be used as a last resort, or when it can clearly lead to a win.

  • Normal: In emergencies, Tera Normal can let Scream Tail set up dual screens against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. Note that Scream Tail is completely passive against Gholdengo, though.

  • Dark: Tera Dark is a niche answer to Prankster Taunt users such as Grimmsnarl.

Brute Bonnet.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon is likely to be relevant in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Speedy Spore.description:
• Don't be fooled by Brute Bonnet's low Speed stat; after two uses of Trailblaze, it even outspeeds Dragapult, which is a very feasible feat thanks to Spore. With the lack of Sleep Clause, this Speed turns Brute Bonnet into a terrifying sleep inducer!

  • Crunch versus Sucker Punch: Crunch is the preferred STAB move, reliably hitting the most common Spore check, Gholdengo, which makes it the ideal STAB attack to use with Substitute. However, Sucker Punch lets Brute Bonnet pick off threats when it doesn't have the chance to Spore and set up Trailblaze.

  • Close Combat versus Substitute: On one hand, Close Combat deals massive damage to Dark-type resistances, such as Roaring Moon, but it leaves Brute Bonnet fairly vulnerable to priority attacks. On the other hand, Spore gives Brute Bonnet ample opportunity to set up Substitute, easing the cost of early wake ups.

Tera Types

  • Dark: Powering up Crunch makes it easier to sweep with Crunch or Sucker Punch while still leaving it immune to Grimmsnarl's Prankster Taunt.

  • Fire: Tera Fire turns Brute Bonnet's devastating U-turn and Fairy-type weaknesses into resistances, giving it the edge against Flutter Mane and letting it fry Scizor and Tinkaton with Tera Blast.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants Brute Bonnet important resistances to U-turn, Fighting, and Fairy without compromising itself against Water-types.

  • Fairy: With Tera Fairy, Brute Bonnet deals with Dragon-types far more reliably, and gains a valuable tool against opposing Dark- and Dragon-types with Tera Blast.

EV Spreads

  • 148 HP / 100 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Adamant: With Adamant, Brute Bonnet will still outspeed Great Tusk and Annihilape after Trailblaze and Dragapult after two uses of Trailblaze. Brute Bonnet's bulk lets it survive some powerful attacks, such as Iron Moth's Sludge Wave, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain, and almost always surviving Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

  • 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: At the cost of bulk, maximizing Speed lets Brute Bonnet outspeed threats such as Garchomp and Iron Treads after just one use of Trailblaze

Items

  • Booster Energy: Activating Protosynthesis takes dvantage of Brute Bonnet's power, though it means switching out will weaken Brute Bonnet.

  • Leftovers: If using Substitute, Leftovers is by far the preferred item, as Brute Bonnet has plenty of turns to recover its health against sleeping foes.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb is the most consistent way to boost Brute Bonnet's power, letting it switch out after using Spore when needed.

  • Focus Sash: Despite Brute Bonnet's good bulk, Focus Sash is a great option to stop potential sweeps, assuming entry hazards aren't set up.

Bulky Spore.description:
• With good bulk and access to strong priority, Brute Bonnet is a great offensive user of Spore.

  • Bullet Seed versus Seed Bomb: Even when not using Loaded Dice, Bullet Seed is useful for potentially KOing foes like Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane through Focus Sash and punishing Mimikyu switch ins. Nontheless, Seed Bomb is the more reliable option when not using Loaded Dice.

  • Substitute: Substitute is easy to set up thanks to Spore and eases the risk early wake-ups can pose. If using Substitute, using Crunch or Payback over Sucker Punch is preferred due to the issues Substitute Gholdengo can cause.

  • Crunch versus Payback: Having a reliable Dark-type STAB move is helpful when facing foes like Substitute Gholdengo. Payback has higher damage potential, but Crunch won't have its power dropped by foes switching in.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat crushes Roaring Moon and opposing Brute Bonnet, though the drop in bulk can be troublesome for this set.

Tera Types

  • Dark: Tera Dark works fantastically with Sucker Punch, giving Brute Bonnet good revenge killing capability.

  • Poison: Tera Poison covers Brute Bonnet's major weaknesses to U-turn, Fairy, and Fighting, giving it an easy chance to use Spore.

  • Fire: While the Stealth Rock weakness can be troublesome, Tera Fire still does well against Flutter Mane and lets Brute Bonnet melt Scizor and Tinkaton with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Powerful Dragon-type attacks such as Outrage and Draco Meteor can be turned into Spore bait with Tera Fairy, in addition to arming Brute Bonnet with a powerful Tera Blast against them.

  • Grass: If using Bullet Seed, Tera Grass can make sense for increasing the chance of shooting down Focus Sash leads such as Flutter Mane and still keeping the Spore immunity against Breloom and opposing Brute Bonnet.

Items

  • Leftovers: The extra recovery pairs very well with Spore and Substitute.

  • Sitrus Berry: If not using Substitute, the quick burst of recovery with Sitrus Berry is preferred.

  • Loaded Dice: Guaranteeing 4 hits with Bullet Seed means Brute Bonnet will always OHKO Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle through their Focus Sash, and the higher chance for 5 hits can even shoot down Mimikyu and offensive Great Tusk.

Flutter Mane.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane's blistering Speed and Special Attack along with its powerful unresisted STAB combination exerts an oppressive amount of pressure on most teams, making it one of the premier offensive Pokemon in the format.

  • Mystical Fire: Mystical Fire scorches the common Flutter Mane check, Scizor. It also heavily disrupts enemy special attackers.

  • Power Gem: Power Gem gets a bit of extra damage against Fire-types like Ogerpon-H and Incineroar, which can be relevant when using Tera Stellar.

  • Substitute: Calm Mind + Substitute is a classic duo that greatly assists Flutter Mane's setup attempts, allowing it to set up in-front of Thunder Wave Porygon2. Even without Calm Mind, it can save Flutter Mane from devastating uses of Thunder Wave from the likes of Archaludon.

  • Taunt: Taunt is hugely disruptive against a variety of support Pokemon, such as Swampert, Ting-Lu, and Porygon2.

Other Options

  • Stellar Tera Blast: With Tera Stellar, Tera Blast can be some good insurance against Pokemon with unpredictable Terastallization options, but the Special Attack drop doesn't gel well with Booster Energy.

  • Draining Kiss: When using extremely bulky Flutter Mane variants, Draining Kiss can be paired with Calm Mind to keep it around much longer. However, Tera Fairy is highly recommended when using this, as Draining Kiss is otherwise very weak.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Flutter Mane's incredible Speed is put to good use, outspeeding almost everything in the metagame with the major exceptions being Booster Energy Iron Bundle and the very rare Choice Scarf Dragapult.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash patches up Flutter Mane's poor physical bulk, giving it new revenge kill chances.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Flutter Mane benefits from Terastallization, it's generally flexible enough to go without it.

  • Stellar: Flutter Mane boosting all of its offensive moves once gives it good offensive flexibility, especially since it retains the important immunity to Extreme Speed.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy makes Moonblast a potent sweeping move, while reducing damage against Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch and Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak.

  • Water: Tera Water is handy for giving a resistance to Steel, Ice, and Fire, giving improved matchups against Scizor, Ting-Lu, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Electric: In addition to resisting Bullet Punch, Tera Electric protects Flutter Mane from the dreaded Thunder Wave and Glare!

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Flutter Mane an offensive and defensive edge against Scizor, though the weakness to Urshifu-R's Aqua Jet is quite unwelcome.

EV Spreads

  • All of these EV spreads are designed to give Flutter Mane a Speed Boost with Protosynthesis.

  • 4 HP / 108 Defense / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: The Defense investment usually allows Flutter Mane to survive Sucker Punch from Adamant Chien-Pao. To require Adamant Chien-Pao to get a critical hit to OHKO Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch, an EV spread of 4 HP / 124 Def / 124 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe can also be used.

  • 116 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 132 Spe with Timid: This EV spread outspeeds Jolly Roaring Moon and survives an opposing Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball without Terastallization. In addition, Life Orb Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak has a fairly low chance of OHKOing, and Iron Bundle fails to KO with the combination of Hydro Pump and Freeze Dry.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: If using Focus Sash, this simple spread is best for maximizing Speed and power. Note that this spread's vulnerability to priority makes it a poor fit for Booster Energy variants.

  • 236 HP / 252 Def / 20 Spe with Bold: This extremely defensive spread allows Flutter Mane to survive Tera Dark Life Orb Jolly Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch without needing to Terastallize itself, while still outspeeding Choice Scarf Jolly Landorus-T and Gouging Fire after Booster Energy.

Choice Attacker.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread: This spread allows Flutter Mane to usually survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch before Terastallizing.

  • Tera Type: Tera Fairy gives this set the easiest late game sweeping opportunities, and saves Flutter Mane from powerful Sucker Punches from the likes of Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

Offensive Support.description: This set is currently undergoing proofreading, but is otherwise nearly content complete. If you would like to read the analysis in its current state, click on this link!

Charm.description:
• The combination of Charm and Pain Split turns Flutter Mane into a devastating control option, massively crippling opposing offensive threats and healing itself with the combination of Pain Split and Draining Kiss.

  • Calm Mind versus coverage: Calm Mind allows Flutter Mane to maintain its role as a sweeper by increasing its damage output while simultaneously reinforcing its longevity. However, this leaves Flutter Mane quite vulnerable to Steel-types, so Shadow Ball and Mystical Fire are reasonable alternatives.

  • Draining Kiss versus Moonblast: Moonblast's far superior damage output is a great option versus more defensive teams, while Draining Kiss supplies superior lasting power against more offensive teams and is a great fit for Tera Fairy.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Since this Flutter Mane is trying to defeat unexpected physical threats one-on-one, Terastallization is great at patching up some matchups that Charm can't on its own, even if it's not required for this set to work.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Flutter Mane a very useful resistance to Steel, Ice, and Fire, giving it improved matchups against Scizor, Ting-Lu, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy Further boosts Moonblast's impressive damage output while removing Flutter Mane's Ghost weakness.

  • Electric: Tera Electric not only gives a useful Bullet Punch resistance against Scizor, but it also prevents common paralysis spreaders like Porygon2, opposing Flutter Mane, Archaludon, and Serperior from crippling Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 124 HP / 252 Def / 132 Spe with Timid: The chosen EVs ensure that Flutter Mane will always outspeed Jolly Booster Energy Roaring Moon. Maximum Defense investment gets the most out of Charm with the rest placed into HP.

Slither Wing.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon is likely to be relevant in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. While we wait for the metagame to settle, here are some sample sets that may be viable. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sandy Shocks.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon might have a niche in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2, though their viability is uncertain. While we wait for the metagame to settle, here are some sample sets that may be viable. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Iron Treads.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon has a few niches in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Assault Vest.description:
• With a decent defensive typing in Ground / Steel and good bulk, Iron Treads can run an effective Assault Vest set.

  • Iron Head versus Heavy Slam: While Heavy Slam is not as consistent as Iron Head due to Iron Treads's middling weight, it reaches maximum power against targets such as Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant. Heavy Slam gets an OHKO on Iron Valiant and 2HKOes Iron Bundle, which is something that's not achievable with Iron Head, however, Iron Head 2HKOes Baxcalibur, and does non-negligible damage to Dragonite, which isn't possible with Heavy Slam.

  • Rapid Spin: It may seem weird to run Rapid Spin on such a fast-paced-format, but with it, Iron Treads can support teammates like Dragonite and Focus Sash Flutter Mane. Additionally, with a Jolly nature and minimal Speed investment Iron Treads can outrun Timid Iron Bundle after a Rapid Spin.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner gives Iron Treads a move to hit Dragonite, Hydreigon, Garchomp, and Great Tusk hard.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off is Iron Treads's best move against Rotom-W and Rotom-H, and its item removal is valuable all around, crippling both the Pokemon it's supposed to check as well as common switch-ins.

  • Volt Switch: Pivoting can help Iron Treads against physically bulky Pokemon like Dondozo, Corviknight, and Terastallized Garganacl.

  • EV Spread: The EV Spread aims to maximize Iron Treads's ability to take special attacks, especially when coupled with an Assault Vest; the Speed allows it to outspeed Jolly Breloom before a Rapid Spin and Timid Iron Bundle.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Flying provides Iron Treads with a Ground immunity and a Fighting resistance, along with neutralizing its Fire weakness, which can be useful against Tera Fire Flutter Mane and Sylveon, Skeledirge, Iron Valiant, and Iron Moth.

Offensive Support.description:
• Iron Treads possesses an incredible support movepool along with a great base 106 Speed stat, making it a great support option.

  • Electric Terrain: A manual Electric Terrain may seem odd, but Iron Treads has the bulk to run it and use it to activate its own Quark Drive along with its teammates' if applicable, and the lack of other Terrains in the current series means Electric Terrain can run for its full duration a lot of times. Electric Terrain also blocks sleep moves from foes such as Skeledirge, Espathra, Iron Valiant, Gengar, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Rapid Spin: Despite the fast-paced-nature of BSS, Rapid Spin allows Iron Treads to both boost its speed and clear entry hazards from its side of the field, supporting teammates such as Focus Sash Iron Bundle and Dragonite.

  • Knock Off: Along with its item removal ability, Knock Off is Iron Treads's best move to hit Rotom-W and Rotom-H.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner allows Iron Treads to hit foes such as Dragonite and Great Tusk hard, but it should be used carefully if it's run alongside Electric Terrain, as it ends the current active Terrain.

Other Options

  • Heavy Slam: With Heavy Slam, Iron Treads can OHKO Iron Valiant, as well as 2HKO Iron Bundle without Tera Steel. After Terastallizing into Steel, Heavy Slam can OHKO Iron Bundle after a Rapid Spin.

  • Wild Charge: If Iron Treads is holding a Life Orb, Wild Charge is capable of 2HKOing Corviknight in Electric Terrain.

  • Bulldoze: While weaker than Earthquake, Bulldoze is a speed control option for Iron Treads that affects Ghost-types, unlike Rapid Spin.

Tera Types

  • Ground: Tera Ground neutralizes Iron Treads's Fire, Ground, and Fighting weaknesses and ramps up the power of its Earthquake.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gets rid of Iron Treads's Water weakness and gives it resistances to Ice and Grass.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy increases Iron Treads's speed even further, allowing it to outspeed Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, Dragapult and slower Choice Scarf foes, making it very likely to get a move off first.

  • Terrain Extender: Terrain Extender increases the duration of Terrains to eight turns, giving Iron Treads or one of its Quark Drive teammates more turns to make use of their ability.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is an option for ensuring Iron Treads can get at least one move off against faster foes that can KO it.

  • Air Balloon: An Air Balloon allows Iron Treads to have an edge against other Ground-type leads such as Garchomp.

  • Life Orb: When used alongside Electric Terrain, Life Orb boosts Iron Treads's offensive pressure, and a Terrain-boosted Wild Charge can 2HKO Corviknight.

Iron Bundle.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Santa's Slay.description:
• With nearly perfect coverage and an incredible Speed stat, Iron Bundle's ferocious brand of holiday spirit is a metagame-defining force!

  • Encore: Giving the gift of an encore lets Iron Bundle punish passive Pokemon and naughty sweepers alike.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Iron Bundle take further advantage of encored Pokemon and is a decent way to scout for Tera types when using Booster Energy or Life Orb. It's especially effective at punishing Sucker Punch revenge killers such as Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

  • Ice Beam: With a power-boosting item, Ice Beam OHKOes Dragonite through Multiscale, and is a far safer way to OHKO Ursaluna-B that lack Assault Vest.

  • Flip Turn: Pivoting is a big help when Iron Bundle is facing Pokemon likely to Terastallize such as Chi-Yu or Landorus-T, though it doesn't have great synergy with Booster Energy's one-time use.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt will make support Pokemon such as Alolan Ninetales and Ting-Lu want to take a holiday, though watch out for common users of Mental Herb such as Toxapex.

  • Whirlpool: Although difficult to pull off with Iron Bundle's mediocre bulk, trapping foes with Whirlpool can make Encore especially deadly.

  • Electric Terrain: Giving Iron Bundle a Speed boost via Electric Terrain isn't nearly as flexible as Booster Energy, but it does let Iron Bundle support potentially deadly Quark Drive teammates such as Iron Valiant and Iron Hands.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Iron Bundle's perfect coverage and high Speed means its fairly flexible with a team's Terastallization needs.

  • Water: Besides the power boost for Hydro Pump, Tera Water enables a reliable Water-type STAB move in Tera Blast and avoids an OHKO from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Close Combat.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost gives Iron Bundle an important immunity to Extreme Speed and Quick Attack, which can especially ruin Dragonite, Ogerpon-H's, and Entei's holiday with Encore.

  • Ice: With Tera Ice, Freeze-Dry will OHKO offensive Dragonite through Multiscale and Ice Beam will OHKO even bulky Dragonite and most Assault Vest Ursaluna-B.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Quark Drive's Speed boost lets Iron Bundle outpace key Choice Scarf and Booster threats such as Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Landorus-T.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs Iron Bundle regifts support moves so it can wallbreak, with moves such as Tera Water Hydro Pump now OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu.

  • Focus Sash: Getting around Iron Bundle's iffy bulk makes it a fantastic lead and revenge killer.

  • Life Orb: While Life Orb compromises Iron Bundle's ability to take priority attacks, it boosts damage without passing on powerful support moves.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 44 HP / 12 Def / 148 SpA / 52 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This bulkier spread survives Jolly Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword and Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

Iron Hands.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

CATCH THESE HANDS (Assault Vest).description:
• With its great Attack, its good natural bulk, and a healing move in Drain Punch, Iron Hands stands out as a premier Assault Vest attacker.

  • Thunder Punch versus Wild Charge: Wild Charge lets Iron Hands muscle through bulky foes like physically defensive Dondozo at the cost of longevity.

  • Fake Out: Fake Out picks off weakened, normally faster threats, such as Dragonite and Volcarona. It can also beat Focus Sash leads, such as Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Iron Hands a good option to hit Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam is Iron Hands's best option to hit Fairy-types, notably OHKOing Flutter Mane.

  • Volt Switch: Volt Switch, though incredibly weak, can scout switches and maintain offensive momentum.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: While Iron Hands will function without Terastallizing, it'll be needed to handle Choice Specs Flutter Mane, argubly the most dangerous special attacker in the metagame, as well as handle Ground coverage more reasonably.

  • Ground: Tera Ground gives Iron Hands a strong Earthquake and removes most of its common weaknesses.

  • Grass: Tera Grass giving Spore immunity can stop Breloom cold if it doesn't Terastallize. The Ground-type resistance also lets Iron Hands square up with Ting-Lu much more effectively.

  • Water: Tera Water's Ice and Fire resistances help a lot against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu.

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera allows Iron Hands to take advantage of its great bulk by giving it a better defensive typing, though previously walled Steel-types like Gholdengo and Magnezone become a lot more threatening.

  • Flying: Tera Flying lets Iron Hands completely flip its matchup against Ground-types like Garchomp and Great Tusk and dodge Fissure attempts from the likes of Dondozo and Ting-Lu.

  • Electric:Tera Electric elevates Thunder Punch's power to more acceptable levels, makes Wild Charge very difficult to switch into, and removes Iron Hands's weakness to Fairy.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting allows Iron Hands to deal more damage with Drain Punch while also removing its weakness to Ground-type attacks.

  • Steel: Tera Steel grants a resistance to Fairy and boosts Heavy Slam's power, drastically improving Iron Hands's matchup against Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 252 Atk / 204 SpD / 52 Spe with Adamant: Because Iron Hands is in a highly contested Speed tier with Azumarill and Kingambit, some Speed investment is very helpful. 52 Speed EVs is a substantial boost to help with this while also jumping above the next Speed tier, outrunning targets like 4 Speed Blissey and Brute Bonnet.

  • 252 Atk / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: Going with a simple spread that maximizes power and special bulk is still a very effective option for Iron Hands.

Bulky Substitute.description:
• Iron Hands's incredible bulk gives it one of the game's strongest Substitutes, letting it set up on a unique list of threats.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance lets Iron Hands set up on the passive foes it blocks with Substitute. The Attack boost also pairs very well with Drain Punch, keeping Iron Hands healthy and making it much harder to break.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch provides more immediate damage against pure Ground-types and the ever-present Dragonite.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake hits Gholdengo, Iron Moth, and Tera Fire Chi-Yu hard. It also does well against foes that try to block Drain Punch with Tera Poison.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite having a strong bulk profile, Iron Hands frequently needs to remove its common Ground- and Fairy-type weaknesses to be effective.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy removes all of Iron Hands's most troublesome weaknesses while also granting a powerful Dragon-type immunity. This does, however, make Iron Hands much easier to revenge kill with Gholdengo and Iron Moth.

  • Water: Tera Water is another solid defensive option that drastically improves the Chi-Yu matchup. Likewise, the resistance to Ice is fantastic against Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur, with the latter no longer being able to rely on Icicle Spear to effectively break through Substitute.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting boosts Drain Punch's output while removing Iron Hands's Ground weakness.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can block Will-O-Wisp from support Dragapult and Rotom formes, which otherwise outspeed and burn Iron Hands if it doesn't already have Substitute up.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can turn the tide against faster Grass-types like Breloom and Wo-Chien, blocking their status moves and buying a free turn to start setting up.

EV Spreads

  • 92 HP / 4 Atk / 172 Def / 212 SpD / 28 Spe with Impish: The defensive investment keeps uninvested Dondozo's Wave Crash from breaking Iron Hands's Substitute, providing superior protection from Fissure spam. After Terastallizing, non-STAB Earthquake from the likes of Dragonite and Baxcalibur often fails to break Substitute as well. On the specially defensive side, a full health Iron Hands can survive a Fire Blast from Modest Tera Fire Chi-Yu.

Iron Jugulis.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon might have some niches in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Booster Energy.description:
• While not quite as powerful or versatile as its counterpart Hydreigon, Iron Jugulis fills a unique role due to its higher Speed and Flying-type STAB.

  • Hurricane vs Air Slash: Hurricane secures KOs on Pokemon like Iron Bundle that Air Slash cannot, however, Air Slash is much less likely to miss, and the flinch chance can come in handy occasionally.

  • Taunt: With Taunt, Iron Jugulis stops walls such as Clodsire from healing off its attacks, and prevents debilitating status that would otherwise cut its sweep short.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power grants Iron Jugulis valuable coverage on most Pokémon that would not mind its main attacks, like Tinkaton.

  • Flash Cannon: Flash Cannon is useful for hitting Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane for big damage.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower provides super effective coverage on Steel-types that might otherwise cause issues for Iron Jugulis.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: While not doing much damage to many does due to Iron Jugulis's thoroughly average Attack stat, Knock Off can still help Iron Jugulis and its teammates by softening up defensive cores via item removal.

  • Substitute: Substitute can be used to punish Spore attempts from the likes of Breloom and Brute Bonnet, as well as easing prediction by scouting switches.

  • Focus Blast: Though unreliable due to its accuracy, Focus Blast is Iron Jugulis's best option to hit Kingambit.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Terastallizing into a Flying-type boosts Iron Jugulis's damage output with Air Slash and Hurricane, making it even more difficult to switch into while removing the weaknesses that come from its secondary Dark typing.

  • Dark: A Dark-type Tera boosts Dark Pulse's damage considerably, and when coupled with its rather high flinch rate, a Tera Dark Iron Jugulis can prove quite difficult to handle for some teams.

  • Steel: A Steel-type Tera grants Iron Jugulis a resistance to Fairy and Ice, improving its matchup with Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle and giving it STAB on Flash Cannon.

  • Ground: Tera Ground gives Iron Jugulis an Electric-type immunity, allowing it to block Volt Switch from the likes of Rotom-W and Iron Hands while also giving it STAB on Earth Power.

NANO LOVE (Choice Item).description:
• With its good Speed and powerful STABs, Iron Jugulis lends itself nicely to use a Choice item set, setting itself apart from Hydreigon by virtue of its higher Speed at the cost of some power.

  • Hurricane vs Air Slash: Hurricane offers Iron Jugulis an extremely powerful Flying-type STAB attack, though Air Slash is far more consistent due to its higher accuracy.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power allows Iron Jugulis to hit otherwise irritating switch-ins like Magnezone and Tinkaton.

  • Flash Cannon: Flash Cannon allows Iron Jugulis to punish Fairy-type switch-ins such as Flutter Mane, as well as the numerous Tera Fairy users in the BSS metagame.

  • U-turn: U-turn allows Iron Jugulis to keep momentum for its team by scouting switches and pivoting out of disadvantageous matchups.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs elevates Iron Jugulis's power, allowing it to wallbreak much more consistently.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf's Speed boost allows Iron Jugulis to outspeed otherwise faster foes like Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, potentially surprising them with early KOs.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Tera Flying boosts Air Slash to more respectable power levels, and also makes Hurricane incredibly hard to switch into safely.

  • Dark: Tera Dark pushes Dark Pulse's damage output even further, making Iron Jugulis very hard to deal with in conjunction with the move’s ever-irritating flinch rate.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Iron Jugulis resistances to Fairy and Ice, improving its matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

Iron Moth.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive.description:
• Good Speed, the useful ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, and great coverage make Iron Moth a reasonable alternative to other offensive Fire-types like Chi-Yu and Gouging Fire.

  • Meteor Beam and Power Herb: Beyond being a more flexible way to boost Iron Moth's Special Attack than other options, Meteor Beam and Power Herb let Iron Moth crush opposing Fire-types who can otherwise use their bulk to be an issue, like Entei and opposing Iron Moth.

  • Overheat: Even with the lack of extra coverage, Overheat is so strong that very few Pokemon can safely switch into it if using Choice Specs.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball is highly recommended to hit Urshifu-R and Ursaluna-B as hard as possible.

  • Dazzling Gleam: Dazzling Gleam makes sense with Tera Fairy, dealing huge damage to Roaring Moon and OHKOing Urshifu-S.
