  • Toxic Spikes: Iron Moth stands out as a good choice for an offensive Toxic Spikes setter, though note that it fears Ting-Lu far more than Meowscarada.

Other Options

  • Flame Charge: If not using a Choice item, coverage can be sacrificed in exchange for giving Iron Moth the ability to outspeed major threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Iron Moth's sheer offensive power and good Speed tier means Terastallization isn't integral to it, but it can be a good tool to stop revenge kills.

  • Grass: Tera Grass massively improves Iron Moth's matchup against common foes like Urshifu-R, Landorus-T, and Primarina, and also prevents the rare Breloom lead from launching Spore successfully.

  • Water: Tera Water gives coverage against other Fire-types with Tera Blast, and is still a good option to prevent Choice Scarf Urshfu-R from revenge killing with Surging Strikes.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost pairs best with Meteor Beam or Booster Energy variants, letting Iron Moth dodge Normal-type priority that would usually revenge kill it from Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, and Entei.

  • Fire: When paired with Overheat and Choice Specs, Tera Fire means Fire-resistant foes aren't safe; with even physically defensive Incineroar taking over 60% from it!

  • Fairy: The Dark-type resistance Tera Fairy provides can be a good way to catch Chien-Pao off guard after its Focus Sash has been broken, and saves Iron Moth from Urshifu-S's Sucker Punch.

Items

  • Booster Energy: While Booster Energy does make this Iron Moth less flexible in terms of switching out, the extra power can allow Iron Moth to run bulkier EV spreads, and the lack of recoil like Life Orb can make it a good late-game cleaner too.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs turns Iron Moth into a full blown wallbreaker.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes predicting against foes like Landorus-T less troublesome, and is a perfect fit if setting up Toxic Spikes.

  • Assault Vest: Iron Moth's good special bulk makes Assault Vest a fine choice, letting it survive new attacks such as an unboosted Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle. It can be paired with bulkier EV spreads for even more impressive feats!

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf outspeeds important threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult, who could otherwise outspeed and KO Iron Moth. Note that this item does compete heavily with the more powerful Chi-Yu, so make sure aspects of Iron Moth like Toxic Spikes absorption are important to the team.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 164 HP / 100 Def / 60 SpA / 4 SpD / 180 Spe with Modest: This EV spread survives Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Life Orb Chien-Pao's Throat Chop from full health, survives two Shadow Balls from Modest Flutter Mane that lack an offensive boost, and outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu and Adamant Urshifu formes. If using Assault Vest, even Choice Specs Flutter Mane fails to 2HKO with Shadow Ball!

  • 140 HP / 28 Def / 160 SpA / 180 Spe with Modest: This Assault Vest based spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball, and OHKOes Iron Bundle with Fiery Dance.

Speedy Booster Energy.description:
• With Booster Energy in its circuits, Iron Moth can sacrifice some of its power to become a surprisingly effective late-game sweeper and emergency revenge killer. While Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle are the usual go-to for this, Iron Moth doesn't have to worry about Toxic Spikes or Scizor's Bullet Punch.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball is the best option for dealing damage to bulky foes like Ting-Lu and Suicune, and it also OHKOes Iron Bundle.

  • Dazzling Gleam: Dazzling Gleam is Iron Moth's ticket to overloading Dragon-types like Garchomp and Roaring Moon, who can otherwise stop a sweep.

  • Toxic Spikes versus Toxic: This Iron Moth set is arguably the fastest offensive Toxic Spikes setter that makes sense, making it a reasonable option for Toxic Spike loving teammates like Garganacl. Toxic on the other hand, directly puts a timer on common bulky switch-ins like Dragonite and Ting-Lu.

  • Psychic: While not providing great coverage overall, Psychic is Iron Moth's best move against Toxapex and opposing Iron Moth.

  • EV Spread: The given EV Spread ensures Iron Moth gets a Speed boost upon consuming Booster Energy while providing as much protection from priority attacks as possible. It also avoids a OHKO from Jolly Choice Scarf Landorus-T's Flying Tera Blast.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium If saved for late game, Iron Moth can often get itself in a position to sweep without worrying about revenge kills. Terastallization however, can reduce its vulnerability to certain priority attacks and allow it to be used earlier.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is among the best options, preventing foes Aqua Jet Urshifu-R from from easily stopping a late-game sweep, plus dealing big damage to physically defensive Ting-Lu with Energy Ball.

  • Water: Tera Water still aids against Urshifu-R, but does so while not being OHKOed by Choice Scarf Landorus-T's Flying Tera Blast, at the cost of doing less well against bulky Water and Ground Pokemon.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost blocks common Normal-type priority, from foes like Dragonite, Entei, and Ogerpon-H.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy punishes Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S from attempting to revenge kill with Sucker Punch.

Toxic Spreader.description:
• Iron Moth may seem like a strange Pokemon to use as a bulky Toxic spreader, but it sets itself apart from other Pokemon like Toxapex thanks to being far less passive and having access to phazing.

  • Fiery Dance: While Fiery Dance is not a particularly reliable away to sweep, taking the chance is worth it considering Iron Moth's Speed.

  • Toxic Spikes versus Toxic: Toxic Spikes is the preferred option for its excellent team support for bulky Pokemon like Garganacl, Charm Flutter Mane, and Latias. Toxic on the other hand, lets Iron Moth independently punish bulky responses to it like Ting-Lu and Porygon2.

  • Whirlwind: A phazing move may not seemingly gel well with Speed investment, but it has incredible utility when Toxic Spikes are set up, punishing teams that leave their Toxic Spikes absorber in on Iron Moth.

  • Sludge Wave versus Energy Ball: Giving up on Whirlwind does lose a unique selling point as a Toxic Spikes setter, but in exchange makes Iron Moth much harder to check with Chi-Yu and Primarina. Sludge Wave's damage output makes it the best choice, but Energy Ball stops Swampert from having a field day.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: When the aim is to simply set up Toxic Spikes, Terastallization is not that important. However, Iron Moth's typing gives it enough weaknesses that Terastallization can give it a far longer life span.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Iron Moth a resistance to Water moves without losing its resistance to Ice and Fire, which is helpful against Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu. It's also a great type to use with Tera Blast for dealing damage to Chi-Yu and Ursaluna-B.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Iron Moth deal with powerful Earthquakes from the likes of Ting-Lu and Landorus-T, gives it a vital resistance to Water, and nullifies Spore.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Dark resistance can surprise Chien-Pao looking to revenge kill Iron Moth and protects it from powerful Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Choice Band Dragonite and Gouging Fire.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy can be paired with specialized EV spreads to either get easier KOs, gain a Speed boost, or survive surprising special attacks at the cost of the flexibility of more general EV spreads designed to switch in multiple times.

  • Sitrus Berry: The quick burst of recovery Sitrus Berry gives can be paired with specialized EV spreads, allowing Iron Moth to survive a wider range of attacks.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak protects Iron Moth from the dreaded Salt Cure, which can otherwise put a timer on phazing. It also prevents specially defensive Iron Moth from losing to Chi-Yu's flinch chance.

  • Leftovers versus Black Sludge: Leftovers's residual recovery pairs well with using Whirlwind as much as possible, but it's a fairly high-value item. Black Sludge is an acceptable alternative, but note that it will hurt Iron Moth after Terastallization if not using Tera Poison.

Booster Energy Exclusive EV Spreads

  • 188 HP / 244 Def / 36 SpA / 4 SpD / 36 Spe with Modest: This Booster Energy optimized spread OHKOes 4 Special Defense EVs Iron Bundle with a Quark Drive-boosted Fiery Dance while having good enough physical bulk to have a good chances of surviving powerful attacks from full health, like Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Psyshock.

  • 252 HP / 220 SpD / 36 Spe with Calm: This EV spread gives Iron Moth a Special Defense boost with Quark Drive, making it so bulky that even a Modest Choice Specs Chi-Yu has a low chance of 2HKOing it with Dark Pulse!

Sitrus Berry Exclusive EV Spreads

  • When using Sitrus Berry, make sure to run an even HP stat, so that one use of Ruination will activate it.

  • 180 HP / 228 Def / 100 Spe with Timid: This EV spread almost always survives two hits from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Crunch with Sitrus Berry, and it outspeeds Jolly Annihilape.

  • 244 HP / 188 Def / 12 SpA / 12 SpD / 52 Spe with Bold: This EV spread has around a 90% chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Crunch. The minor Special Defense investment also avoids a 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse and Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

Other EV Spread Examples

  • 236 HP / 228 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 36 Spe with Modest: This EV spread survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Psyshock from full health.

  • 196 HP / 132 SpD / 180 Spe with Calm: This EV spread almost always avoids the 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse while outspeeding it alongside Adamant Urshifu-R.

  • 244 HP / 164 SpD / 100 Spe with Timid: This EV spread outspeeds Jolly Annihilape and, as a bonus, gives Leftovers Iron Moth a nearly guaranteed chance to avoid being 2HKOed by Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse and Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • 244 HP / 52 Def / 4 SpA / 12 SpD / 196 Spe with Timid: This EV spread sacrifices some bulk to outspeed Garchomp while still surviving Life Orb Chien-Pao's Crunch and having a great shot of surviving two uses of Dark Pulse from Timid Chi-Yu. It also gets a Speed boost from Quark Drive.

Benchmarks for Speed EVs

Like many fast bulky Pokemon, Iron Moth has a huge variety of viable EV builds. If you'd like to make your own EV spread though, keep these Speed tiers in mind! Natures that can efficiently use these Speed tiers will be mentioned.

  • 36 Speed EVs with any Neutral Nature: This is the minimum amount of Speed to run, outspeeding Jolly Breloom.

  • 52 Speed EVs with any Neutral Nature: This outspeeds Modest Gholdengo.

  • 76 Speed EVs with Timid or 180 Speed EVs with Calm This outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu and Adamant Urshifu formes. Note that Timid will give Iron Moth a bonus point to Speed, but a Calm nature has a greater chance of surviving some special attacks with specific EV spreads.

  • 100 Speed EVs with Timid: This outspeeds Jolly Annihilape.

  • 132 Speed EVs with Timid: This is the minimum investment for Iron Moth to get a Speed boost from Quark Drive, assuming no Special Attack investment, since doing so will increase Special Attack instead.

  • 156 Speed EVs with Timid: This outspeeds Jolly Urshifu formes and Mimikyu.

  • 196 Speed EVs with Timid: This outspeeds Jolly Garchomp.

Iron Thorns.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon might have a niche in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2, though their viability is uncertain. While we wait for the metagame to settle, here id s sample set that may be viable. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Baxcalibur.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

All-Out Attacker.description:
• Baxcalibur's bulk majorly differentiates it from Chien-Pao as an offensive Ice-type, making it a very relevant alternative.

  • Icicle Spear: Icicle Spear is recommended despite its inconsistent damage, as it deals damage through Mimikyu's disguise and potentially KOes Focus Sash users like Breloom and Meowscarada.

  • Glaive Rush: Glaive Rush makes Baxcalibur very vulnerable to getting KOed the next turn, but it is still the least risky Dragon-type STAB move. Remember that Ice Shard will remove Glaive Rush's negative effects as well.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency Without Focus Sash - High: While Baxcalibur's typing is very helpful against Iron Bundle, its a poor defensive typing otherwise, often forcing it to Terastallize against threats such as Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao.

  • Ground: A Ground Tera type gives Baxcalibur a reliable STAB move in Earthquake, resistance to Stealth Rock, and removes a ton of weaknesses, all at the cost of losing to Chien-Pao, Iron Bundle, and Rotom-W.

  • Electric: With Tera Electric, Baxcalibur's Tera Blast deals massive damage to Corviknight that lack a set up move, Azumarill, does good chip damage to Dondozo, and gains a valuable resistance to Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Ice: Boosting the power of Ice Shard gives Choice Band Baxcalibur new revenge kill chances, and makes wall breaking with Icicle Spear easier.

  • Fire: Tera Fire massively swings the Scizor matchup in Baxcalibur's favor, makes it a good check against powerful Fire-types such as Iron Moth and Volcarona, and severely punishes Chi-Yu's attempts to revenge kill with Overheat.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Baxcalibur's bulk makes it an excellent user of Assault Vest, making it particularly effective against Rotom formes and Iron Bundle.

  • Choice Band: With Choice Band, Baxcalibur becomes an immediate threat, threatening to 2HKO physical walls such as Dondozo.

  • Focus Sash: Chien-Pao has an easier time running Focus Sash, but the sheer surprise value and less reliance on Terastallization still makes it a viable option on Baxcalibur.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Spe with Adamant: This simple EV spread maximizes Baxcalibur's bulk and power.

  • 116 HP / 156 Atk / 236 Spe with Adamant: The Speed investment here outspeeds Modest Gholdengo and Adamant Dragonite.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: If using Focus Sash or Choice Band, winning Speed ties against Great Tusk and opposing Baxcalibur makes maximum Speed much more appealing.

Sweeper.description:
• With good bulk, an immunity to burn, and just enough Speed to work, Baxcalibur is a powerful sweeper.

  • Icicle Spear: Icicle Spear KOes Breloom and Mimikyu through Focus Sash and Disguise respectively.

  • Glaive Rush: While Glaive Rush is valuable for late-game sweeping, it does make Baxcalibur very vulnerable to bulky OHKO move users such as Dondozo, Ting-Lu, and Garganacl.

  • Ice Shard: Ice Shard means Baxcalibur will have a difficult time breaking past bulky Steel-types early-game, but it makes it an effective cleaner otherwise.

Other Options

  • Swords Dance: Dragon Dance is the more reliable option for sweeping due to Baxcalibur's Speed, but Swords Dance can be paired with Ice Shard and an Adamant nature to OHKO fast, frail foes such as Booster Energy Flutter Mane.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization is required for Baxcalibur to cover the most amount of threats via Tera Blast, and patches up its mediocre defensive typing, but Baxcalibur's bulk and tendency to force switches means it's still viable without it.

  • Ground: Tera Ground makes Earthquake an especially reliable sweeping tool, removes most of Baxcalibur's weaknesses, and makes it immune to Thunder Wave.

  • Electric: When paired with Tera Blast, this is Life Orb Baxcalibur's best shot at dealing damage to Dondozo switch-ins. The paralysis immunity also helps Baxcalibur set up against Blissey with less risk.

  • Ice: Tera Ice works great with Ice Shard, making Baxcalibur easier to clean teams with.

  • Steel: With a Tera type of Steel, Baxcalibur has a much better matchup against Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, and a handy resistance to Scizor's Bullet Punch.

  • Fire: Besides adding a useful Bullet Punch resistance, Tera Fire severely punishes powerful Fire-types that think they can revenge kill, and gives Baxcalibur a powerful Tera Blast against Corviknight and Tera Steel Rotom-W.

  • Dragon: This makes Glaive Rush deal obscene damage and removes weaknesses to Mach Punch and Bullet Punch.

Items

  • Loaded Dice: With a guaranteed 4 hits from Icicle Spear, Baxcalibur is able to always OHKO offensive Mimikyu after Dragon Dance.

  • Life Orb: This helps Baxcalibur sweep reliably and ensures Icicle Spear OHKOes Breloom through Focus Sash.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash may seem like a waste with Baxcalibur's bulk, but it provides new set up opportunities and eases match-ups against other Dragon-types.

Gholdengo.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Choice Item.description:
• With Trick and an immunity to status moves, Gholdengo is a dangerous Choice item attacker for offensive and stall teams alike!

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt deals massive damage to Urshifu-R, a key target of revenge killing if using Choice Scarf. It also stops Tera Water Garganacl from walling Gholdengo.

  • Nasty Plot: This can be used to give Gholdengo more bite against defensive, slower teams after using Trick.

Other Options

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast deals huge damage to Incineroar and Porygon2, and blows Chi-Yu out of the water, but its accuracy issues don't make it a great fit for this set.

  • Dazzling Gleam: Dazzling Gleam can be paired with Tera Fairy to crush Urshifu-S, and is a safer move against Chien-Pao who may be tempted to Terastallize into an Electric-type.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Choice Gholdengo is perfectly functional without Terastallizing, it's particularly vulnerable to common Pokemon that Terastallization can solve such as Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Water: This Tera type gives Gholdengo a valuable resistance to Fire and Water, massively improving the matchup against Tera Water Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. It also gives Gholdengo its most reliable Tera Blast against Incineroar and Entei.

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, Gholdengo gains an extremely useful immunity to Ground, which is especially useful on Choice Specs sets against Ursaluna-B and Landorus-T.

  • Steel: Make It Rain becomes very powerful with a Tera boost, giving Choice Specs the chance to OHKO several Ursaluna-B variants in particular.

  • Normal: A Normal Tera type gives Gholdengo the edge against opposing Ghost-types, potentially flipping the table against hard to check sets like Thunder Wave Flutter Mane.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a useful way to resist Sucker Punch without being weak to Fairy-type attacks from Flutter Mane, though the weakness to Scizor can be a huge issue for the Choice Scarf set.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With this, Gholdengo outspeeds key threats such as Urshifu formes, Ogerpon formes, and Chi-Yu. It also outspeeds Chien-Pao and Meowscarada, but beware of Sucker Punch.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs make Gholdengo much more difficult to wall, with Make It Rain dealing over 50% to Assault Vest Landorus-T in particular.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Gholdengo mirror matches are common enough that maximizing Speed is usually a wise idea. Timid is needed to outspeed Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao.

  • 68 HP / 4 Def / 148 SpA / 36 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: This spread survives an unboosted Shadow Ball from Timid Flutter Mane 93.7% of the time while also outspeeding Jolly Breloom.

  • 100 HP / 4 Def / 204 SpA / 36 SpD / 164 Spe with Modest: This bulkier spread for Choice Specs sets allows Gholdengo to survive an unboosted Shadow Ball from Timid Flutter Mane, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom and the rare Jolly Tyranitar.

  • 36 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 44 SpD / 172 Spe with Timid: This spread allows Choice Scarf Gholdengo to outspeed unboosted Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane while being able survive Tera Water or Choice Specs boosted Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle.

Minor Optimizations

  • Neutral Nature and Nature Mints: Use a neutral nature Gholdengo that has a Timid or Modest Mint used on it. This way, Gholdengo can eat any Berry without being confused after Trick.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Nasty Plot makes Gholdengo a terror against slower teams, especially with its good bulk, unpredictable coverage, and diverse Tera Types.

  • Focus Blast: Despite its reliability issues, a boosted Focus Blast OHKOes Incineroar, who otherwise is a great check against Gholdengo, in addition to ripping through Chi-Yu switch-ins.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Gholdengo avoid residual damage from Garganacl's Salt Cure and eases prediction in general.

Other Options

  • Psyshock: Psyshock lets Gholdengo break through Clodsire more easily, but isn't particularly relevant outside of this.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Gholdengo may have a great typing, but common Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Ogerpon-H will usually revenge kill it without Terastallization.

  • Water: With this Tera type and Tera Blast, Chien-Pao, Ting-Lu, and Fire-types like Incineroar and Entei all have a far harder time revenge killing Gholdengo.

  • Flying: Flying Gholdengo gets the jump on dangerous offensive Ground-types like Landorus-T, Ursaluna-B, and Garchomp.

  • Normal: While it's a much worse defensive typing, Tera Normal does let Gholdengo surprise faster Ghost-types like Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, at the cost of being revenge killed by Urshifu formes.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak prevents Salt Cure from chipping down Gholdengo, making it far easier for it to run Recover against Garganacl.

  • Leftovers: This is the most reliable option for keeping Gholdengo healthy and pairs especially well with Substitute.

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon ruins Breloom's chances of winning the lead war against Gholdengo and makes Hippowdon easy set-up bait.

  • Focus Sash: Despite Gholdengo's good bulk, Focus Sash is useful for giving it new opportunities to sweep.

EV Spreads

  • 68 HP / 4 Def / 148 SpA / 36 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: If using Recover, some bulk investment makes sense, with all but the highest damage roll from Timid Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball failing to OHKO. It also outspeeds Jolly Breloom, and at least speedties with other Modest Gholdengo.

  • 252 HP / 172 Def / 52 SpA / 28 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This bulky spread survives a Shadow Ball from Modest Flutter Mane assuming it lacks an offensive boost and can use Terastallization to avoid a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's STAB attacks.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Maximizing Speed is useful on more offensive sets to at least speedtie with opposing Gholdengo, and outspeeding several threats close to this Speed tier, such as Dragonite.

Defensive.description:
• While Gholdengo's defensive stats aren't remarkable, it's fantastic typing and immunity to status moves like Taunt make it a great defensive Pokemon, and a horrifically effective spreader of paralysis!

  • Hex versus Shadow Ball: Hex gives this Gholdengo a good offensive kick against paralyzed foes, but Shadow Ball is worth considering for its consistency.

  • Make It Rain versus Focus Blast: Make It Rain is Gholdengo's most consistent way of dealing damage to Garganacl, but this set's defensive nature makes it difficult to win the one-on-one. Focus Blast isn't nearly as reliable, but it's Gholdengo's best shot at making it past Ting-Lu and Incineroar, and punishing Chi-Yu switch-ins.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Gholdengo's fantastic typing, Chien-Pao is easily able to break through any Gholdengo that doesn't Terastallize.

  • Water: Tera Water is the best Fire-type resistant Tera type for Gholdengo, letting it potentially survive an assault from Chi-Yu and Incineroar, though their coverage moves can still seriously damage Gholdengo. When used with Rocky Helmet, it also makes Gholdengo an effective Choice Scarf Urshifu-R check.

  • Flying: Avoiding Earthquake against foes like Landorus-T makes Tera Flying extremely useful for Gholdengo; this also gives it protection against Fissure from the likes of Dondozo and Garganacl.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Gholdengo a much better matchup against Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S, who commonly revenge kill Gholdengo otherwise.

  • Normal: Tera Normal is not incredible defensively, but it does let Gholdengo surprise faster Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, both of whom despise paralysis.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 236 Def / 20 Spe with Bold: The given EV spread will outspeed up to paralyzed Dragapult.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: This offers Gholdengo the best shot of surviving Ursaluna-B's Earth Power followed by Vacuum Wave after Leftovers recovery.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 with Bold: The Speed investment allows Gholdengo to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu formes and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu with the magic of paralysis, which is an especially effective combination when using Tera Water!

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet takes advantage of Gholdengo's excellent typing against physical moves, making it a good way to punish contact moves such as Outrage from Dragonite.

  • Covert Cloak: This is Gholdengo's best shot of outstalling Garganacl, since it grants an immunity to Salt Cure's effect.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is at its best with specially defensive Gholdengo, letting it withstand Ursaluna-B's Earth Power followed by Vacuum Wave without requiring Terastallization.

  • Weakness Policy: While this might seem strange on a defensive Pokemon, Weakness Policy lets Gholdengo beat opposing Gholdengo as long as they lack Choice Specs.

Wo-Chien.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Leech Seed.description:
• With excellent bulk and a unique array of moves to support it, Wo-Chien stands out as a dangerous user of Leech Seed and a prime Pokemon to stall matches out with.

  • Foul Play versus Knock Off: Foul Play is Wo-Chien's most consistent offensive move that also happens to punish setup sweepers, while Knock Off's support is especially helpful against Trick users such as Gholdengo and Rotom-W. Note that both are viable together if you're willing to give up a support move.

  • Substitute: When paired together with Toxic Spikes, Protect and Substitute makes even foes that should beat Wo-Chien get worn down before they can KO it, such as Chi-Yu. Substitute itself protects Wo-Chien from slow users of Yawn such as Dondozo and Hippowdon, and slow OHKO moves from Ting-Lu, Dondozo, and Kingambit.

  • Ruination: Ruination gives Wo-Chien powerful chipping down potential, though it should never be used as Wo-Chien's only attack due to it being extremely difficult to KO with. When paired with Knock Off, it's especially useful against Wo-Chien mirror matches.

  • Giga Drain: With Stealth Rock support, Giga Drain OHKOes Iron Bundle and almost always 2HKOes Chien-Pao. If you allocate 60 EVs to Special Attack, Giga Drain will OHKO Iron Bundle regardless of Stealth Rock.

  • Taunt: Taunt does an excellent job of surprising other Taunt Pokemon switching in, such as Annihilape and Corviknight.

  • Toxic Spikes Partners: Wo-Chien becomes far more deadly with Toxic Spikes support, letting it quickly wear down a wide variety of foes even faster. Toxapex is one of the best options thanks to its good defensive synergy with Wo-Chien, but other options include Iron Moth, Glimmora, Clodsire, Focus Sash Meowscarada, and the niche Gengar.

Other Options

  • Snarl: Snarl makes fearsome special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu far easier to switch into when Wo-Chien needs to escape, though Wo-Chien will need to have the correct Tera Type to outstall these foes itself.

  • Ingrain: In addition to providing some extra recovery, Ingrain makes phazers such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon fail to stop Wo-Chien consistently, though Wo-Chien being trapped is a serious drawback.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite Wo-Chien's fantastic bulk, its vulnerability to Toxic Spikes and poor defensive typing mean it must often Terastallize to stall out teams.

  • Poison: Tera Poison provides a vital resistance to Fairy and Fighting, and it also lets Wo-Chien absorb Toxic Spikes.

  • Fairy: Besides being a great defensive type, Tera Fairy helps Wo-Chien against Fighting-types that'd normally beat it.

  • Water: Tera Water provides Ice and Fire resistances, helpful against Baxcalibur, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives useful resistances to Fairy, Fire, and Ice, which help against major threats like Flutter Mane, Baxcalibur, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao.

Items

  • Leftovers: Wo-Chien's stalling playstyle makes Leftovers the most consistent recovery item.

  • Big Root: If another Pokemon desperately needs Leftovers, Big Root is a viable alternative for getting extra recovery from Leech Seed and Giga Drain.

EV Spreads and Adjustments

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish or Bold: Maximizing Wo-Chien's physical bulk lets it pull off some incredible stunts, such as avoiding a 3HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch with Leftovers and, after Terastallization, avoiding a 2HKO from Choice Band Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful or Calm: With the correct Tera Type and maximum Special Defense, Wo-Chien can take on Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle much more effectively.

  • Using 60 SpA EVs: If you're willing to give up a bit of bulk, this investment is required to OHKO Iron Bundle with Giga Drain with either a Bold or a Calm nature.

  • Using 100 Speed EVs: With some sacrifice to bulk, this Speed investment lets Wo-Chien outspeed Adamant maximum Speed Kingambit, and it can be vital in Wo-Chien mirror matches after Terastallization makes it vulnerable to Leech Seed, due to Substitute blocking Leech Seed.

Chien-Pao.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

RUINOUS ATTACKER.description:
• With its high Attack and Speed, and incredible ability in Sword of Ruin, Chien-Pao is one of the strongest physical attackers in the game.

  • Icicle Crash: While Ice Spinner is perfectly accurate, Icicle Crash’s higher power and flinch chance makes it the preferred attack. Additionally, not being a contact move allows Chien-Pao to avoid unnecessary chip damage from Rocky Helmet users.

  • Sucker Punch versus Crunch: Sucker Punch offers priority with a strong base power at the cost of necessitating prediction, while Crunch is a more standard attack whose Defense drop can allow Chien-Pao to potentially break through bulky foes.

  • Ice Shard: Ice Shard is a more consistent albeit weaker alternative to Sucker Punch.

  • Sacred Sword: Sacred Sword provides coverage for Pokemon that resist one or both of Chien-Pao’s STAB attacks, like Chi-Yu and other Chien-Pao, plus its Chien-Pao's best shot against Porygon2. Additionally, ignoring defense boosts allows Chien-Pao to deal more consistent damage to foes who boost their Defense like Archaludon and Garganacl.

  • Psychic Fangs: Psychic Fangs rips up Dual Screens, which makes Focus Sash Chien-Pao's match-up against Alolan Ninetales more favorable. Otherwise, it does good damage to Primarina, Urshifu-R, and Toxapex.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant gives Chien-Pao a significant power boost for sniping Pokemon with Sucker Punch, but Jolly is important for Speed tying with Flutter Mane and opposing Chien-Pao.

  • 0-1 SpA IV: If using Tera Blast on Jolly Chien-Pao, make sure to to use a SpA IV that's 0-1. This is because if Flutter Mane uses Charm, any SpA IV that's higher will result in Tera Blast becoming a Special Attack.

Other Options

  • Swords Dance: While it can be difficult to fit and very reliant on Focus Sash, Swords Dance boosts Chien-Pao’s Attack to unwallable levels, making it a very potent sweeper.

  • Lash Out: Lash Out is a situational but powerful response to Charm Flutter Mane and Breaking Swipe Gouging Fire thanks to the doubled BP on the turn Chien-Pao's Attack is lowered.

  • Sheer Cold: While it may seem alluring, Sheer Cold is a very risky slot on this set, as its standard attacks already hit most relevant foes. Even if Chien-Pao fails to KO a foe, it will generally leave it within range for a teammate.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Chien-Pao offers power in spades without needing to Terastallize, only needing it on very rare occasions to break past specific walls or dodge priority moves aimed at it.

  • Electric: Tera Electric can be used in tandem with Tera Blast to improve Chien-Pao’s matchup against key threats such as Urshifu-R and Primarina while also making it immune to paralysis.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost doesn’t offer much offensive benefit, but it allows Chien-Pao to dodge Normal-type priority from Dragonite, Ogerpon formes, and Entei, which can be particularly useful if using Swords Dance.

  • Stellar: Stellar's one-time boost per attacking type can open up new sweeping opportunities for Chien-Pao, especially for Life Orb sets.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Chien-Pao survive Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, which otherwise threatens to OHKO through Focus Sash. Combined with Tera Blast, Chien-Pao still threatens big damage into Urshifu-R and Primarina.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosts Sucker Punch to extreme power levels while making Crunch exceptionally difficult to switch into without a resistance.

  • Ice: Tera Ice can allow Chien-Pao to finish foes off with Ice Shard from higher ranges and makes Icicle Crash an even more formidable tool.

Choice Band Breaker.description:
• Choice Band transforms Chien-Pao into one of the most bloodthirsty wall-breakers in the metagame!

  • Ice Shard versus Sucker Punch: Ice Shard is the weaker but more reliable priority move for cleaning late-game. Sucker Punch is one of the most powerful priority moves in the metagame, but falters against support moves like Substitute and Thunder Wave.

  • Sacred Swords versus Psychic Fangs: Sacred Sword gives Chien-Pao useful coverage against bulky foes like Porygon2 and Archaludon, as well as opposing Chien-Pao. Psychic Fang's coverage is worse, but it hits the important Urshifu-R and Primarina, as well as breaking dual screens.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Chien-Pao is already plenty powerful, Choice Band combined with Tera can elevate 2HKOs to OHKOs on some of the bulkiest walls in the meta. For this reason, Tera can be worth using on Choice Band sets.

  • Dark: Tera Dark turns Choice Band Crunch into a devastating wallbreaker move that few can withstand, OHKOing Max HP Annihilape, Entei, and Scizor if using an Adamant nature. Neutralizing Chien-Pao’s Steel-type weakness also makes it less vulnerable to Scizor’s Bullet Punch.

  • Ice: Tera Ice gives Choice Band Icicle Crash enough power to challenge even physically defensive Ting-Lu, having approximately a 69% chance to OHKO if using an Adamant nature; be warned, however, that Ting-Lu often Terastallizes in front of Chien-Pao, making this inconsistent. The extra power behind Ice Shard is also a welcome boost.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy combined with Choice Band Tera Blast handily defeats some of Chien-Pao's less common checks, OHKOing standard variants of Annihilape and Urshifu formes. It also removes several weaknesses, most notably turning Chien-Pao's 4x Fighting-type weakness into a resistance. Make sure to use a Special Attack IV of 0 or 1 to avoid Charm flipping Tera Blast into a Special Attack!

EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 228 Atk / 12 Def / 60 SpD / 188 Spe Adamant: This spread allows Chien-Pao to survive all but the highest damage rolls from Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed, and Modest Ursaluna-B's Vacuum Wave. The Speed investment outspeeds Jolly Ogerpon formes.

  • 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe Jolly: This spread just attempts to speedtie with Flutter Mane and opposing Chien-Pao.

Ting-Lu.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Ting-Lu's absurd bulk and excellent support movepool make it the premier Stealth Rock setter in the metagame!

  • Ruination: Ruination gives Ting-Lu the most consistent option for damage output, without resorting to offensive investment.

  • Taunt: While Ting-Lu's Speed is awful compared to most Taunt users, using Taunt against foes like Urshifu formes on the switch is still useful, plus Ting-Lu can use some specialized Speed EVs to outspeed certain paralyzed threats. Note that while using Taunt against Toxapex can be useful, it is highly likely to run Mental Herb, which risks getting Ting-Lu poisoned.

  • Protect: Protect with Leftovers is a strong choice when running Ting-Lu with high sustain teammates such as Toxapex, and can keep Ting-Lu's health up when its in risky situations like trapped by Dragonite's Fire Spin.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam deals serious damage to Fairy-types, with Flutter Mane in particular needing a huge amount of defensive investment to avoid being OHKOed by it.

Other Options

  • Fissure: Fissure lets Ting-Lu potentially punish passive Pokemon without Substitute, such as Toxapex.

  • Spikes: Getting Stealth Rock and Spikes together makes Whirlwind a very effective damage dealing tool, in addition to supporting other offensive Pokemon. However, it can be difficult to set up without compromising Ting-Lu's damage output.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Even with Ting-Lu's fantastic bulk, Terastallization greatly increases the amount of Pokemon it can beat one-on-one, such as Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

  • Poison: Tera Poison gives Ting-Lu an important resistance to Fairy and Fighting, and it lets it absorb Toxic Spikes.

  • Fairy: In addition to a useful Fighting resistance, Tera Fairy helps Ting-Lu against powerful Dragon-types like Choice Band Dragonite and Choice Band Gouging Fire.

  • Water: With Tera Water, Ting-Lu has a significantly better matchup against Urshifu-R. The Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu matchups can also benefit, but be mindful of potential Tera Blast coverage.

  • Steel: Tera Steel retaining a Fighting weakness is unfortunate, but in exchange, Heavy Slam will OHKO even most bulky Flutter Mane, and it gives Ting-Lu a good matchup against Iron Bundle.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry versus Leftovers: Ting-Lu's lack of reliable recovery usually makes Sitrus Berry the most reliable method of surviving an extra attack. Leftovers is a good alternative if Sitrus Berry is needed somewhere else, and even preferable if running Protect.

  • Mental Herb: Mental Herb can be used to nullify one use of Taunt or Encore, which Ting-Lu is fairly vulnerable to, at the cost of reducing its lifespan with a lack of any recovery.

EV Spread Information

  • Physical Defense versus Special Defense: Specializing in one defensive stat depends on which threats Ting-Lu needs to handle, with physically defensive variants preforming better against threats like Dragonite and Roaring Moon, and when Terastallized, Chien-Pao, Ogerpon-H, and Urshifu-R. For specially defensive variants, major targets include Gholdengo and Latios, and when Terastallized, Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Chi-Yu.

  • HP Stat Adjustments with Sitrus Berry: When using a Sitrus Berry, running an even HP number is the best option, so Ting-Lu will eat its berry right after being hit by Ruination.

  • 252 HP / 156 Def / 100 SpD with Impish: When Terastallized to a neutral typing and holding a Sitrus Berry, Ting-Lu survives up to four Icicle Crashes from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao. It also avoids a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast even without Terastallizing thanks to Sitrus Berry.

  • 140 HP / 116 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: This Specially Defensive spread withstands even Modest Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat!

Speed Benchmarks With Taunt

  • Investing in Speed may seem absurd, but with paralysis support, Ting-Lu can realistically outspeed some major threats!

  • 60 Speed EVs: This outspeeds up to paralyzed Jolly Dragonite, which can save Ting-Lu from Encore.

  • 76 Speed EVs: This outspeeds up to paralyzed Adamant Urshifu-R, and many variants of Ursaluna-B.

  • 92 Speed EVs: This outspeeds up to paralyzed Modest Chi-Yu.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest and Vessel of Ruin combine to make Ting-Lu an especially formidable tank.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam deals far more damage to Flutter Mane and Mimikyu than any other attack, with even Bold Flutter Mane having a good shot at being OHKOed after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Fissure: Fissure is Ting-Lu's best shot at KOing bulky foes like Stamina Archaludon and Ursaluna-B.

  • Payback versus Throat Chop: Payback will usually deal more damage thanks to how slow Ting-Lu is, but Throat Chop will punish Pokemon that switch in more.

  • EV Spread: The given EV spread maximizes Ting-Lu's Attack and special bulk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Ting-Lu doesn't need Terastallization to function, it makes it far more effective at beating a wide variety of Pokemon one-on-one.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy not only helps Ting-Lu against powerful Dragon- and Fighting-type attacks, but it also gives Ting-Lu a good Tera Blast to hit Dragonite and Roaring Moon with.

  • Poison: Tera Poison gives Ting-Lu a vital Fairy resistance against Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, and it lets it absorb the dreaded Toxic and Toxic Spikes. It still makes a reasonable Tera Blast option for hitting Primarina and Serperior hard as well.

  • Water: Tera Water is a fantastic defensive typing, letting Ting-Lu avoid a 2HKO from Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Ting-Lu a powerful STAB Heavy Slam, giving it a great matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. It does become an issue against common Fire-types like Ogerpon-H and Gouging Fire though.

Chi-Yu.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Choice-Yu.description:
• With a Choice item, Chi-Yu can choose to become either a spicy revenge killer or a scorching wallbreaker!

  • Flamethrower versus Lava Plume: Flamethrower's higher power makes it the better cleaning tool, but Lava Plume's higher burn chance gives Chi-Yu a good shot of punishing major physical attacking fores such as Dragonite, Azumarill, and Garchomp that resist Fire.

  • Psychic: This is Chi-Yu's most powerful attack against Urshifu-R and Toxapex and can pick off weakened Annihilape without Overheat's Special Attack drop.

  • Tera Blast: Even before Terastallizing, Tera Blast is a decent coverage move that hits Primarina and Roaring Moon.

  • Modest versus Timid: Modest is generally preferred since Chi-Yu's Speed isn't too impressive, but Timid does ensure that Chi-Yu outspeeds Urshifu formes, Annihilape, and Mimikyu, who are fully capable of revenge killing Chi-Yu that lack Choice Scarf.

Other Options

  • Fire Blast: Fire Blast's shaky accuracy can be an issue, but it's a far better sweeping tool than Overheat.

  • Memento: Support isn't Chi-Yu's forte, but Memento lets Choice Scarf sets potentially set-up a sweeper in exchange for KOing itself.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Chi-Yu's damage output is red hot even without Terastallization, making it a fairly flexible Pokemon.

  • Fire: Tera Fire Overheat is extremely difficult to wall without a resistance, making it an easy choice for Chi-Yu. It also lets Tera Blast become a powerful STAB move while Chi-Yu is locked into using it, letting it get around the normal limitations of using a Choice item.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a good response to Urshifu-R and Primarina, and lets Chi-Yu avoid being OHKOed by Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Chi-Yu's best shot of defeating Roaring Moon and and gives it an important Fighting-type resistance.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost lets Chi-Yu surprise common users of Normal-type priority such as Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, and Entei, with the bonus of blocking Breloom from an easy revenge kill.

  • Dark: While Tera Dark is nowhere near as impressive as a boosted Overheat, Dark Pulse has excellent coverage and also removes Chi-Yu's troublesome Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Water: Getting a Water-type resistance is always useful against Urshifu-R, but the real key for Tera Water is that it helps Chi-Yu in the mirror match-up, especially against Assault Vest Chi-Yu.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf patches up Chi-Yu's lukewarm Speed into something usable for revenge killing and also makes bulkier builds easier to use.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs trades revenge killing for terrifying wallbreaking power. With Tera Fire, the heat gets so extreme that even Blissey is 2HKOed by Overheat!

Bulkier EV Spread

  • 228 HP / 12 Def / 124 SpA / 4 SpD / 140 Spe with Modest: This is a bulky spread meant for Choice Scarf, outspeeding up to Iron Bundle. The bulk investment survives Breloom's Mach Punch, Mimikyu's Play Rough followed by Shadow Sneak, and has a good shot of surviving Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed. 40 EVs can be moved from Special Attack to Speed to outspeed Dragapult at a serious cost to power.

Offensive.description:
• Chi-Yu's sizzling offensive power lets it get away with a wide variety of options that wouldn't fit on a Choice item set.

  • Flamethrower versus Lava Plume: Flamethrower's greater power makes it the better option in most instances, but Lava Plume's higher burn rate is good at punishing switch-ins like Roaring Moon and Dragonite.

  • Flame Charge: Chi-Yu is powerful enough that even without an offensive item, getting a Speed boost makes cleaning teams late-game very achievable.

  • Psychic: Psychic is Chi-Yu's best option against Urshifu-R and Toxapex. Note that Overheat will out-damage targets like Annihilape though.

Other Options

  • Will-O-Wisp: If not using Assault Vest, Will-O-Wisp severely punishes bulky physical threats like Roaring Moon and Dragonite that may switch in and works great with Terastallization to surprise other bulky threats such Ting-Lu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Chi-Yu has a ton of weaknesses to common attacking types, so while Terastallization isn't needed to function, it can especially help bulkier Chi-Yu check more threats and otherwise focus less on hit-and-run attacking.

  • Fire: Beyond giving Overheat soul-melting damage output, Tera Fire gives Chi-Yu a vital Fairy-type resistance against Flutter Mane and a good shot of OHKOing even bulky Flutter Mane with Overheat.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a huge help against Urshifu-R and Primarina, and can save Chi-Yu from Choice Scarf Landorus-T revenge kills as long as it doesn't use Flying Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy has good synergy with Chi-Yu's former typing, giving it a vital Fighting-type resistance and ensuring Chi-Yu is not walled by Roaring Moon.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost is Chi-Yu's best hope against Dragonite and Entei's Extreme Speed, as well as blocking snipes from Ogerpon-H's Quick Attack.

  • Water: Tera Water works great on Assault Vest Chi-Yu with Tera Blast, ironically turning it into a decent check against other Chi-Yu! It also eases the matchup against Urshifu-R.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Chi-Yu has shockingly decent Special Defense, so Assault Vest lets it preform much better against Flutter Mane and opposing Chi-Yu.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets you get away with playing this set far more offensively at the cost of being even weaker to priority attacks than usual.

  • Focus Sash: If using a more offensive spread, Focus Sash can be worth it to flip the tables on fast offensive foes such as Iron Bundle.

  • Eject Pack: This turns Overheat into a one-use pivot move, surprising foes with a momentum shift in your favor.

EVs

  • 228 HP / 12 Def / 124 SpA / 4 SpD / 140 Spe with Modest: This bulky spread is perfect for Assault Vest and Flame Charge, letting Chi-Yu outspeed Iron Bundle after a boost and avoid an OHKO from Breloom's Mach Punch. It also avoids a KO from Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak following Play Rough and often survives Tera Normal Dragonite's Choice Band Extreme Speed. If outspeeding the rare Dragapult after Flame Charge is a priority, 40 Special Attack EVs can be moved to Speed.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: When using more offensive items like Life Orb or Focus Sash, going a more offensive route makes Chi-Yu a better late-game sweeper. Modest is preferred for the damage output, but Timid outspeeds Urshifu formes and Annihilape.

Nasty Plot.description:
• While not easy to sweep with due to it's Speed, Chi-Yu becomes a a hot wallbreaker after setting up Nasty Plot!

  • Overheat: Overheat's Special Attack drop may conflict with Nasty Plot, but it'll deep-fry almost any Pokemon slower than Chi-Yu, making it a worthy wallbreaking tool.

  • Psychic: Psychic shatters Urshifu-R, a common revenge killer against Chi-Yu.

  • Substitute: Substitute does a great job of punishing common status users such as Archaludon. If Terastallized, Chi-Yu has a good chance of retaining its Substitute against Salt Cure as well.

  • Timid versus Modest: While this Chi-Yu is more focused on extreme wall-frying than sweeping, Timid is nice for outspeeding Urshifu formes and Annihilape, whom certainly can't handle boosted attacks well.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Chi-Yu's poor defensive typing can make it fairly easy to revenge kill, so having Terastallization free gives Chi-Yu much more KO opportunities beyond cooking slower threats.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Overheat an insane wall-breaking move, with Life Orb threatening to OHKO Blissey after a boost!

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost covers Chi-Yu's Fighting-type weakness and helps against Extreme Speed and Quick Attack, making it much harder to stop its sweep.

  • Grass: With Tera Grass, Chi-Yu can threaten to OHKO Primarina after a boost in addition to resisting Urshifu-R's Aqua Jet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Chi-Yu a helpful Fighting-type resistance and a better match-up against powerful Dragon-types like Dragonite and Roaring Moon.

  • Dark: With Nasty Plot and Life Orb, Tera Dark Chi-Yu is capable of OHKOing even the most specially defensive Annihilape with Dark Pulse!

  • Water: Tera Water lets Chi-Yu deal with opposing Chi-Yu more comfortably.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes setting up Nasty Plot much easier, at the cost of power.

  • Life Orb: While it makes Chi-Yu even more vulnerable to priority moves, Life Orb is otherwise an excellent wallbreaking item, notably giving Chi-Yu a better matchup against stall teams.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 24 HP / 12 Def / 220 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid or Modest: If using Substitute, this spread prevents Garganacl with 4 Attack EVs from breaking a Terastallized Chi-Yu's Substitute with Salt Cure. Note that Body Press and Earthquake will still break the Substitute unless using the correct Tera Type.

Roaring Moon.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new changes that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive Dragon Dance.description:
• With great special bulk, Speed, and Booster Energy juicing up one of its stats, Roaring Moon is a great choice for late-game sweeping!

  • Acrobatics: When powered-up by Tera Flying and Booster Energy, Acrobatics becomes a very powerful STAB that puts foes like Ogerpon-H and Urshifu-R in their places.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head is Roaring Moon's best shot of slicing up bulky Flutter Mane, and is an especially good fit with Tera Steel.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake lets Roaring Moon smack Incineroar, Archaludon, and Garganacl hard without resorting to Outrage lock-ins.

Other Options

  • Scale Shot and Loaded Dice: This is an alternative way to give Roaring Moon a Dragon-type STAB and a way to boost its Speed, though it makes it even more vulnerable to priority than usual.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Roaring Moon's great special bulk is offset by its awkward typing, meaning Terastallization is highly recommended to aid its set up.

  • Flying: Tera Flying has fantastic synergy with Roaring Moon, giving it a vital Fighting resistance and soaring the power of Acrobatics into the stratosphere!

  • Steel: Tera Steel's good match-up against Fairy- and Dragon-types makes it a prime choice, with Flutter Mane in particular being a huge target.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is an excellent way to set-up on fearsome Dragon-types such as Gouging Fire and Choice Scarf Latios, and it gives Roaring Moon a vital Fighting-type resistance against otherwise troublesome foes like Urshifu-S. Speaking of Urshifu-S, Tera Blast with this typing also transforms Roaring Moon into a good check against it.

  • Fire: With Tera Fire, Roaring Moon gains a useful resistance to Bullet Punch and Fairy-type attacks. The Will-O-Wisp immunity helps too, but the Stealth Rock weakness does makes this a more niche option overall.

EV Spreads

  • 220 Atk / 36 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread gives Roaring Moon a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, making it a good revenge killer.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: This simple spread makes Protosynthesis boost Attack, perfect for unleashing brutal Acrobatics right off the bat!

Choice Attacker.description:
• It's great Speed and powerful STAB attacks make Roaring Moon a fearsome offensive pivot!

  • Outrage: Outrage is a risky move, but it excels at cleaning teams in the late game.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head is good coverage against bulky Flutter Mane and common Tera Fairy types like Dragonite and Gouging Fire.

  • Torkoal and Sun Teams: Roaring Moon functions perfectly fine on its own, but it also just so happens to be a fantastic option on Sun teams! If using this archetype, consider Torkoal, who can support Roaring Moon with Stealth Rock to make late-game cleaning even easier.

Other Options

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf gives Roaring Moon the chance to get some shocking revenge kills against threats like Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Urshifu-S, though its quite a bit more vulnerable to strong priority attacks compared to popular alternatives like Landorus-T and Gouging Fire.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: This Roaring Moon goes for immediate all-out strength, so its defensive typing isn't as key as other sets. Still, Roaring Moon's nerve-wracking weakness to Fairy coverage makes Terastallization a good idea.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Roaring Moon a good match-up against Fairy types like Flutter Mane with Iron Head, and the Stealth Rock resistances lets it pivot out with less consequences.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy not only absorbs Dragon-type attacks, but it also massively improves Roaring Moon's match-ups against strong Fighting-types such as Urshifu-S and Annihilape via Tera Blast.

  • Fire: Tera Fire's Stealth Rock weakness is a bit problematic with U-turn, but has great offensive and defensive synergy, letting Roaring Moon take Fairy-type attacks, and crisp foes if using it on a sun team.

  • Electric: Tera Electric gives a handy Bullet Punch resistances and lets Roaring Moon zap Primarina and Urshifu-R with Tera Blast.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 220 Atk / 36 Def / 252 Spe: This spread gives Roaring Moon a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, which can be useful if running Choice Band on a sun team.

Bulky Dragon Dance.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread: This spread allows Roaring Moon to outspeed Jolly Urshifu formes, and the ability to avoid a 2HKO from Iron Bundle if Roaring Moon Terastallizes. This spread also gains an Attack boost from Booster Energy. If outspeeding the less common Garchomp is important, 244 Speed EVs will be required.

Acrobatics.description:
• With Booster Energy juicing up Tera Flying Acrobatics and one of Roaring Moon's stats, it's an excellent choice for late-game sweeping!

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is Roaring Moon's best shot at beating Kingambit.

  • Taunt: Taunt is the best way around troublesome defensive foes, such as Dondozo, Corviknight, and Tera Fairy Skeledirge.

  • Throat Chop: Throat Chop is the preferred Dark-type STAB move over Crunch, since it can shut down important sound moves from Skeledirge, Volcarona, and Sylveon.

  • Roost: Recovery really allows Roaring Moon to take advantage of its good special bulk, especially if investing in it.

EV Spreads

  • 220 Atk / 36 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread gives Roaring Moon a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, making it a good revenge killer.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: This simple spread makes Protosynthesis boost Attack, potentially letting Roaring Moon 2HKO Skeledirge with Acrobatics.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 20 Def / 204 SpD / 28 Spe with Careful: This spread takes a slower, bulkier approach to boosting, getting a Special Defense boost from Protosynthesis and outspeeding Dragapult after one Dragon Dance. This spread is best used with Roost, and Taunt is also highly recommended to get past Skeledirge.

Dragon Dance.description:
• While Roaring Moon is most known for using Booster Energy and Acrobatics, other Tera Types and moves can let it defeat a different set of threats and be used earlier in the game.

  • Throat Chop: Throat Chop shutting down important sound moves such as Volcarona's Bug Buzz makes it the better option over Crunch.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head is good at punishing Fairy Terastallization, especially when using Tera Steel Roaring Moon.

  • Roost: Even with the offensive nature of this set, Roost is good against Choice locked foes.

  • Scale Shot: While lowering Roaring Moon's Defense makes it even more vulnerable to priority, the Speed boost can lead to some surprising sweeps when picking off foes. It also has a shot of OHKOing offensive Dragonite through Multiscale.

Other Options

  • Outrage: This is by far Roaring Moon's strongest attack, though being locked in can easily lead to counter play via Terastallization and Fairy-types.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Tera Steel's good matchup against Fairy- and Dragon-types makes it a prime candidate.

  • Fire: With Tera Fire, Roaring Moon gains a useful resistance to Bullet Punch and cooks Scizor, Tinkaton, and Corviknight with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is an excellent answer to faster Dragon-types such Dragapult and Choice Scarf Garchomp and gives Roaring Moon a vital Fighting-type resistance against otherwise troublesome foes like Great Tusk, Iron Hands, and Annihilape.

  • Ghost: Roaring Moon gains a useful Extreme Speed and Mach Punch immunity, making Dragonite and Breloom far less problematic. This is especially useful if using Scale Shot.

Items

  • Life Orb: While making Roaring Moon more vulnerable to priority, the reliable damage output means Roaring Moon doesn't have to set up to deal massive damage.

  • Booster Energy: Beyond making Roaring Moon more suited for late-game sweeping, Booster Energy is perfect for making opponents think its the more common Acrobatics set.

  • Loaded Dice: When using Scale Shot, Loaded Dice is a strong consideration, letting +1 Roaring Moon always OHKO offensive Dragonite and almost always OHKO Breloom with Scale Shot.

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry is perfect for taking advantage of Pokemon that are likely to inflict status on Roaring Moon, such as Tinkaton, Rotom-W, and Umbreon.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: This classic spread will give Roaring Moon an Attack boost from Protosynthesis.

  • 220 Atk / 36 Def / 252 Spe: This is the spread to use if a Speed Boost from Protosynthesis is needed.

Jaw Lock Trapper.description:
• With Jaw Lock, Roost, and Taunt, Roaring Moon is capable of severely punishing defensive answers to it, which is worth the risk of trapping itself.

  • Dragon Dance: If trapping a very passive foe such as Hippowdon, Roaring Moon can threaten to get to +6, slicing through teams like a hot knife through butter!

  • Substitute: Substitute works great with Toxic Spikes support, giving Roaring Moon a means to rack up Toxic damage.

  • Earthquake: This prevents Roaring Moon from being walled by Kingambit.

  • U-turn: U-turn gives Roaring Moon a way to switch out of bad Jaw Lock matchups, reducing its risk greatly without using up an item slot.

Other Options

  • Acrobatics: If using Booster Energy and Tera Flying, Acrobatics is far more powerful than Jaw Lock, punishing Annihilape and Great Tusk in particular.

Tera Types

  • Poison: In addition to providing a vital resistance to Fairy- and Fighting-type attacks, Tera Poison lets Roaring Moon freely switch into Toxic, which would ruin this set otherwise.

  • Fairy: Taking on Dragon- and Fighting-type attacks makes Fairy a reliable Tera type.

  • Flying: Tera Flying grants Roaring Moon safety from Garganacl and Dondozo's Fissure and pairs nicely with Acrobatics.

  • Don't Use Ghost: Tera Ghost is tempting to allow Roaring Moon to switch out of Jaw Lock, but be warned: you must Terastallize only on the turn after using Jaw Lock, because otherwise, the trapping effect will fail to activate if using Jaw Lock as a Ghost-type!

Items

  • Leftovers: If using Dragon Dance, the residual recovery makes setting up multiple Dragon Dances much easier.

  • Shed Shell: Shed Shell lets Roaring Moon switch out of Jaw Lock, massively reducing the risk.

  • Booster Energy: This turns Tera Flying Acrobatics into a powerful form of offense.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Making Roaring Moon immune to Toxic Spikes gives it much more flexibility against stall teams with Toxic Spike setters such as Clodsire and Toxapex.

  • Protective Pads: Protective Pads will guard Roaring Moon against Volcarona's Flame Body and Rocky Helmet for otherwise good trapping targets such as Dondozo and Clodsire.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 196 Def / 36 SpD / 28 Spe with Impish: This EV spread outspeeds Dragapult after one Dragon Dance, avoids a 2HKO from Iron Bundle if Roaring Moon is Terastallized, and avoids a 2HKO from an unboosted Dragonite Tera Normal Extreme Speed.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 20 Def / 204 SpD / 28 Spe with Careful: This spread gets a Special Defense boost from Protosynthesis while still outspeeding Dragapult after one Dragon Dance.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: While much less bulky than the other spreads, maximum Speed ensures Roaring Moon outspeeds Iron Valiant, Scream Tail, and Dragon Dance Tyranitar. The former two can ruin Roaring Moon with Encore.

All-Out Attacker.description:
• With great offenses and U-turn, Roaring Moon is a good and unexpected choice for pivoting.

  • Throat Chop versus Jaw Lock: Shutting down troublesome sound moves such as Torch Song and Bug Buzz make Throat Chop the superior choice over Crunch. If using Assault Vest, Jaw Lock's trapping capabilities come in handy, especially with U-turn reducing its risk.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head is good coverage against Tera Fairy-types with Levitate such as Rotom-W and Hydreigon.

  • Outrage: Outrage is a risky move, but it excels at cleaning teams in the late game.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Roaring Moon a good matchup against Fairy types with Iron Head, and the Stealth Rock resistances lets it pivot out with less consequences.

  • Fire: Tera Fire's Stealth Rock weakness is a bit problematic with U-turn, but has great offensive and defensive synergy, letting Roaring Moon take Fairy-type attacks, and roast Scizor and Air Balloon Tinkaton with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy not only absorbs Dragon-type attacks, but it also massively improves Roaring Moon's matchups against strong Fighting-types such as Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and Annihilape via Tera Blast.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: A Choice Scarf in wing will let Roaring Moon outpace some of its common revenge killers, such as Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Dragapult.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band gives Roaring Moon incredible wallbreaking power, now being able to 2HKO Skeledirge and Dondozo with Outrage.

  • Assault Vest: Roaring Moon makes for a great bulky using of Assault Vest, being able to easily take on Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane when Terastallized into the correct type.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: The old-school offensive spread gives Roaring Moon an Attack boost from Protosynthesis.

  • 220 Atk / 36 Def / 252 Spe: This spread gives Roaring Moon a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, which can be useful if running Choice Band on a sun team.

Iron Valiant.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Physical Attacker.description:
• Iron Valiant's blistering Speed and the threat of Destiny Bond make it a cybernetic assassin that's excellent at taking foes down with it!

  • Shadow Sneak: Shadow Sneak is Iron Valiant's best tool against Flutter Mane and is useful for picking off Focus Sash foes such as Iron Bundle.

  • Encore: Encore plugs in perfectly with Destiny Bond, punishing foes that use support moves to avoid getting taken down with Iron Valiant.

  • Moonblast versus Spirit Break: Even without investment, Moonblast will often deal more damage to foes with even defenses or lower Special Defense such as Garchomp and Wo-Chien, and avoid Rocky Helmet damage. However, Spirit Break's Special Attack drops give Iron Valiant a chance to help teammates set up after it gets KOed, and it will still put Terastallized offensive Flutter Mane into Shadow Sneak's KO range.

  • Knock Off: This is Iron Valiant's only way to 2HKO offensive Gholdengo, and removing items gives it a good support niche.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Since this Iron Valiant often uses Destiny Bond, Terastallization isn't very important for it, thought the surprise value still makes it viable in certain matches.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost lets Iron Valiant safely Encore Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Fighting: An extra powerful Close Combat gives Iron Valiant better late-game cleaning potential.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Getting around Iron Valiant's aluminum-thin bulk gives it the potential to take down multiple Pokemon.

  • Booster Energy: Getting a one-time Speed boost trades Iron Valiant's great early-game potential for excellent revenge killing potential.

Alternate EV Spread

  • 12 HP / 228 Atk / 84 Def / 36 SpAtk / 148 Spe with Naive: This Focus Sash EV spread gives Iron Valiant a very high chance of surviving Adamant Baxcalibur's five-hit Icicle Spear and likely OHKOing it back with Close Combat. The Special Attack investment 2HKOs maximum HP Dragonite through Multiscale while the Speed investment outspeeds up to Garchomp.

Special Destiny Bond.description:
• Iron Valiant's high Special Attack and Destiny Bond make it a highly unpredictable threat that can surprise its more physically defensive checks, such as Dondozo.

  • Encore: This will give any foe attempting to use support moves to escape Destiny Bond a nasty shock.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball 2HKOes Skeledirge and will often 2HKO defensive Gholedngo, both of whom are common issues for the physical variant of this set.

  • Shadow Sneak: While weak enough to be unable to 2HKO bulkier Flutter Mane, Shadow Sneak is still a great choice for picking off Focus Sash foes such as Great Tusk and Iron Bundle.

  • Close Combat versus Aura Sphere: Even without physical investment, Close Combat is generally the stronger move, and it ensures Blissey and Chansey will not wall Iron Valiant without Terastallization. However, Aura Sphere does hit many physically defensive foes such as Corviknight harder, and it gets around Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This set's focus on Destiny Bond makes Terastallization a waste fairly often, but it can make sense in more late-game contexts.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost gives Iron Valiant an opening to Encore Extreme Speed Dragonite and gives Shadow Sneak a more acceptable amount of power.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's boost to Moonblast potentially gains a 2HKO on Dondozo and Terastallized Skeledirge.

  • Steel: With Tera Steel, Iron Valiant gains a useful resistance to Bullet Punch and Ice Shard, making Booster Energy variants harder to revenge kill.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is particularly useful for letting Iron Valiant surprise Skeledirge, who normally OHKOes with a +1 Torch Song.

  • Booster Energy: While unlikely to enable a sweep unless it's late-game, this consumable Speed boost transforms Iron Valiant into an effective revenge killer.

Mixed Attacker.description:
• Iron Valiant's excellent special movepool gives it an effective wallbreaking mode that can catch foes such as Skeledirge and Dondozo by surprise.

  • Encore: Encore is perfect for punishing attempts to set up on Iron Valiant.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball is handy for 2HKOing Skeledirge before it Terastallizes, as it's normally a great Iron Valiant check.

  • Thunderbolt: This programs Iron Valiant to 2HKO Corviknight and physically defensive Dondozo with Life Orb.

  • Psyshock versus Psychic: Psyshock deals massive damage to Iron Moth and Clodsire, who are otherwise big problems. Psychic on the other hand, is preferred if Amoonguss is a serious problem due to being able to consistently 2HKO physically defensive vairants.

Other Options

  • Calm Mind: Calm Mind makes Iron Valiant even more difficult to wall, but it's very difficult to set up without Focus Sash or Encore.

  • Aura Sphere: Close Combat's higher power is usually preferred, but Aura Sphere does better against Corviknight and makes Iron Valiant less vulnerable to priority attacks.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Iron Valiant can do plenty of damage without Terastallization, but resisting important priority Attacks or boosting its power certainly makes it useful.

  • Ghost: With Tera Ghost, Life Orb Shadow Ball OHKOes physically defensive Skeledirge, in addition to giving Iron Valiant an important immunity to Extreme Speed.

  • Fairy: Powering up Moonblast with Tera Fairy can 2HKO even specially defensive Dondozo.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has fantastic defensive synergy, giving useful resistances to Scizor's Bullet Punch, Chien-Pao's Ice Shard, and Flying- and Fairy-type attacks.

  • Electric: Tera Electric means Iron Valiant no longer needs Life Orb to reliably 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo without Life Orb, in addition to giving a vital resistance to Scizor's Bullet Punch.

Items

  • Life Orb: While the recoil makes Iron Valiant even more vulnerable to priority attacks, it provides immense wallbreaking power.

  • Booster Energy: Taking advantage of Quark Drive trades easy wallbreaking in exchange for incredible revenge killing power and late-game sweeping.

Swords Dance.description:
• While tricky to set up without support, Swords Dance Iron Valiant is a niche but dangerous sweeper that requires dedicated defensive Pokemon such as Skeledirge and Dondozo to easily check.

  • Encore: Encore lets Iron Valiant short-circuit support moves and have a shot of setting up Swords Dance, but this does come at the cost of one of its STAB moves.

  • Close Combat versus Spirit Break: If giving up a slot for Encore, Close Combat's high power against bulky foes such as Kingambit, Ting-Lu, Corviknight, and bulky Chi-Yu makes it the easy option. Spirit Break's low Base Power reduces Iron Valiant's general sweeping potential in exchange for dealing big damage to common Tera Fairy Pokemon such as Rotom-W and Garchomp.

  • Shadow Sneak versus Knock Off: With a boost, Shadow Sneak is capable of ruining Flutter Mane's attempt to revenge kill, but Knock Off lets Iron Valiant deal with Gholdengo, hit Volcarona and Iron Moth hard, and punish Skeledirge switch ins.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: While this set isn't reliant on Terastallization, it does make late-game sweeping a much more feasible task for Iron Valiant, making it less vulnerable to priority attacks that can ruin its sweeping potential.

  • Ghost: Powering up Shadow Sneak can make cleaning easier and the Extreme Speed immunity can turn Extreme Speed Dragonite into setup bait with Encore.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has excellent defensive synergy, giving Iron Valiant an important Bullet Punch and Ice Shard resistance and covering Flying- and Fairy-type attacks.

  • Fairy / Fighting: Terastallizing into one of Iron Valiant's STAB types can make cleaning through bulky foes easier if dropping coverage for Encore.

  • Fire: In addition to a useful Bullet Punch resistance, Tera Fire gifts Iron Valiant a burn immunity and can even be used with Tera Blast to break defensive Gholdengo and Corviknight.

  • Electric: Not only does this help Iron Valiant against Scizor, but Tera Electric can be paired with Life Orb and Tera Blast to wear down Dondozo.

Items

  • Focus Sash: If not using Encore, this is the most reliable way to get Swords Dance set up.

  • Booster Energy: Quark Drive's Speed boost makes it far more difficult to revenge kill Iron Valiant, outpacing key threats such as Dragapult, Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Iron Valiant more effective at hit-and-run tactics and can let it OHKO bulky threats such as Corviknight after a boost and Stealth Rock damage.

Bulk Up.description:
EV Spreads

  • 100 Speed EVs: This Speed investment outspeeds Jolly Ursaluna.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Ogerpon-W's great support movepool and Embody Aspect's Special Defense boost give it the opportunity to face premier special attackers such as Flutter Mane, Ursaluna-B, and Gholdengo head on.

  • Horn Leech: Horn Leech's recovery can help maintain Ogerpon-W's defensive profile without compromising its offenses.

  • Substitute: Substitute has great synergy alongside Ogerpon-W's other support moves, especially Leech Seed. It's also useful for blocking Toxic from Gliscor, which coupled with Ogerpon-W's Ground resistance allows it to heavily disrupt Gliscor's attempts to cripple foes.

  • Leech Seed: Due to being forced to run Wellspring Mask, Ogerpon-W misses passive recovery from items such as Leftovers, making Leech Seed a solid option for recovery alongside Synthesis.

  • Encore: Locking targets into an undesirable move can discourage setup attempts and passive play and allow opportunities for healing.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 4 Def / 188 SpD / 60 Spe with Careful: This spread aims to maximize Ogerpon-W's special bulk, and it outspeeds positive nature base 70 Speed foes such as Jolly Breloom and neutral nature base 85 Speed foes such as Rillaboom.

Embody Aspect

Ogerpon-W is locked into a Water Tera type. When it Terastallizes, Water Absorb becomes Embody Aspect. This forme's Embody Aspect boosts Special Defense, making it essentially like an Assault Vest without the downsides, which can be key to taking strong hits such as those from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane and Tera Normal Ursaluna-B.

Ogerpon-Hearthflame.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

ALL STAR.description:
• With its great offensive presence and incredible ability in Mold Breaker, Ogerpon-H is one of the premier threats in Regulation F.

  • Ivy Cudgel: Ivy Cudgel offers a consistent STAB move with an elevated critical hit rate, allowing Ogerpon-H to power through even foes that resist Fire.

  • Horn Leech VS. Trailblaze: Horn Leech provides a consistent Grass-type STAB move and a form of healing to assist in longevity; however, Trailblaze’s Speed boost can allow Ogerpon-H to take over games on the spot if given the chance.

  • Play Rough VS. Rock Tomb: Play Rough is good coverage for foes such as Dragonite and the Urshifu formes, as well as Pokemon that might try to use Tera Dragon to resist Ogerpon-H’s STAB combination. Rock Tomb doesn't hit as many Dragon-types, but in exchange offers speed control and is Ogerpon-H's best attack against Fire-types like Entei and Incineroar.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance boosts Ogerpon-H’s Attack to frightening levels, and thanks to Mold Breaker, it cannot be ignored by the likes of Unaware Dondozo.

  • Quick Attack: While difficult to run without giving up Swords Dance, Quick Attack is great for cleaning up late game with Embody Aspect.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: Knock Off provides team support with its item removal, removing pesky items like Porygon2's Eviolite and the rare Skeledirge's Ability Shield. It's coverage isn't as good as the other options though.

  • Encore: Ogerpon-H’s good Speed allows it to make decent use of encore to lock foes into utility moves, providing itself or its teammates turns to set up.

  • Substitute: Substitute when paired with Swords Dance is a huge help against Dragon Tail Archaludon, though this will come at the cost of coverage.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 100 Atk / 92 Def / 60 Spe with Adamant: This spread outspeeds Iron Bundle after Trailblaze while avoiding a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch; however, it will no longer outspeed Urshifu.

Tera Types

The Hearthflame Mask grants Ogerpon-H a Fire Tera type. When Ogerpon-H Terastallizes, it is given a new ability, Embody Aspect, Which boosts Ogerpon-H’s attack. However, it will no longer have access to Mold Breaker.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spreads: This Ogerpon-H has plenty of room for EV customization, here are two examples.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 60 Def / 36 SpD / 156 Spe: This spread lets Ogerpon-H outspeed Adamant Urshifu-R and Timid Gholdengo, while surviving Choice Scarf Adamant Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes. The Special Defense investment gives Ogerpon-H a high chance of surviving Blood Moon + Vacuum Wave from Assault Vest Ursaluna-B.
